To earn the most points as you try to be first to build a 3-by-3 grid showing only Heroes and Batmobiles. How? Match the colored edges on the cards. Easy...until the bad guys show up! When they do, you must cover them up with a Hero, because you can't finish your grid until every Villain is buried!

(from the rules)
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Radio Collector Card Game
description: Players try to get radio programs for their station and then find sponsors and cast members. It's based on real old time radio programs and includes photos from the real cast.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Giftschrank
description:
Translated from the publisher's site:
"Der Giftschrank" (poison cabinet) is a strategic game that is full of suspense right from the start - running into the third dimension it requires planning skills and the ability to keep a level head and to make the right decision even in complex situations.

name: Treasure Island
description:
Treasure Island is an exciting game for two players. It is based on Robert Louis Stevenson's famous book Treasure Island. The object of the game is for each player to travel by land and sea from England to Treasure Island and to accumulate the most shares of the buried treasure (pieces of eight) in competition with the other players during the game.

Contents:

- Two wooden tokens, one for each player, for traveling from Benbow Inn (starting point) to Bristol (sailing point) and to travel to the main treasure are of the island.

- 1 ship which is used by both players to cross the ocean; it being steered by the magic wheel.

- Two magnetic compasses (one for each player) for treasure hunting on the island.

- 9 pieces of eight are used to keep score; 1 worth 50,000 shares, 2 worth 20,000 shares each and 6 worth 10,000 each.

- Captain Flint's manuscript for playing Treasure Island.

- 1 game board.

name: Fascination Pool
description: The board is a miniature pool table with a maze built onto the surface. The object of the game is to get the six colored balls in the six pockets of matching colors (green ball into green pocket - yellow ball into yellow pocket and so on). The game includes a triangle to place on the colored triangle in the center of the table. The six balls are placed into the triangle. The rack is removed and the table is picked up so that it can be tilted. One point is scored for each ball that goes into a matching colored pocket. The first player who scores twenty-four points is the winner.

name: The Legend of Merlin's Magic
description:
Game with an optional 3-D staircase component. Players move to rescue King Arthur from the dungeon, where he is in one of four cells. The other three cells contain monsters, which may be defeated with matching colored potions collected from the castle above.

From Publisher:

Players avoid the Black Knight and make evil monsters vanish as they appear from behind cell doors. The true Merlin is found when a player is the first to rescue King Arthur from the dungeon.

A great first game for girls and boys - no reading required!

2-4 Players, Ages 4 - 11

Contents:
1 Game Board
1 Cardboard Stone Staircase
6 Magic Potions
3 Creature pieces
1 King Arthur piece
4 Merlin Playing pieces with stands
(presumably one 6 sided die also)
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sextett
description:
Sextett is a collection of 6 abstract strategy games packaged in one box. According to the rules none of these games had been published before, although in fact at least a few are traditional games. Ravensburger catalog #12.026

The game box includes several sets of multi colored pawns used in all games and 3 double sided hard playing boards.

The games included are:

Quicki - a dice rolling race game where players move around an abstract grid of points trying to reach their colored places in the board center, players can be sent back to their starting places by other players choosing to land on their current position.

Ponte - from the translated rulebook: The object of the game is to reach the island by crossing streets and bridges with one figure as fast as possible and then build a tower and reach it by jumps.

The Magic Star - The object of the game is to try to move clockwise around the star on the outer or inner path beginning from the starting point. The player who manages to get all of his game figures into his own star corner first wins the game. A blockade figure constantly changes the aspect of the game.

Piggy Back - The object of the game is to get all the figures across the board first, whereby the players are forced at times to carry the opponent's figures "piggy-back" across the board or even to be carried in the same way themselves in order to reach their destination. The point of the game is to try to take advantage of the piggy back rule whenever possible.

Fox Jumping - A gathering of foxes (2 or 4 fox families make 40 foxes) is disturbed by a hunting party. Hastily each fox tried to hide in one of the 39 neighboring dens. But since there is room for one fox in each den, the slowest fox loses the race.

Surakarta - This game originated in Indonesia. It bears the name of the old time-honored city of Surakarta on the island of Middle Java. The game is played on a grid of points with all points on the outer edge connected by a curved line that leads back to another board edge. The idea is to move your pawns around the grid trying to get to a curved line that can be used to move to another side of the board and more importantly eliminate your opponents pawn. The game is played actively in Indonesia by drawing lines in the ground and playing with pebbles.

name: eMemo: Art & Architecture
description: eMemo memory matching games are fascinating and educational memory-challenging games that explore the world. eMemo games stimulate and enhance the memory while teaching about Geography, Architecture, Design and History. The theme of all eMemo games is that they play similarly to a traditional memory game, except that instead of matching two identical images, eMemo requires players to match a photo with a zoomed-in section of that same photo.

name: Crazy Ates
description:
From the publisher:

"Tacos, spaghetti, and steak with ice cream. Lay down cards that match either the tasty foods or cool colors. No matching card? Play a wild crazy #8 and name a new color! With a bit of strategy and a pinch of luck, the first player to get rid of their cards wins!"

A SimplyFun version of the card game "Crazy Eights," using "oversized cards with engaging artwork" depicting various foods (instead of standard card suits). "Ideal for play dates and parties."

name: Asalto al Poder
description: Asalto al Poder is a tactical game for two players or teams who fight for the control of the capital city in a hypothetical state during a "Coup d'Etat". One of them controls the loyalist, the other the revolutionary forces. Combat is the last opcion, players try to atract the other's player counters to its side and win strategic locations.

name: Bible Eights
description: Bible Eights is a Crazy Eights variant which uses Bible characters.

name: Twin Scribbage
description:
Essentially 2 sets of Scribbage aka Ad-lib Crossword Cubes packaged together, but with new rules.

The 2 sets of cubes are colored differently.

name: Pelotón
description:
From the publisher (edited):

"Pelotón is a mixture between RPGs and wargames created by Julián García. Pelotón tries to represent combat during the whole 20th century... it's possible to play in WW I, WW II, Korea, Vietnam, Afghanistan, Ex-Yugoslavia, or even to simulate anti-terrorist actions.

The number of soldiers that the players take is approximately 10 (a squad), each of which is represented by a figure (scale 1/72 or 20mm) and has a card describing its qualities.

Pelotón can be played as miniatures rules, or as an aid to RPGs in those combat situations in which the excessive number of prominent figures makes the action slow."
categories: Korean War, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Gang Way for Fun
description: This game was based on the TV show "Broadside" from the creator of "McHale's Navy". The show lasted only one year, and the board game was even shorter-lived than that.

name: Go-Spel
description: A family game that is described by the publisher as a "mix of Scrabble and Crosswords". The game has letter tiles like Scrabble with which players try to spell words. Double points are awarded if the word is a proper noun from the New Testament. A list of New Testament proper nouns is included in the game.

name: Trade Winds: The Merchant Marine Game
description:
Not to be confused with the 1960 Parker Brothers game with 17th-century Pirates (also called Trade Winds), this older game is set in the year it was published, 1943.

---From the publisher's brochure:---

A game of ships and men and the cargoes carried between U.S. and Latin American ports. Each player is a trader in imports and exports, and his success or failure is measured by the profit or loss resulting from his transactions.

---end brochure quote---

The center of the board shows a map of Central and South America, while around the edge are the spaces you move on. There are two card decks: one shows the countries you can visit, and the other shows dollar figures, both for buying and selling. When leaving the USA, you pick a card to see where you're bound and another card to see what your cargo cost you (red number). You roll 1d6 per turn until you arrive at your destination, then draw another dollar card to see what you get for selling your cargo (red number, which are usually higher). You repeat this process for going home, except you roll 2d6 for movement on the way home (7s means you lose your turn). Game ends when a player has made five complete round trips - whoever made the most money wins.

name: Round-A-Bout
description:
From the Box,

" In fast-paced rounds of twists and turns, you force your opponent to score MORE while you score LESS. "

" Play your cards right to turn the rotating penalty pointer 'round and 'round. It could be a wheel of mis-fortune for your opponents. "

" But watch out ! Don't let the pointer stop on your turn !
If it does, you're stuck with the penalty points !
One way out is to play a special "wild" card.
Can you do it ?
If you can, you have turned the tables on your opponent !
End the game with the lowest total score and you're the winner. "

" It takes a lot of strategy and a little luck to do a turnabout in ROUND-A-BOUT. Are you ready to take a turn ? "

name: Idrottsspelet
description:
Idrottsspelet (`The Sports Game´) is actually limited to track-and-field. Players roll the dice and hope for good results in running, long jump, high jump, putting the shot, triple jump and pole-vault. In the running events, players roll the dice and move their pieces along the track. In the jumping events there is some decision-making and push-your-luck involved, as players must decide when to jump. They move their pieces according to the die-roll and will have to decide if they are happy with the result or would like to roll once more, of course risking an illegal jump.

Players may either just play to win, or they may wish to know their actual results in meters and seconds. In the latter case, there are some results tables in the rulebook that can be used. The current WRs, as of 2003, are also noted. Only men´s results are included, and all playing pieces depict men.

Contents:

1 gameboard
20 cardboard flat figures w/ metal stands
2 dice
1 rules folder (in Swedish)

name: Denk mal
description: Denk mal is Mastermind turned into a word game. Each of the two players chooses a word and notes some clues about the word on his pegboard. Then the pegboards are exchanged and every player tries to come up with the word of the other player. Whoever guesses the word of the opponent first wins the round.

name: Axis of Evil 2007
description:
From the website:

"Angered by continued American influence around the world, Russia, China, and the newly formed International Islamic Alliance ally themselves together to become the next superpowers of the world. There is only one way for them to bring their nations to the status of greatness: WAR! Once again the United States and the European Union stand together to defend liberty and freedom from the new Axis of Evil, but will it be enough? From Aegis destroyers to Chemical SCUDs and from Close Air Support to Nuclear Weapons, the world is at war with the most destructive modern weapons any nation has possessed."

For this, you'll be provided with the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc., while you will utilize the components from Axis & Allies or related games.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: World War III: 1988
description:
From the website:

"With a brief but deadly skirmish between NATO and Warsaw Pact forces on the border of Germany quickly expanding, Soviet generals see their chance to bring war to NATO forces and destroy the alliance once and for all and bring all of Europe under the Soviet flag. With approximately 20,000 Soviet-made tanks in Europe and over 1 million men under arms moving into the Fulda gap and other choke points along West Germany, NATO may be in for the fight of its very existence as each nation involved as both hunter and prey. Based on the first three novels of the series, WW III by Ian Slater."

For this, you'll be provided with the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc., while you will utilize the components from Axis & Allies or related games.
categories: Modern Warfare, Novel-based, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: World War III: Arctic Front – 1989
description:
From the website:

"World War III is over. Or is it? Moscow has surrendered, but Siberia defies the cease-fire, and General Freeman must eliminate the threat of nuclear warfare and launch a bloody ground assault through the frozen Siberian tundra. However, the icy waters of Lake Baikal conceal a deadly weapon that will determine the fate of millions. In addition, Siberia has enlisted the aid of China to hit the American-led UN force in a deadly suprise attack. Based on the 4th and 5th novels, WW III: Arctic Front and WW III: Warshot, of the WW III saga by Ian Slater."

For this, you'll be provided with the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc., while you will utilize the components from Axis & Allies or related games.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Nacht der Diebe
description:
(from the back of the box)

During the day, Kashmar is a peaceful town. Trading is prospering. The numerous pubs are packed. On the streets, live is pulsating. The inhabitants are wealthy and content. But when daylight is replaced by the dark of the night, the "night of the thieves" has started.

"Night of the thieves" is a fast and exciting game full of surprises. Each player is the master of a guild of thieves and sends his fellow thieves to rob the most valuable treasures in the city. Good planning and a little luck are necessary to be successful. The biggest treasures go the master of the guild that can trust his instincts...

Contents:

1 rulebook
24 dice
6 location cards
66 playing cards
150 playing pieces (wooden discs)

Playing time: 2 - 3 hours
Number of players: 3 - 6
Age: from 12

Tactics: 3 (on a scale from 1 to 6)
Entertainment: 6 (on a scale from 1 to 6)
Interaction: 5 (on a scale from 1 to 6)

name: PanGaea
description:
The game's tag line is "A Game With A Past!"

In the game, players move around Pangaea, collecting Destination Cards, Dino Dollars and discs. The goal is to be the player with the most Dino Dollars at the end of the game, which happens when one player collects eleven Destiny Cards and returns to the start/finish square.

However, it's not as easy as it sounds, as randomly-drawn Destiny Cards can affect gameplay.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Grandchampionship Martial Arts Hall of Fame
description:
Four areas of the oldest art test their abilities against one another. To win, you must successfully complete each.

Are you the next master? It’s time to test your skills and compete.

name: Geriatric Wars
description:
From the publisher:

Dateline: 1990
New progress in medical science assures most people in the U.S. of living well into their second century.

Dateline: 1994
The Social Security Data and Distribution System, (SSDDS), over-worked and long antiquated, finally collapses due to the destruction of the agency's central records center by fire. The single surviving data bank yields the addresses, but no names of a mere 125,000 social security recipients.

The announcement of four to six months without any benefits sends thousands of protesting old folks to Washington. During the resulting riot, the director of the SSDDS is murdered by an enraged mob. In a last-ditch, desperate effort to save his skin, the new director authorizes the last 100,000 checks, labeled "occupant", to be mailed to the addresses listed in the sole surviving data bank. It was unfortunate that no official could have foreseen the wholesale slaughter of our elderly population for a few fortunate ones to cash a handful of checks. The "Pension Battles" had begun. This black page of American History was later known as the "GERIATRIC WARS"...

Geriatric Wars is a game of tactical combat between two or more senior citizens. The object of the game is to secure the check by outdistancing or quickly eliminating your opponent. The game ends when the check is signed and mailed to the local bank, or there is only one player left.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Lose a Turn, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Race, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up
publishers: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

name: Play Rome
description:
This is an interesting collection of 30 or more games placed in a box with dozens of beautiful printed paper "boards" for playing the numerous games listed in the enclosed book. "Play Rome" seems to be made in conjunction of the "Department for the Promotion of Culture, Theater, Tourism and Sport" of Rome. The many printed boards are quite beautiful and the games run from being very simple to being very complex. The description on the box reads,

"These games may help you to discover your own personal Rome. They will not only lead you far and wide through the city but also through the centuries starting from a small village of some dozens of huts up to our days."
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Maze, Memory, Puzzle

name: Up To My @*! In Alligators
description:
Components: 5 specially printed dice with alligators on them. A score pad.

Each die has alligators on each side, with values:
1 (twice)
2
3
4
"@*!"

Players take turns to roll all five dice:

no matching gators = add the numbers on each gator
any pair = 10 plus the points on the other gators
two pairs = 15 plus the points on the other gators
three of a kind = 25 points plus the points on the other gators
four of a kind = 50 points plus the points on the other gator.
full swamp = 100 points
five of a kind = 200 points
five "@*!" = Automatic Win!

Players may roll (all) the dice as many times as they wish and may stop at any point, scoring for the last roll only. If two or more "@*!" sides show up the player scores 0 and his turn ends.

First player to 1000 points (suggested) is the winner.

name: Club-House Golf
description:
Ad copy:

If You Love Golf...
You'll Love Club-House Golf.

A new fun golf card game that plays like real golf
and incorporates strategy, risks and rewards.

Complete with water hazards and out of bounds, every hole is a challenge that combines skill and the luck of the draw, giving all players an equal chance of winning.

The hole's par determines how many cards are dealt each player, and the hole's handicap determines the wild card.

Play begins by dealing three cards on par 3's, four cards on par 4's, and five cards on par 5's. The wild card is worth 0 and the value of other cards varies from 1 to 20.

The goal is to have the lowest score on each hole. Four players can play a round in under two hours

A superb gift for the golfing enthusiast and a great game for the entire family.
Includes scorecards, pencils, cards, a scoring ball
all in a smart decorative tin box.

name: Math Whiz
description:
Math Whiz is an educational and entertaining math quiz game for ages 12 and up. The game can be played by up to six persons or by up to six teams of two or more persons per team.

You don't have to be a math whiz to win Math Whiz since it is a game of both chance and skill and is designed in such a way so as to allow a player of lesser math skills a chance to win against a math whiz.

The math questions are keyed to the red, blue, green, yellow and brown spaces and the Triple Bonus circle. Players may use pencil and paper to work out solutions to the 1001 math questions. The player or team who first earns three each of the red, blue, green, and yellow chips is the winner and moves the player token into the Math Whiz circle at the center of the playing board.

name: Get The Picture
description: Get The Picture is a team game in which one team member suggests words or phrases to the other members of the team by drawing or sketching. The faster a team guesses the correct answer, the faster they move around the board. The first team around the board wins. The game includes an electronic sixty-second timer and reusable dry-erase boards.
publishers: Lagod Ventures, Inc., Worlds of Wonder, Inc, WOW Toys, Inc.

name: Le Caméléon
description:
It's a game for two players.
On a 9X8 checkered board they must move their colored pieces (4 blue, 4 yellow and 4 red) to capture their opponent's pieces; but during the game for every enemy piece captured, you have on the board one new piece of a complementary color (orange, green or purple.
From then on what you can capture and with what is decided by a complex color chart. When a complementary color is captured, you can obtain a new black piece (the chameleon)with special rules.

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Tower of Doom
description:
Our Ninja heroes must escape from the "Tower of Doom" and the Giant Samurai Swords penetrating it. When friendly forces (that's you) pull out the swords that trap them, they plummet through the dark depths beneath the city in a race for sewer-vival. Your task: Rescue them as they race from the sewer openings. You get a slice of "Pizza" as a reward for every Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle that you catch in your "Rescue Scoop." Warning! Beware of the Shredder or you won't get any "Pizza!"

Be the first player to complete your Scoring Pizza by rescuing enough Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and you'll win the game.

name: The Ozmopolitan Game
description: This is similar to the old kids' cardgame Animals, with an added Oz theme. Players take turns turning up cards with pictures of characters from the Oz books. When the same picture appears twice in a row, each player tries to be the first to recognize and acknowledge this. The game comes with several other sets of rules, also based on classic games for kids.

name: Skix
description:
Skix is a "6 in 1 multiple board game". All six games share in common the Skix Ball Wheel, a kind of reverse spinner in which a marble is launched and spins around the outside rim of the wheel until it lands in one of the many grooves along the inside "hub" of the wheel.

Each game has a circular paper disk that is placed over the hub in the center of the wheel; the disk gives a value or instruction to each groove on the inside hub. A two-sided gameboard is also included for four of the games.

The six games are as follows:

1) BADLANDS: Be the first to travel from St. Louis to Houston, watching for Indians and bandits.

2) HILL CHAMP: Get to the top of the hill by following a crisscrossing path.

3) SPORTS CAR RACE: Race against your opponents and be the first to cross the finish line.

4) TUG OF WAR: Pull the other team onto your side. Only one marker is used in this game, to determine where the center of the "rope" currently is.

5) SPELL-N-SCORE: This is one of two games that is played with pencil-and-paper, rather than the gameboard. Each player spins for five letters -- each with its own point value -- and attempts to make a word worth as high a score as possible.

6) CARDS (Poker, Black Jack, War): This is the other paper-and-pencil game(s). Shoot the marble to determine which cards are "drawn" for each of these games.

name: County Stadium Pro Baseball Game
description:
This is a simple dice rolling baseball game that is localized to a specific field.

There are 21 possible dice combinations that each have a specific game effect.

For example rolling a:
3 & 4 = Strike out
2 & 5 = Bunt Single
1 & 6 = Error - All runners advance one base

The box art and field art are unique to the featured stadium, in this case the Brewers old County Stadium that existed from 1953–1999.

name: Wild Zone
description:
A card game. To win, have the lowest points, once a player reaches 100 the game ends.
A round ends when one player discards their hand. Remaining card points are now tallied.
Each person gets seven cards. There are blue and wild zone cards. Blue or wild can be played with another blue or wild card if the sum of the cards played and the top card of the discard pile sum to ten.
Players can play out of turn using only wild zone cards, again totaling to ten.
If a play cannot be made, the player must pass and draw one card, only if the top card is wild. A play is now allowed if able. If everyone passes, the top draw card is placed on the discard pile.

name: Bosse Bildoktorn
description:
Swedish game themed on a popular TV-series, Bosse Bildoktorn (`Bosse the Car Doctor´). Very enthusiastic car mechanic teaches the viewers just about everything in Do-It-Yourself. The game is basically roll, move and answer questions on cars, tourism in Sweden, entertainment, etc. Players may also buy motels and garages to make other players pay, Monopoly-style.

Contents:
Board
385 cards with 1925 questions
Some other cards
Players´ pieces
Dice
Motels
Garages
Money
Pencil
Rules

Ages 13 and up. Language: Swedish.

name: Kave Kapers
description: Object of game is to the first spelunker to successfully map a cave. The arrangement of the boards create a different each time you play it. Players must avoid water hazards, rock falls, and low passages.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spellbinding
description:
Spellbinding is a word game where the objective is to successfully identify a scrambled word while in the center space on the board and controlling the dice. The board consists of three concentric circles, divided into spaces, and a large center space.

When a player is in control of the dice, the player to his right is the SPELLBINDER. The SPELLBINDER is the game's arbiter. His duties are as follows: he selects a card from the deck; he scrambles the letters of a word on the card, which is indicated by the board or the second die; he presents that scrambled word; he determines who is the first to correctly identify the word (and whether a tie has taken place). The other players have one minute to identify the word. The first to identify the word gains (or keeps) control of the dice.
If no player correctly identifies the word, play continues to the left.

This process continues until a winner is determined.

name: Egypt to Canaan No.4 The Conquest of Canaan
description:
This is the fourth in a series of 4 games in the Egypt to Canaan Hebron series of bible games published by Good Reading Limited.

Like the other games in the series it is a roll-and-move game and uses a D8 which it calls a 'Pyragon'.

Players race to encircle Jericho seven times to conquer it, capture Ai, capture five kings and move round twelve tribes.

From the rules:
"These exciting games have been carefully planned so as to give a constructive idea of the history of Israel from Bible, from the time of the captivity in Egypt up till the time of the settlement in the land God had promised them."

name: Galaksens Herskere
description:
Tongue in cheek science fiction game, where 2-5 players battle for rulership of the galaxy.
Each player start out with control of one planet, and then proceed to conquer planets either from the other players or from neutral territories.
You spend your income to buy factories, anti-missile systems and other planetary defenses, or you could spend it all on troops! A chit drawing system is used for troop acquisition, and the troops vary in types from rabbits to space pigs and other silliness.

name: Fetch!
description:
Fetch! is a trivia board game for dog lovers. Players advance along the trail loop by correctly answering questions on a wide variety of dog topics. Knowledge, guesswork & luck combine to allow one player or team to complete the trail loop & arrive home first to become Top Dog!

For 2 to 6 Players or Team, Teens & up

name: The Snoopy Game
description:
The object of the game is to be deliver three dog food bowls to Snoopy. Players may start their character on either of two start spaces. In turn, players advance according to the roll of the die. When passing over a deck of chance cards, the player must examine to the top card to determine whether the player may continue and the direction player must move. If the card is a dog food bowl, the player keeps it. Players may take dog food bowls from each other by landing on one another by exact count.

This children's game features a set of cards with instructions and character likenesses, 5 plastic figures: Snoopy with Doghouse , Charlie Brown , Peppermint Patty , Lucy and Linus and a d6 movement die with paw prints for pips.

name: Zoom Out!
description:
Players take turns playing their cards in an effort to be the first to run out of cards. In addition to wild cards, Zoom cards allow players to play out of turn if they have the correct card. Whoever wins one hand of play creates a new rule to affect all future games. In this way, later games can contain many complex rules.

This game is inspired by the "Zoom" television series.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Baby Trivia Game
description:
From the game box: What do you know about having babies?

Here's an easy, fun way to break the ice at any baby shower and test your knowledge of babies, booties, blankies, and bottles.

name: Fraggle Rock Doozer Construction Game
description: The object of this English Fraggle Rock game is to be the first player or team to complete their construction by reaching the solid yellow square between the red arrows. The game consists of a 15 by 15 inch game board, 170 Doozer Building Cards, 1 dice and dice cup and 21 directions cards. The illustrations on the box, board and directions cards are very nice and are done by an artist that did other Fraggle items such as the UK Fraggle Rock annuals.

name: Thomas the Tank Engine & Friends: Cargo Fun!
description: Each player chooses to be one of the engines on the island of Sodor: Thomas (blue), Percy (green), James (red), and Duncan (yellow). Each train starts in the roundhouse in the center of the board, loaded up with four pegs of their color. On a player's turn, he rolls the die, which will direct him to the next blue, green, red or yellow section of track. When a player lands in a corner section of track (all colored blue), the player can unload one of their pegs if there is not already a color of their peg in that corner. The first player to unload all of their pegs and return to the roundhouse is the winner!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Racing, Trains

name: Powerblock
description:
Each player has seven pieces of three types and tries to "checkmate" the opponent's powerblock piece.
Geodesics can move one space; continuums, two; and powerblocks, three. The spaces are all triangles.

name: Movie Maker
description: In Movie Maker, players take on the role of film producers. Will you make the next hit that will rake in the cash at the box office…? What will be the 'hot' theme next? Love story, SciFi, Western, or maybe Adventure, Horror or Children’s Movies? And when the moment of truth arrives and all producers present their films to the public, much laughter and enjoyment are ensured. Movie Maker is a story-based card game with no preset game duration.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sport-Fest
description: With Sportfest, the goal is speed. Compete for your nation in various sporting disciplines. Split your strengths up carefully. But overall, speed is of the essence in this competition for medals.

name: Kopf und Hut
description:
The game consists of 44 cards, 22 showing a head and 22 a hat belonging to the head.
The 22 pairs can form 11 couples, as there are a man and his wife (or a woman and her husband, if you like...)depicted on the cards (racing drivers, soldiers, cowboys, chinese, sailors etc.).
Every player gets a certain number of cards and tries to melt head and hat, and, if he's lucky enough, to melt the couple too.
This is done by picking up a card and discard. You can do that from the open discard pile or from the concealed reserve pile.
When the piles have been used up, you have to pass a card from your hand to your neíghbour. If he can form a pair, he is suspended from passing a card, next player in line has to proceed.
Game ends when all the pairs have been formed, every pair counting 1 point, every couple 5 points.

A light little family card game. The original Rudi Hoffmann graphics drawn by the maestro himself add to the atmosphere of the game.

name: Fleet Attack
description:
This is a quick-playing abstract fleet science fiction fleet combat game. Each ship (or fighter squadron) is represented by a card, which details attack strength, shields, armor, mass, etc. Each ship is deployed in one of 3 ranks (with rank 1 being the closest to the enemy). Ships with a given total mass can protect a ship whose mass is less than theirs making that ship harder to hit.

The game system is downloadable (PDF) and includes the rules, board and cards. There are a number of optional weapon systems so that custom designed ships can be developed to fit a particular sci-fi genre.

From the publisher's Web site:

Each player has a control sheet which has 3 rows on it (Ranks) each rank also has a protected area.

Each ship is placed in a rank 1, 2 or 3 dependant on the setup conditions of the scenario.

Each turn the players roll for initiative ( for their side not individual ships), and then alternate activating ships. Activation consists of moving (if you want to) and firing (again if you want to), you can fire and move or move and fire.

Firing procedure is very easy and is based on the ranks you and your target are in (add them +1 if the target is protected) + bonuses for special abilities. You declare how much damage you wish to do and roll to hit , the defender applies defenses and marks any remaining damage.

Once all ships have been activated (or all players defer twice consecutively) the turn is finished and any end of turn effects are applied. Then a new turn starts....

name: Dirty Devil
description: The object of the game is to earn the dubious title of 'Dirty Devil' by collecting the most cherub cards. There are four piles of coloured cards. Each player receives an equal number of cherub cards. A player spins the devil’s fork to determine the card category: debauched, dexterous, dramatic or despicable. The card is read out. The fork is spun again to determine the player’s partner/victim. If either victim finds the deed too distasteful they can get out of it by surrendering a cherub card to the other player. Bluffing is the name of the game. A player is out of the game when they lose all of their cherub cards. A game for consenting adults!

name: Children of Many Lands
description: Players start with four puzzle pieces and simultaneously draw from the center and replace one piece at a time until all four pieces go together to form a picture. Then every player grabs for a marker (one less marker than number of players) and everyone that gets a marker scores a point.

name: Prosperity
description:
From the game rules:

"The main objective is to buy properties at auction, improve them and then sell them through estate agents. Doing this should make players a profit - and at the end of the game the most prosperous player is the winner."

Published by Casper Games Ltd, a Bristol [UK] based company - not the same as the other Casper Games.

name: Ratz
description:
R.A.T.Z is a supplement for Injurius Games. The RATZ are a genetically-engineered slave race that earned its freedom in the months directly preceding the rise of Injurius I to the throne of the Empire. Those months were enough for the little guys to spread to nearby systems, and become unkillable - as a race.

Injurius might still have gone to the trouble of wiping them out, for surely there are no more troublesome creatures in the universe than RATZ - but his scientists have told the Emperor that these creatures, though their lives are often shortened by brutality, are effectively immortal. Barring accident, starvation or plague, these creatures don't age once they reach adulthood.

The Emperor decided to use the RATZ as test subjects for his experiments - after all, an immortal Emperor would be a great asset to the Empire. Allowing the creatures to fight in the arena is simply a bonus: any RATZ that are felled in the arena go into the Special Program, and work goes on.

Expands:

Injurius Games
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: King of History
description:
From the official English translation of the game manual:

"The game is based on the history of Goguryeo, Baekje, Silla and Balhae, the four ancient nations in Korean peninsula and Manchuria. This is the time when Korea began to shape its unique cultural traditions, through competition and collaboration with China and Japan.

Each player will select a region and expand the territory to build a nation. The game features many famous historical figures, war heroes, scholars, and great kings. Players will be able to learn Korean history and geography while enjoying the game.

The goal of the game is to expand the territory to build a nations. Player who first earns the winning points wins the game. Points are calculated by adding territory points from the card game and points obtained from the event cards."

The King of History is a combination of a cardgame and a boardgame.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Treadmill
description:
From Rules
Goal: Be the first player to reach Executive Level, have $1 million in cash and securities (stocks, bonds and real estate), and be on a Security Trading Square (STS). You achieve success by buying and selling securities at strategic times as the economy changes and being watchful of other players' positions.

The gameboard has some fixed spaces and some spaces that are holes that allow the middle level to be seen. As the center wheel is turned, the text and actions allowed in the holes change.

The box is particularly large at 22"x22".
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Road Kill
description:
Roadkill is a tabletop miniatures battle game of skirmish battles in a ruined, near-future Earth. It features grim survivors, vile vampires, and gun-toting, motorcycle-riding werewolves.

The game contains a number of pre-built character types, but also includes rules for designing your own characters and vehicles.p>

Roadkill uses the Goalsystem mechanics made popular by West Wind's previous skirmish games, SuperSystem and Chaos In Cairo. A RoadKill battle usually involves two rival gangs of survivors or monsters, numbering between 5-10 models per side.

name: Lighthouse-opoly
description:
LIGHTHOUSE-OPOLY, a fun way for young and old alike to learn about our nation’s lighthouses and the keepers who kept the lights ablaze through dangerous storms, dense fog and darkest night.
In LIGHTHOUSE-OPOLY players buy famous sentinels from coast to coast, acquire keeper’s cottages and trade them in for lighthouses. Sounds easy but add restoration fees and lose a few turns for failed inspections and it becomes a little more difficult and a lot more fun! Each deed back contains fun facts about each lighthouse. Did you know that Michigan’s Old Presque Isle Light is haunted? Even though the lantern room is empty folks swear a light still shines from the tower. Draw another card and you may discover an image of Maine’s Nubble Light is on the spacecraft Voyager. It’s all fun and games until you’re sent to Alcatraz Island locked up till another roll of the dice sets you free. So gather friends and family. Choose your token. Who knows? You may become Head Keeper…or elected president of Boon Island…but you better not let the goat in the garden or it’s a big fine for you!
Pewter tokens include: A Lantern, Captain's Wheel, Ship, Keeper's Cap, Bell, and Buoy
For 2-6 players, ages 8 and up
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Waken The Storm
description:
Currently in the blind testing phase, Waken The Storm uses the game mechanics of Larry Brom's The Sword And The Flame (with modifications) to let gamers play out fantasy battles using miniatures on the tabletop.

The game will include rules for units consisting of various fantasy races, including goblins, orcs, trolls, ogres, dragons, hobbits, elves and dwarves.

The game is expected to be available in winter 2005.

name: I.U.opoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, Graduation Cap

Board Spaces:
Assembly Hall, The Library, Nick's, Mother Bear's Pizza, The Marching Hundred, Kirkwood Avenue, Wright Quad

Cards:
You are part of the winning little 500 team! Take a victory lap around the board.

Recite the Fight Song or Lose One Turn.

Parking in Faculty Parking! Pay $50.

Graduation Fee! Pay $25 for each Year of Credit and $100 for each Diploma.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: U.K.opoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, Graduation Cap

Board Spaces:
Chemistry-Physics Building, Law Building, Rupp Arena, Tolly Ho, UK Marching Band, The Commons, Avenue of Champions

Cards:
Recite the Fight Song or Lose One Turn.

Parking in Faculty Parking! Pay $50.

Graduation Fee! Pay $25 for each Year of Credit and $100 for each Diploma.

Kentucky vs. Louisville, Advance to Rupp Arena. GO CATS!

Too much fun at Two Keys. Lose 2 turns to study.

Little Derby Winner! Collect $100.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: M-Stateopoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, Graduation Cap

Board Spaces:
Chapel of Memories, Lee Hall, Humphrey Coliseum, Cotton District, Malfunction Junction, Oby's, Famous Maroon Band, College of Education

Cards:
Recite the Fight Song or Lose One Turn.

Parking in Faculty Parking! Pay $50.

Graduation Fee! Pay $25 for each Year of Credit and $100 for each Diploma.

M-State vs. Ole Miss. Advance to Scott Field. GO M-STATE!

Super Bulldog Weekend! Advance to the space of your choice.

Dean's List Again! Advance to Walk of Honor and collect a $200 scholarship.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: BristolOpoly
description:
BRISTOLOPOLY is concerned with business trade in Bristol. The object of the game is to accumulate as much wealth as possible through the purchase, trade and development of businesses - the businesses themselves representing actual firms on the Island or town.

It has the following features:

- Businesses to buy, trade and sell.
- A £500 ‘Loan Card’ for each player, ‘Get Out of Jail’ in another game.
- The ability (once you own all the key businesses in a colour group) to expand by building shops and superstores. Though you wouldn’t guess that from the counters!
- Magistrates Court - a place where you get sent when you have failed to pay your bills - though you are able to visit if you happen to pass by.
- The Sport & Fitness Square, where you gain £200 by passing through. Not in the usual position of one of the corner squares, but two squares after the Start.
- 21"Pay & Take" and 21"Good News/ Bad News" cards.
- Mortgages
- Bristol Hippodrome Sponsored Free Parking.

- ... and many more.

Box Description : Picture of Clifton suspension bridge by Philip Pierce
Board Description : Pict of SS Gt. Britain at Great Western Dock.
Year of Manufacture : 2000
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: The Flintstones Cut-ups Card Game
description:
A simple children's game based on the television cartoon characters. Players take turns rolling the die and placing the appropriate cut out on the board. The first to complete their character’s picture wins.

Comes with roll-board, cards, and die.

name: Boscaiola
description:
The game consists of a plate, a set of small balls (5white and 1 red) and a spinning top (which comes in two pieces).
After putting the small balls in the plate, drive the top with your hand. the small balls will go into the seats.
When the top comes to a halt, sum up the numbers of the seats (holes) occupied by the small balls (if the red occupies a red seat it is worth twice as much).
If all the balls make points, one has the right to another go.
The player is disqualified if one ball or more fall out of the plate (into the corner pockets).
The winner is the player who is the first to make a number of points fixed in advance (for example 1000).
Several persons can play this game together.

name: Roonic
description:
Each of 52 cards has two letters (AB,CD, etc.) on it and there are four of each denomination. Deal out all cards and the dealer calls a trump word. For example, PIG. This means the OP is the highest denomination, IJ is next and GH is next. Otherwise, AB is higher than CD, etc.

Points are scored for capturing cards, with bonus points for trump and more bonus points if syllables of and/or the entire trump word can be spelled with captured cards.

name: Tug of War
description: Both players play from identical decks and try to build two monsters pulling the rope (on the plastic mat), before being forced to build the third color monster. Winner is the player to build two monsters pulling or having the opponent build his "you lose" monster.

name: Doublecross
description:
From box:
Doublecross, with its unique three-sectioned domino, provides an intriguing change of pace for the avid board game player, yet offers new avenues of play for veteran domino lovers.

name: Dog Pound
description:
Dog Pound is a fast condition-recognition game similar to Slamwich, Twitch and Bongo. The cards are cut to resemble dog biscuits, and contain matching pairs of dogs and owners who bear an uncanny resemblance to each other. Whenever a pair appears on the card pile, the first person to slap the pile wins all of the cards.

There are also three special action cards that add a twist to the pattern recognition required in the game. The fire hydrant card costs you an extra card, which is added to the pile. The dog catcher card allows you to pick up the pile, but you have to leave the dog catcher behind. And finally, the dog biscuit card is a sort of wild card, and whoever slaps the pile first with a dog biscuit on it wins the pile.

The player who collects all of the cards in the deck wins.

Contents:

20 Dog Cards
20 Dog Owner Cards
2 Fire Hydrant Cards
2 Dog Catcher Cards
4 Dog Biscuit Cards
Rules on the box
publishers: IDEAlogists LLC, Madd Capp Games, MJ Moran Company

name: Battle of Berlin
description: This is a two player card game simulating the battle of Berlin (4/3/1945 – 5/2/1945). Players are Russian Generals competing to be the first to capture Berlin. One player is Marshal Georgi Zhukov (First Belorussian Front). The other player is Marshal Ivan Koniev (First Ukranian Front). The game is free to print and play from the Ludi Popina web site.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Time Jump
description:
Funny family & party game for 2-6 players. Who can guess the other's plans? Who's fooling who? You better stay 'cool' flying through the dimensions...and be aware of the nasty timeholes!

Players take turns moving their spaceship around whatever 'dimension' he is in (each dimension is represented by a circular board, and there are three dimensions.) The object is to move your ship through each dimension, starting with Dimension 1. Turning each round, one player acts as the 'Time-Master' and is able to place 1 to 3 'timeholes' which cause players either to go back to the start of the dimension (if you are in Dimension 1) or to drop back to the previous dimension on the space corresponding to the space you landed on (i.e. If you were on space 6 in Dimension 2 when you landed on a timehole you'd go back to space 6 in Dimension 1.)

The winner is the first player to pass the Time Jump space in Dimension 3 safely (i.e. If you pass the Time Jump space but land on a timehole, the game continues.)

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/timejump.htm

name: Bürokratie: Ausgabe Schulen 2005
description: Bürokratie - Ausgabe Schulen (Bureaucracy - School Edition) is by Jürgen Junghanel and is a strategic card game that plays like a board game and deals with excessive bureaucracy in a critical manner. Those who know many bureaucrats and use their knowledge get ahead. Just putting in an honest day’s work as a teacher isn’t good enough. You get closer to the desired bureaucrats, when the class sizes increase, by playing out new school, school board or ministry of culture facilities. The better facilities attract more bureaucrats – that much is obvious. When the class sizes shrink, you can increase the number of bureaucrats by skills: new laws, new rules or certificates. To play out facilities or skills you need various cards such as party book, lobbying, intrigue, catastrophe and honest work, which you get for teaching and are therefore easiest to get in the schools. The player with the most bureaucrats wins. But there’s also – although rarely – justice: The player who manages to get 7 of the 10 school cards receives an award from the government and immediately wins all the bureaucrats.

name: Sternenkinder
description:
aka Star Children.

This game can be played for ages 4 and up. It involves the collecting of stars in order to distribute sweet dreams to the children on Earth. Nominee for Kinderspiel des Jahres 2005.

name: Top-ography
description:
This game teaches American geography - in particular city names and locations.

Players take turns selecting either red or black and then spinning the Alphabet Top. The player then announces either the red or black letter as appropriate. Next, that player inverts the sand timer and places pegs next to cities on the map of the United States that start with the letter spun. When the sand runs out, their turn is over and play passes to the next player. The first player to place all 25 of their pegs onto the map correctly wins. If a peg is placed incorrectly, 2 additional pegs of that player are removed as a penalty.

name: Afrikanische Mühle
description: This is one of the new mini-leather travel games by HiKu that comes with a a leather game board in a 7 by 7 cm wooden box. This is an African version of Nine Men’s Morris.

name: Lam Turki
description: This is an ancient solitaire game from Bengala. This is one of the new mini-leather travel games by HiKu that comes with a a leather game board in a 7 by 7 cm wooden box.

name: Helix
description:
The board consists of 12 rods arranged in a pattern of a circle with 2 perpendicular diameters and 2 sets of co-terminal arcs arranged at a 45 degree angle with respect to the the diameters.

Players start with 24 beads (either blue or red). The goal is to create patterns of 4 beads along any "line" either horizontally or in a stair-step pattern. The line can be along the outside of the circle, along one of the two straight lines, or along one of the arcs. A line along an arc in a stair-step pattern is called a "helix."

After all 48 beads have been played, the game is scored as follows:

1 point for each line of 4 beads
1 bonus point for the first line of 4 beads
2 points for each line of 5 beads

The player with the highest total score is the winner.

The game can also be played as a partnership game with partners sitting across from each other and sharing a color.

Similar to:

Score Four

name: Lifesaver Game
description: The Lifesaver Game provides a comfortable setting for parents to instruct children about the importance of safety and how to avoid dangerous situations. Children today live in a very active and sophisticated world. As a result, they need to know how to react to emergency situations. The best way to teach children is to make it fun. In the game, children and adults are asked safety questions and parents are encouraged to help the child get the correct answer. The child is rewarded with Lifesaver tokens for each correct answer. They could win a penny, five cents, a hug, a "stay up 1/2 later" token, etc. Honoring the tokens makes the family fun last long after the game is over. It also motivates children to play the game again and again, thus reinforcing principles of safety.

name: Smack-A-Roo
description:
Smack-A-Roo is a fun family game that is actually 10 games in one: Baseball, Smack-It, Skeebol, Knockoff, Bowlaround, Duck Zoop, 6 Lil’ Indians, Impossi-Bowl, Clownaround, and Shoot the Works. Some of these titles reveal the type of game: “Baseball,” “Bowlaround,” and “Impossi-Bowl,” are all pretty clear, for instance. Other titles are Ideal’s proprietary titles for games or variations that they have devised for this unique “arena-style” playing board. It’s all explained in the instruction booklet, which illustrates how to play each game. Gameplay is kind of a mix of Skittle Pool, Zig Zag Zoom, and Rebound or Bumper Shot.

There is a cool little marble-shooter gadget and marbles, of course. There are other gadgets and equipment, too: tenpins for bowling games, a triangular pin-setting device, a spinner device and an abstract clown used as challenging obstacles during play, and a sidelines bat for baseball-type games. Any number of people can play—including solo (which isn’t much fun, however)—but Smack-A-Roo is best suited for 2 to 4 players.

name: Taxi and the city
description:
Taxi and the city seems to be (according to the information of the publisher) a new line of games, in which the players try to earn the most money by working as a taxi-driver in a certain city during the agreed playtime. Right now it is only available concerning the German city 'Wiesbaden', but others are planned.
Afaik... DiceBoxx has been shut down and no one is following up ... too bad:(
R.S. (living in Wiesbaden... close to DiceBoxx)

name: Gunjin Shogi
description:
Literally meaning ‘Soldier Shogi’, Gunjin Shogi is not really related to Shogi other than by having a military theme and pentagonal pieces. The game is more similar to Army Chess (Lu Zhan Jun Qi) or Stratego, featuring hidden pieces and a hierarchical system of combat, where higher ranked pieces defeat lower ones: the objective is to capture the opponent’s flag. Like Army Chess, Gunjin Shogi requires a third person to act as umpire and resolve combat. Unlike Army Chess (and more like Hai Lu Kong Jun Qi), Gunjin Shogi includes planes and tanks.

Each player has 23 pieces, consisting of a flag, 12 officers, 2 planes, 2 tanks, a cavalry unit, two engineers, a spy and two land mines. There is a hierarchy of ranks, with some exceptions – planes naturally cannot be destroyed by land mines and engineers deactivate land mines, for instance.

The game dates to at least before the second world war (I base this on an incomplete pre-war set I was shown in an antique shop in Japan).
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Jungle Bungle Game
description: Jungle Bungle is a truly new kind of game that's out and out fun. With its talking dice, lucky dip bag and exciting game play it is a must for kids of all ages. Players are out to get a full set of snaps of the wild jungle animals prowling the board. Each turn the dice, growls, trumpets, roars, laughs or tells you what to do.
publishers: Diset S. A., Drumond Park Ltd.

name: So You Think You Know Maine
description:
From the box:
"A game of Maine trivia suitable for natives and people from away."

Players start in Kittery (Southern Maine). Counties in Maine represent different categories. As players roll and move around the board, they must collect cards at each county seat. Players then race to Fort Kent (Northern Maine) to win the game.

name: The Complete Book of Games
description:
This is a very large book (900 pages) explaining rules to all kinds of games. The first 300 pages are dedicated solely to card games. The book then moves on to traditional board and dice games such as checkers, backgammon, and craps. There are many word and guessing games. Outdoor activities are also listed, including races, snow or water games, lawn games, and full-blown sports.

Ideas for adults' get-togethers include quick-thinking contests and even dancing games. The book details countless games for children, suitable for everyday play or social events such as birthday parties. Some of the party games are geared toward specific holidays.

This huge volume devotes one little paragraph to branded games such as Monopoly, Pit, and Flinch. It only mentions that they exist, and require special equipment, which is purchased along with the rules.

Although you'll find very familiar entries such as bridge, marbles, and baseball, many of the games are less known, or a variation on a more familiar idea. Some of the names are intriguing in their own right. Here's a sampling of names of the many games to learn:

Misery Nap
Bierspiel
Anti-nudist
Hearts of Lettuce
Skeegee-Weegee
The G Man Never Takes His Ease
Literary Salad
Strawberries Without Cream
Schnozzle Race

name: Facts In Acts
description: "Who was blinded on the road to Damascus?" "Who asked to be tried in Rome?" Players answer these and other questions from the book of Acts as they match these four-sided dominoes. There are two complete sets of dominoes with one set emphasizing people, and the other set emphasizing places. Scriptural references and an answer key is included. 2-4 players. Ages 10 and up

name: Picture Perfect
description:
Be the first player/team to score 50 or more points by identifying famous faces randomly assorted in 5 major categories: Movies, Television, & Radio; History; Sports, Recreation, & Leisure; Music, Arts, & Literature; and Miscellaneous.

Includes 400 famous faces cards and instruction sheet

name: Diagonale
description:
This is an Italian game by Gastone Fiori.

Look like 3D Checkers with 3 transparent octagonal boards.
Put one over the other like a tower.

There are 3 kinds of pieces; a diagonal one, a concave one and a convex one (that perfectly fit the concave shape.

The convex one appears like a little House

You put 2 concave, 1 convex and four diagonal pieces on the line Cross..

All the piece can eat like Checkers in the same board.. but can eat in different mode on parallel board according with their shape. Convex and concave pieces may "Kill" pieces on other boards if they are in a "reflected diagonal" with an opponent piece.. diagonal pieces may kill pieces on other boards if they form a diagonal with the opponents piece.

name: Probaddility
description: Probaddility is an engaging card game dealing with probability and simple addition. Players make educated bets about the likely numbers hidden under opponents cards and win or lose cards depending on the accuracy of their predictions. A fun and engaging introduction to these basic concepts.

name: Real Numbers
description: The REAL NUMBERS game was designed as a prelude to EQUATIONS. It comes in a handy 5-game kit that can be clipped to a pen in your shirt pocket. The REAL NUMBERS Game provides a practical introduction to the process of finding Solutions from randomly generated symbols similar to what occurs in EQUATIONS. The REAL NUMBERS Game deals with real, rational, irrational, integer, and natural numbers.

name: The Meditation Game
description:
From Publisher:

THE MEDITATION GAME offers a delightful excursion into the realm of pure strategy. Though simple in design, the game is rich in creative possibilities and subtle surprises. The colorful playing mat and 49 playing rings are used by two players or teams in the pursuit of “Spontaneous Right Action”. Clear, coherent and comprehensive thought is required for success. THE MEDITATION GAME offers people of all ages a refreshing opportunity to experience a gentle, mental massage.

name: Civil War Wit
description:
A simple trivia game covering the American Civil War. Each card (two standard decks' worth) has a photograph or etching reproduction on the front and a point value. On the back are two questions--one "buff" level, the other "scholar" level. Get either question right--it's not clear, from the rules, who gets to choose which question gets asked, the asker or the answerer--and you get the points listed on the card. There is often no clear connection between the point value of the question and its difficulty. The pictures, however, are very nice.

In an odd twist, if a card's question goes unanswered, the answer is then read aloud and the card set aside. After all the rest of the cards have been dealt with, this pile of discards--whose answers, again, have been revealed--gets shuffled up and gone through again. Presumably this is to test short-term memory. The game ends once all cards have been correctly answered.

This is part of a series of "WIT" games from this company, which included trivia games on wildlife, National Parks, and other Americana topics.

name: Whoops!
description:
Everybody plays on every spin! Spin the spinner, do the stunt, squeak the squeaker, tag out, and win!

Contents: Game board, spinner, squeaker, scoring pegs, scoreboard.

name: Quizmo Phonetic
description: A bingo type game that can be used to help teach phonetics and reading.

name: Slangsters
description: A game of slang expressions. One person/team gives a slang expression, the opposing team must come up with the definition. 300 cards included in game, 5 categories on each card. Things To Do, Places To Go & People To See, Grab Bag Rally, Whatchamacallits, Kissing Cousins. Subcategories sometimes provided. Rolled die determines category chosen. Each card has a different letter on sides, and players must spell out SLANGSTERS to win. Cards may be traded between teams.

name: RAEj
description:
From reading the rules:

A bizarre and unlikely combination of checkers, Chinese checkers, backgammon, and chess.

Note: production quality of this game is surprisingly high. The "checkers" feel to be made of high-quality material, and feel cool and smooth to the touch, reminiscent of 'Go' stones, but much larger (and flat). They have star outline, star-filled, and star-filled in a circle designed etched into them: 1 set blue etchings, 1 set red etchings. The board is standard hard cardboard. The board art is gray background with white lines, with blue and red stars, triangles, and square delineated colored zones.

From the rules:

Each player starts with 1 'pawn' (checker) and 1 "King' (checker with a star in a circle design} on their designated opposed short-sides of the 9 x 10 square board. Two dice (each numbered only 1-3) are rolled to determine movement.

"Pawns" (checkers) move forward or sideways and can only jump other "pawns".

"Knights' (checkers with a star design) are created by jumping a "pawn" with its own "King", They can jump "pawns" or "knights", and may not be jumped by "pawns". When a "pawn" is knighted, the checker is flipped over to it's star-design side.

"Kings" (checker with a star in a circle design) move forward, backward, or sideways. They can jump any piece, but must stay out of the opponent's "holding zone" (a 3 x 3 square area in the middle of the opponent's side).

A piece may enter the board on a player's holding zone when a 2 is rolled on a die, and is moved the number on the other die.

A piece may leave the board when it is in a "destination square" (located on the last rank of the opponents side of the board) on any roll.

Captures are only made by a King. When a king jumps an opposing piece, that piece is placed back in the opponent's 'holding zone' (effectively starting over it's journey).

There is a scoring system in place for end-of game (Pawns with 1, Knights 2, Kings 4), and the doubling-cube is used to issue challenges during play.

The rule-sheet has a small section on strategies, and "Championship tournament" guidelines. Very ambitious.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: One for the Pot!
description: Players roll a die & move around a circular board filling opponent's (and their own!) teacups full of sugar cubes, spoons & squirts of water from a centrally located teapot. Players are eliminated from the game when their cups overflow.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Go Anna!
description:
Three Australian environmental card games for the whole family. For ages 4 and up.

Play Go Anna! and enjoy classic games with an Australian twist.
Play Go Anna! and learn about Australia's unique wildlife.
Younger children develop skills in recognizing colors, words and Australian animals. They develop skills in counting and memory.
For older children there are challenge levels to develop creativity and lateral thinking skills.
Go Anna! features beautiful, whimsical illustrations by Caitlin McDougall, talented actor and artist. Games design by Kribo and Yodit Ackerman.

The three games in the set are:

Go Anna!: Collect sets of possums, wrens or other animals in this fun four-of-a kind game.

Cinnamon's Surprise: Cinnamon the superb blue wren will help you win all the cards in this fast paced game.

Ella & Louis' Wonderful Connections: Match up one Tawny Frogmouth card with another, or birds with birds, mammals with mammals and so on, in this great matching game.

name: Billion Dollar Bustout
description:
This is a gambling game developed and produced by Rick R. Windedahl. He states in the acknowledgment that he developed the game in 1977 for personal home play and that after 5 years of private play he was urged to get a copyright and publish the game.

The object it to become a Billionaire. Each player starts with 300 million dollars and the game continues until only one player is left with money or one player accumulates 1 billion dollars in assets.

The game comes with 300 chips, 16 casino tiles, 6 tokens, 5 dice, 4 betting strips, a gameboard, a slots deck, a regular deck a spinner and the rule book.

Players roll either 1 or 2 dice (their choice) and then move around the board and either play the gambling game of the casino that they land on for small profits against the bank or buy the casino (casinos are grouped, sort of like Monopoly squares, by the same color) and then own and become the bank for that particular casino making the payoffs for others who gamble in that particular casino. The games of chance in the game are SLOTS, WHEEL, DICE, BLACKJACK, ACEY-DUCEY and various forms of POKER. (There is an explanation on how to play any of the games included in the rule book..

Acquiring a set of the same colored casinos allows one to get a bonus by selling them back to the bank for double the buying price.

Sometimes the wording of the rules shows perhaps a lack of proper English and so are not as clear as they could be.

name: Caymanopoly
description: This is the Cayman Island themed version of Monopoly. Community Chest has been renamed to Pirate's Chest and many properties have been renamed based on sponsors. A 2005 revamp was released to raise money for the Cayman Islands' Junior Achievement program.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Junior Achievement Company of Defiance, Ohio

name: NFL Team Trivia Blitz
description: This was an official NFL release. It is not related (directly) to Trivial Pursuit. Players answer trivia questions about the NFL. Of course, records post-1992 will not be here, so don't answer "Barry Sanders" or "Emmitt Smith."

name: Two Armies
description:
This electronically refereed game is the best and closest game-board realization of the battlefield tactics from the Chinese military strategist Sun Zi (500 B.C.) in his celebrated work "The Art of War":

Warfare is the way of deception. Therefore, if able, appear unable; if active, appear not active; if near, appear far; if far, appear near. If they have advantage, entice them; if they are confused, take them; if they are substantial, prepare for them; if they are strong, avoid them; if they are angry, disturb them, if they are humble, make them haughty; if they are relaxed, toil them; if they are united, separate them. Attack where they are not prepared, go out to where they do not expect.

Each player commands a troop of 25 game pieces: 1 Flag, 1 Army, 1 Corps, 2 Divisions, 2 Brigades, 2 Regiments, 2 Battalions, 3 Companies, 3 Platoons, 3 Engineers, 3 Mines, and 2 Bombs. To win a game, one must either capture the Flag piece or defeat all the movable pieces of the opponent player. When two opposing game pieces are engaged in a battle, the identities of the two pieces are only revealed to the electronic referee system (not to the players) which determines the winning piece and the defeated piece. The battlefield consists of railway tracks along which the pieces can move continuously, country-road routes along which the pieces cannot move continuously, and bases which provide shelters to any pieces occupying them. On each side, the Flag piece is to be secretly placed in one of the two castle-shaped headquarters and guarded by movable troop pieces and unmovable Mines. Lively military figures, numeric numbers, and words in both English and Chinese are shown on the game pieces.

name: Rolê em SP
description: Rolê em SP ("Goin'around in São Paulo") is a simple trivia game about the landmarks of São Paulo city (biggest city of Brazil). This game was given as a gift by a Mall located in that city.

name: Adultery
description: Adultery is a game for the piecepack game system. Players move their pawns around a "ring" of tiles (really a square) attempting to land on Home wreckers or other player's Spouses while avoiding their own Spouse.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: What Will You Think Of Next?
description: Played in teams of two, this is a funny word association game. One partner picks up a card from the pile and writes down a word in his/her team booklet. The word that he/she is writing down is what he/she thinks the partner will say next. For example, a card is picked up and it says, "DOG". The player may write down... "pound", "leash", "house", etc, hoping that the one chosen is the one that the partner will say next. Other teams can steal answers or a team may be on an "all guess" space so there is lots of yelling and laughter.

name: Sexolândia
description: Players are divided in two teams. Each team try to guess the answers of the other team to questions on many issues (from culinary to relationships). Based on a TV show with the same name.

name: Colony: A Strategy Game
description:
Colony A Strategy Game is a strategic conflict and colony building game. Small counters represent warships and townships, which are deployed on the main map. Status sheets record the condition of the ships and status of the construction of the colony.
Colony building along with conflict takes place on the same turn, so decisions need to be made to balance advancing victory conditions versus elimination of opponent's assets.
The winner is the first to build an entire colony, which consists of nine CM's being built.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Race

name: The Great Running Game
description:
A head to head rugby game, where players play cards to move the ball around the pitch or to attempt to stop their opponents moves.

Various situations are catered for by the cards held, from rucks and rolling mauls, to sweeping moves by the backs. Several kicking options are also available from little grubber kicks, to towering bombs, to huge touch finding clearance kicks - although beware of your opponent scooping up the loose ball and cutting through your defense.

This is a fast paced, end to end, rugby game, which is quick to learn, and no two matches ever play the same.

Additional rules are also included for playing with 3 or 4 players, or even solo.

name: Corporate Circles
description:
(Description taken from the back of the box)

A highly competitive fast paced adult game (playing time approximately 1 hour) where players move in and out of three CORPORATE CIRCLES trying to become the first person to make $1,000,000.00 cash. This is done by building up one's corporate holdings through the purchase of companies or by acquiring your opponent's companies in hostile takeovers or corporate raids.

This is a game where trivia knowledge can't help you; monopolies can be broken and there is always a risk of your opponents conspiring against you. Your common sense is your only ally.

It's a no holds barred [sic] game where alliances are loosely formed and broken as fast as companies hit the auction block.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Negotiation, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Team-Based Game

name: Try-Max
description:
A strategy game which is a cross between rugby and draughts.
Players have 15 counters representing their team, and alternate moving one of their counters each turn. There is no concept however of a ball, so any piece making it to the opponents end of the pitch is deemed to have scored.

Different pieces have slightly different rules, so the fullback may move sideways (to block an opponent), while a winger may move double on certain turns. There are also spaces which bring into play referee and kicking cards to add additional options.

name: letterHEAD
description: A unscramble the letters game, letterHEAD includes over 300 cards with mixed-up letters on the backs of each. During game play, a card is turned over and the letters are revealed. For example, all players will see a card with these letters, "RUNTYCE". The first player has 30-seconds to attempt to unscramble the letters to make a word. If he/she is unsuccessful, then it is up for grabs. If successful, then he/she would have spouted out, "century". The player would move ahead and maintain turn. letterHEAD's cards are, for the most part, very challenging. If you a really good at this game, then you can get the Genius cards, available through Enterfection Games.

name: The Simpsons: Homer's Trivia Game
description:
(From the box, weird punctuation and grammar preserved)

The Simpsons: Homer's Trivia Game

Hello, I'm Homer J. Simpson! Everybody knows that I have only two hairs on the top of my head (d'oh!) But do you know why I lost most of my hair? Or why my frumpy, old maid of a sister-in-law Selma has no sense of smell or taste? No? Well, don't fret like that pansy Flanders! (The answers are below!) Inside this box are lots more questions about Springfield's number one father, me.

You can compete with your friends, or other Simpson trivia-geeks (you know the type I'm talking about!) See who knows more about me (and what's more important than that?). It's more more fun than "Deviled-egg Nite" at Moe's Tavern!

And guess what? The game comes with a Simpsons cast poster. Whoo-hoo!

Answers:
Homer lost more and more hair each time one of his children were born
Selma lost her sense of taste and smell when a bottle rocket shot up her nose
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: A.D. 1706, Le Siège de Turin
description:
There are two different games inside the box: one on the field battle of Torino (7/9/1706) fought before the city and the other for the siege of the Cittadella (26/7 - 7/9/1706)itself.

The quality of the maps is not very high, while the counters (more than 500) are a work of art, with splendid reproduction of the period uniforms.
The rules are of medium complexity and of the usual kind for the field battle, while they seem very peculiar for the siege battle itself.

name: Hive Alive
description:
Can your fleet of numbered bees infiltrate the enemy hive and "buzz" the Queen Bee?
Higher numbered bees outrank lower ones. With a single "buzz," or touch, they move remove lesser bees from the hive. At number zero, the Queen Bee is practically defenseless.
Protect your Queen Bee from attack!
Steer clear of the dreaded fungus!
Watch out for the deadly Killer Bee!

Math skills covered: inequalities (greater than, less than), fractions, decimals, negative numbers, and place value.

This game is meant for use in grade 2 mathematics classrooms and beyond. The game is to be played by two players at a time. Players try to protect their queen bee from attack; steer clear of the black fungus; and avoid the deadly killer bee. Each player has nine worker bees with a whole number, fraction, or decimal value, one queen bee, and one killer bee. Players attack other bees of unknown value, and the bee with the higher value survives. Whoever captures their opponent's queen bee wins. Mathematics skills covered include inequalities; fractions; decimals; negative numbers; and place value. The game contains a game board, bee value cards, and playing piece stands.

name: Taxicab
description:
A game for the piecepack.

Operate a Taxicab in Pp City to earn more money then the other drivers in the Pp City "Best Taxi Driver" contest. This is a pick-up-and-delivery game with randomly generated passenger pick-up and destination addresses.

name: Happy Landing
description:
Each player is given four wooden chips (or airplanes) of a color and one wooden shooter (or propeller). 'Airplanes' are placed onto the 'propeller' and are catapulted onto the gameboard by tapping the far side of the 'propeller'.

The board consists of a box insert depicting various features surrounding a landing strip, each labeled with either positive or negative points. In the center of the board is a cup, which is the highest scoring feature and true target.

Excerpted from the box:

The game is based on the principle of an airplane trying to land safely without "cracking up." This is called a Happy Landing.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Aviation / Flight, Children's Game

name: Jay Jay Counts Game
description:
From the publisher:
