description: The players race around the board and answer questions from various movie categories such as Quotes, Cult Cinema, Actors, Genre and so forth. Whenever they get a question right they can mark down points on their marking sheets. However answers a specific number of questions first is the winner. The game comes in a film spool packaging and includes a soundtrack CD over famous movie tunes
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Talstafet
description: The game consists of: 1 board, 1 red die, 1 blue die, 1 playing piece, 35 number tokens, 1 set of rules. The one who gathers most points wins. Move a playing piece around the board and get as many number tokens as possible before the board is out of tokens or your piece cannot move anymore.

name: Polus
description: A challenging dice game for 2-6 players: The players take turns to roll two dice each; every player may use 3 dice rolls at the most to get 5, 10, 15, 20 or 25 points for the round. The player who reaches 100 first wins the game.

name: Stock Exchange
description: Stock market game where players try to amass money in a specified time limit or play to a set monetary goal. Players move around the board buying and selling shares of, primarily, commodities. The price is determined by "price index cards," that periodically change when players land on certain squares. There is also an auction mechanic and events cards that increase or decrease demand for certain products. The game has a heavy lucky factor.

name: Head-On Football
description:
From the rule book: "This is it, your chance to be a star! Epyx Head-On Football is designed to follow the same rules as professional football. However, you may make changes in the rules or adjustments in gameplay if it suits your needs. With this game, you're in charge, you call all the shots."

This is a 2 player game that roughly simulates a game of American football. There are two decks of cards which represent offensive and defensive plays.

The defensive cards have a red tinted window that line up 'decoder style' on the offensive card to reveal the outcome of the play. Periodically the outcome will be "xx tape xx" which means to activate the audio cassette tape included and listen to the "play by play action". The announcer will then tell you the outcome of the play.

Then the football pawn is moved down the board accordingly. There are markers for keeping track of what down it is and the score.

Dice are used to determine the success of Field Goal and Punt attempts.

The rules suggest not rewinding the cassette tape until reaching the end of the tape, thus keeping some level of randomness.

Components:
Audio cassette with over 200 highlight plays.
20 Offensive formations and plays.
12 Defensive plays.
Game board
6 sided die
Offensive play holder (also marks scrimage line)
Football pawn
5 colored rings used for scoring

name: Animal Friends: Jungle Party
description:
A children's game, ages 4 and up.

A memory game based on sound; music and animal sounds. When you think you've found the right sound with the right animal, all the sounds are changed again, so players have to start over. The game was later published with a Disney theme, where the Animal Friends were from Jungle Book and The Lion King. Languages: Dutch, German, English, Italian, French, Spanish. Playing time: 15-45 minutes.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music
publishers: Golden, Kärnan, Kirjalito, Litas Spil, Ravensburger

name: More After Dinner Games Compendium
description: 'More After Dinner Games Compendium' consists of 1 deck of 50 oversized cards. Each card or card set provides instructions for a group game or activity. 21 games are included, ranging from loud-and-lively to thought-provoking.

name: Division Commander
description:
Division Commander is a set of miniatures rules designed for very high-level World War II operations. Each stand is a battalion, the ground scale is 3" = 1 mile, and turns are 90-180 minutes. The rules are designed from the ground up to play multi-day campaigns with multiple divisions per side.

Like Bruce's "Great Battles of World War II" rules, one of the primary concepts is that of troops "going to ground". Troops start the day fresh and can make dramatic breakthroughs. But, as damage occurs, troops are less willing to push forward, they will seek out defensive positions and wait for a new day. Green troops, in particular, will tend to go to ground very quickly, while more elite troops can continue moving forward. At this level, combat is abstracted, but operational aspects such as air support and corps and army artillery support are key parts of the system.

A number of scenario books are available for the system, including France 1940, Eastern Front, Normandy, North Africa, and the Pacific.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: The F.B.I. Game
description:
Each Player is a 2 man team of F.B.I. agents assigned to investigate the scene of a crime and gather evidence against the guilty fugitive hiding in a distant city. When a player correctly identifies 4 pieces of evidence, the guilty fugitive will fit into their center as easily as a piece in a jig-saw puzzle. First player to obtain 4 pieces of evidence fitting a fugitive on 2 sides, arrests the criminal, brings him into headquarters wins.

Contents:
8 F.B.I. Agents in 4 colors with black wooden bases
4 Fugitives with 4 colored wooden bases
4 Assignment cards
64 Evidence pieces (16 in each case file)
1 Airport Spinner
20 F.B.I. Bulletins
1 Magnifying glass
2 dice
1 dice cup
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: La meva col·lecció
description:
Overview and objectives

The players try to get at least 9 art pieces from different museums in Barcelona, in order to build their own art collection, placing it in their own "shelves". To achieve that, the players must drop pieces they don't want while trying to obtain the ones needed.

Game components

54 tokens (square cardboard cards) representing 54 art pieces from different museums of Barcelona and surroundings. Each token is identified by a number, a color and a category. There are 4 colors and 4 categories.
2 tokens representing a thief.


Rules

Shuffle all tokens. Each player draws 3 tokens from the pile with all tokens shuffled and keeps them in his hand. Then, as many tokens as players in the game are picked from the pile and put in front of them in the "showroom". The players use one of their tokens for bidding for the showroom tokens: the one with the highest number chooses first which piece of the "showroom" he gets. The tokens used for betting are discarded. At this moment each player can add one of the tokens in his hand to his own collection "shelf". Finally each player draws new tokens from the pile to have 3 again.

The critical point is that the shelf can only be filled following a certain pattern: each token must be of the same color or the same category as the previous one, and to completely fill in the "shelf" the player must have, at least, one token of each color and one token of each category.

The first player to complete his collection of 9 pieces is the winner.

name: Oenologus
description:
The Union de la Sommellerie Française (French Union of Sommeliers) created this wine-trivia as a relation gift. The nice wooden box contains a map of France, 6 bottle-meeples, 1 die and 8 sets of 44 cards. On each card, you find 3 questions on wine (in general or questions about a wine region).
Players have to roll the die and answer a question. If the answer is correct, you can play again. If wrong, next players starts rolling the die.
Winner is that player who comes first at the ending point.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Mighty Max And The Crystal Quest
description: Produced by Irwin Toy Limited and released in Canada, "Mighty Max And The Crystal Quest" is a pretty standard board game. Much like LIFE or MONOPOLY, you use Mighty Max character figures to move around the board while trying to land on certain squares. Instead of money or real estate, you're trying to gather "tokens" that grant various abilities. The first one to make it to Skull Mountain, grab the Crystal Of Souls, and make it back to school (where Mighty Max needs to get back to) wins. Throughout the board there are "Battle Arenas" where you must use your ability tokens to defeat the villain associated with each arena.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Jet Race Game
description:
A children's game from the 1950-60's where each player races around a map of the United States visiting various landmarks.

The game features a map of the US with various touristy destinations, a movement track with a small detour/alternate path, and several squares on the path which affect game play. Movement is made with a spinner, and chits represent the jet planes and the various players visits.
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement
publishers: Built-Rite, Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co., Warren

name: Monopoly: Wyland Underwater World
description:
World-renowned marine life artist Wyland has dived and painted the oceans for more than 25 years. Now Wyland fans and ocean lovers everywhere can experience the marvels of the deep sea through this Wyland-inspired MONOPOLY game.

Buy, sell and trade some of the most fascinating sea creatures like the Spinner Dolphin, Orca Whale and Sea Otter in an effort to control and protect our oceans, which cover over 70% of the Earth’s surface. This special edition of the world’s most famous board game teaches you all about the interesting creatures featured in the game and provides tips on ways to save the environment. Learn as you have fun, enjoy the beautiful artwork of Wyland and vie to protect and preserve our marine life in the MONOPOLY: Wyland Underwater World Edition. Includes 6 collectible pewter tokens including a Whale Tail, Turtle, Dolphin, Reef Fish, Starfish and Shark and even includes a 60 minute speed play option for a shorter game with the same amount of fun.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Under the Covers
description:
In the second expansion to the Fuzzy Heroes miniature game, covert rules are added that insert elements of espionage, gadgets and general secrecy.
As with all Fuzzy Heroes games, there is a distinct role playing component to this wargame, though in this game it is perhaps more obvious than the previous ones.

Expands:

Fuzzy Heroes
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Lost Toys
description:
This time, the Fuzzy Heroes venture into the world of horror. Undead toys stalk the floor of your bedroom.
More than any previous book, this Fuzzy Heroes product depends strongly on storytelling and roleplaying elements.
Introducing rules for undeath(a toy-virus), slaying (Spraying...) and related special powers.
Fluffy must use all her "Spraying" abilities to make the world safe for stuffed animals once more.
Hilarious as always.

Expands

Fuzzy Heroes
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Numberland Counting Game
description:
An introduction to numbers:

The object of the game is to collect the largest number of diecut pictures.

Each player selects a different pawn, and places it on start. The youngest player goes first.

The first player takes to top card from the DECK and moves along the path to the next square that matches the color drawn, or if a picture card is drawn, directly to the numeral space on the path matching the numeral in the upper left corner of the card.

The game ends when one player reaches the red HOME space, or when all the plastic numerals have been removed from the playing board. Home is reached by drawing a single or double red color card when there are no other red spaces on the path in front of the player, or by drawing a card that would take him beyond HOME if the path continued. He fills out the home card, like a numeral card.

name: Bearly There
description:
A set of five six-sided dice in a tube with a leaflet containing rules for Bearly There and two other games (Accumulation and Horse)
The dice are identical, each having have a bear and the numbers from two to six.

The object of Bearly There is to roll the dice, totaling the numbers and pushing your luck to reach a specific total.
Although it looks like a cuddly teddy, the bear is, in fact, wild. The twist is that you have the option to either add or subtract the wild values from your accumulated total.

The other two games are equally simple, if not more so.

name: Spelling Bee
description: Spelling Bee is a game of making words from a deck of single-letter cards. On each turn, a player must either start a new word, play a card on an existing word to make a new word, or pass. Letters can be added at the front, back, or anywhere inside a word already on the table. The winner is the player with the fewest cards remaining in their hand when all players have passed.

name: Gold Fever
description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

The left spinner tells how far the players may advance during a turn. The right spinner tells the player whether or not one may advance when one reaches a barrier. The first to complete four trips through the mine is the winner.

name: McWiz Junior
description:
From Dr. Toy:

"There are 1,200 questions included in this innovative game. It is available in French and English. This game is perfect for children 6 and over. There are three questions on each card: one is aimed at younger children (6-7 yrs.) the second aimed for older(8-9 yrs) and the third aimed for 10 to 12 years old children. Everyone at all ages can play the game together. The first player or team to complete the jigsaw puzzle wins. Most questions are based on actual school textbooks."

Expanded by:

McWiz Junior Booster Bus: The Bus of Knowledge in Math

name: Switch
description: Switch is the first of the small box games published by Pseudon and is noted with "#1" on the spine. The game includes 16 tiles which are first laid out for all to see. The tiles are then flipped, and in turn a player must flip two to find the scoring combinations on the score sheet. The winner of the game is the first to make all the combinations on their score sheet.

name: Sesame Street Simple Shapes Game
description:
Oscar the Grouch, Cookie Monster, and Ernie face off in this slightly atypical memory matching game. Each player's goal is to have the longest chain of tiles at game end.

There are two notable differences from most memory matching games.
1. Rather than two tiles being matched to each other, this game has players matching tiles to the symbol resulting from a spinner
2. Instead of ending when all tiles are matched, the game ends when the fourth stop tile is drawn.

Twenty-nine tiles are laid face-down on the play surface. These tiles interlock like puzzle pieces, making a chain of tiles when credited to a player. The game includes a spinner with, six spaces. Three of the spinner spaces show one shape (triangle, circle, or square), while the other three spaces have two shapes. Players take turns using the spinner, and then selecting one tile.

If the tile says "free spin", then the tile is added to that player's chain, and the player immediately takes an additional turn.

If the tile matches the shape(s) on the spinner, then the tile is added to the player's chain of tiles, and that player's turn ends.

If the tile does not match the shape on the spinner, the tile is shown to the other players, and then returned face-down to the available tiles.

If the tile says "stop", then it is attached to the top of the spinner. When the fourth "stop" tile is drawn, the game ends.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sesame Street Dominoes
description:
Sesame Street Dominoes is played like the classic game Dominoes with variations for ages 3 and up and ages 4 and up. The dominoes are thick cardboard pieces with the faces of popular Sesame Street characters in the center surrounded by 4 different colors to the top, bottom, left and right.

In the 3 and up game, players match the faces of Sesame Street characters. In the 4 and up game, players match colors.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Go to Press
description: Players move from department to department at a newspaper, finding and correcting errors in the newspaper headlines. The first player to create a complete newspaper, return to the boss's office and say, "Go to press!" wins the game. Game cards feature interesting questions.

name: Quick Pix Geography
description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Geography -- in what region of the world (Western Europe, South America, etc.) countries are located

name: Quick Pix Math
description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Math -- Commonly used addition and subtraction facts

name: Jangala
description:
Jangala is played on a very small board (5x5) with very few playing pieces (3 per player).

You start in one edge with your 3 pieces of different size and must try to reach the opposing edge first to become winner.

Sounds very easy, but that's not true! The problem is that you are only allowed to move on empty fields or on fields with pieces not smaller than yours. Additionally, only the top pieces can move... so it's clear, that bringing your fattie on the other side of the board is really challenging.

name: Minoru
description:
Minoru is a British horse racing game manufactured by John Jacques. The five horses are die cast metal painted in different colors to designate racing teams. The large playing surface is folded felt.

Named for King Edward VII's Epsom Derby-winning Irish thoroughbred racehorse, Minoru, the game Minoru was a popular parlor game, kept available in the lounge of hotels and clubs as well as in homes between the world wars.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hold Your Horses
description: Any number of people can play this simple racing game that uses a deck of cards to determine movement of five horses.

name: Horse Wise
description: Players answer horsemanship questions as they move their horses around the show ring, first to the right, then to the left. Players use their knowledge of horsemanship topics to advance to the finish square and win ribbons.

name: The Historic Mackinac Island Game
description: Players roll dice and move around the board gaining colors by marking their score sheets with the color of the space they land on (each depicting the name of a Mackinac Island merchant.) When a player collects 7 of any color, he moves to one of two dock spaces. From there, players attempt to roll specific combinations in order to advance to the island and collect a Historic card, and then return back to start. Historic cards are worth 75-150 points. First one to 500 points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Regenbogen
description: Regenbogen (Rainbow) is a large box filled with cards of many colors. With these cards, players build structures to score points. The taller, more complex, and more colors used, the more the points.

name: Numero
description: A tile matching game to learn to count. Learn amounts and numbers from one to ten.

name: Ein Mops kommt selten allein!
description: Four pugs go to eat, but one is not who they seem! Dash as quickly as possible to the food but be careful to get enough to eat else lose your place.

name: The Beautiful Game
description:
The goal of The Beautiful Game is to collect a full side of 11 players and make it to the World Cup final.

As you progress in the game, your team will change. Players may be booked on a red or yellow card. Poor players may be sent to the bench until they improve. Injuries? You betcha!

There are many ways to gain or lose players. Answering World Cup trivia, solving puzzles, and performing tasks are just some of the things you'll find yourself doing to improve your team.

name: Economy-Entscheidung-Erfolg
description:
An interesting economic game, where players try to become the first player, who could buy and purchase 15-18 goods of 6 different types.

Several taxes and fees must be paid on the way to becoming the winner of the game. A few of them are fixed amounts, which must be paid when a player reaches a certain step on the way up, some must be paid, when a player misses a chance to buy or purchase goods and therefore has to draw 1 of 80 event cards.

There are six different goods available. A player can purchase 1-3 goods of a chosen type depending on a dice throw. Red goods can only be purchased by throwing a 6, green goods need at least a 5, yellow ones a 4 and so on.
All goods cost 10.000 per piece, but the selling price is higher for the harder goods, from 16.000 - 32.000.

Before selling, another dice throw is required, which needs matching the throws while purchasing the goods.
Last but not least, the purchase and sale of goods can be challenged by other players, if their bid was either lower or higher than the agreed on transaction.

name: Das grosse essen & trinken Menü-Spiel
description:
This game was available solely through the magazine "Essen & Trinken" (a magazine for cooking).
You objective is it to get as many menus as possible. The menu always consist of 4 courses. You collect by drawing a card from a course of your choice. The card shows the kind of menu (classic, veg. etc.)and the value of that dish. You move forward as many spots as the value of the cards - depending on the place you finish you might have to answer a question or you can trade cards with other players.
At the end only finished menus are counted (and all menue cards have to be from the same kind).

All menu-cards contain a real recipe from the magazine, so you can actually use this game as a cook book (if you can understand German)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: All Change
description:
All change is a tile placement word game that uses a turntable with 4 word slots. Players must place letters into the slot in front of them to make a 3 or 4 letter word.

The turntable is then rotated to present the players with one of the other words, one that their opponents have been working on, which they must add to, change or remove tiles from to make a new word.

name: Halo
description:
The board shows a star surrounded by 2 x 3 orbits. Each player has 6 meteors (tokens). They start outside of the board and are moved from orbit to orbit to the star in the center with the help of a die.

If the die roll is high enough, the meteor is gravitated by the star in the center, but if the roll is too low, it will drive off the center. But the chances for being gravitated can be increased by building stacks of meteors (up to 4 meteors of any player's meteors can be stacked).

Winner of the game is the player, whose meteors reach the center first.

name: Chaos! Rules!
description:
From the website:

The object of the game is to spell the word CHAOS! (in any order) on the table in front of you.

The deck consists of Letter Cards and Action Cards. There should be 32 Letter Cards(C, H, A, O, S, and "!" [exclamation point]) that say "CHAOS! RULES!" in lavender on the backs. The 40 Action Cards say "CHAOS! RULES!" in yellow on the backs. These cards feature specific actions that are to be followed immediately after the card is played.

name: The Brass Monkey Game
description:
"It's World War II and you're an Allied spy, one of the most cunning spies in the business. Your assignment is the most dangerous you have ever undertaken. You must enter the exotic and perilous island of Macao, center of a teeming network of international spies just off the coast of China."

"Once on Macao, you secretly make your way to the legendary Brass Monkey Club, site of the local espionage network and the place where you will make contact with the Master Spy himself, H.E. Rasske. But before you reach the sin-infected Brass Monkey Club, your life and your country's security are endangered many times."

-- rulebook excerpt

To win the game you need to move around the board, collect at least three Brass Monkey cards, and be the first to land on the Brass Monkey Club at the end of the track by an exact roll of the dice. Fail to make the exact roll and you might find yourself starting from the beginning of the trail again! Minor complications are introduced by the Risk cards, while Subterfuge cards aid you in your clandestine mission.

-- player summary
mechanics: Events, Lose a Turn, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Communicate
description:
From the publisher:
"Listen, understand, do and have fun at the same time. A game conducive to language development and communication and also good for shape comprehension and for training fine motor skills."

Essentially a two-player game, this can be played with more players by forming two-teams.

The two players (or teams) sit opposite each other and each player is given an identical kit with 26 wooden elements (cubes, prisms, bridges, etc). The lid of the game box is setup as a vertical screen between the two players so that their wooden pieces and building projects in front of them is not visible to the other.

One player is chosen to be the master builder and the other is the apprentice. The master builder begins building a structure with his/her pieces (not visible to the other because of the screen) and verbally describes it as precisely as possible, as the building progresses. The 'apprentice' tries to follow the description givenby the master builder and attempts to build a replica of the structure with the pieces on his/her side of the screen.

Its exciting to compare the buildings when the screen is finally removed.

A further version (for players with practice) is "sign language", whereby the players may only use their hands to communicate.

name: Olivia Doubt's It!
description:
Olivia challenges convention, requiring those around her to make the occasional leap of faith! Playing cards feature the numbers 1-10. A 42 card deck is divided evenly among the players. The idea is to bid a hand of matching numbers and place the cards face down on the table. Announce your numbers, for example, "two 2's." A player may doubt your bid by saying "Olivia Doubt's It!" The player who is challenged must reveal their hand, have the match or pick up all the cards on the table. If the challenger is incorrect, she must pick up all of the cards. The first player to put down all of her cards wins.

-- Text from box. Apostrophe in game title is printed on box title, box description, and rules cards.

name: Lagunera
description:
From the box:
An action-packed game calling for concentration and dexterity. Develops visual perception and trains hand-eye coordination.

For ages 5+.

name: NBA Jam Session
description:
Abridged from the box:

The Jam Session Basketball game takes the NBAs superstar players and puts you in control. The game brings to life all the action and excitement of the NBA. Can you hoop with the best?

name: La Bataille des Éperons d'Or, Courtrai 1302
description:
This is a simulation of the battle of Coutrai, Belgium, 1302, between the French and the Flemish.

20 minute turns, 80m hex, units of about 250 men.

Magazine game published in Casus Belli (Issue 38 - Jun 1987)

name: Advanced Legendary Battles
description: This expansion of the original Legendary Battles expanded the army selection to 10. The new armies are Undead, Vermin, Samurai, and Army of Darkness (Bruce Campbell not included). New rules for leaders, magic users and monsters add to the fantasy element. New types of units are also added including war engines and mercenaries.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Nøtteliten
description:
Players compete to collect nut-tokens to their trees. When the squirrel has collected all of the 36 tokens the player with the most nuts in his/her tree wins.

This is a simple roll and move game with a little twist: The players share one piece (a squirrel) that they move on the board, and certain fields on the board will either force players to swap trees, or give the player an opportunity to swap trees with a player of his/her choice.

Ages 5+

name: Plutocrat
description:
PLUTOCRAT - "A person who through wealth has control and influence"

The game is played with 2, 4 or 5 players. (No 3 player variant.) Each player is given a continent (Europe, Asia, Africa, The Americas or Australasia) or more, depending on number of players, that represent their area of influence. The game is won by successfully controlling a certain number of properties throughout the world.

The properties are International Airports, Energy Centers, Transport Centers, Communication Centers as well as 4 hotels per continent. The hotels are all of the Hilton line (Hilton and British Airways have a shared advertisement on the reverse side of the board.)

The players 'fly' around the world on their personal jets, paying rents on the properties they land upon and purchasing Options to purchase the property on future turns. The game employs a Roll and Move mechanism upon a five-sided board. Players use acquired cards to short cut the process by arriving at properties of the player's choosing. Auctions are held when a player can not meet their financial obligations.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mind Power
description: Edward De Bono's "Mind Pack" has a book (Mind Power) and a package of pieces that are used to play over 80 games and exercises to help with thinking more efficiently, creatively and have greater concentration. This product teaches 'lateral thinking' techniques. This is taking familiar ideas and associations and redefining them to make everyday thinking enjoyable. It also includes his famous Six Hats thinking technique, which uses role-playing to help you realize your full mind power. The Mind Pack package comes with two sheets of gaming tokens, a gaming board and three decks of specialized cards. All of these pieces, plus the creative thinking ideas within the book itself can lead one to developing and exploring board game creation in directions not previously explored.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Dice, Economic, Educational, Math, Maze, Memory, Negotiation, Party Game, Political, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Hazard
description:
HAZARD - The Ultimate Golf Board Game. Play the course and avoid the hazards. 18 holes of exciting golf - whatever the weather.

HAZARD can be played by any number of players in pairs, foursomes, or alone against the course. Players draw five cards representing a 'wood', 'long iron', 'mid iron', 'short iron' and 'pitch, chip or putt'. Each card has a different stroke indicator informing you of distance, hook or slice, and by using the card in any one of four directions allows you unlimited combinations of shots.

As in real golf, mistakes occur. So when the ball strays from the fairway or into a bunker, 'rough' or 'bunker' cards are drawn to continue play.

Each hole ends when the player lands in a hole or on the green which indicates the number of putts to finish.

Hazard can be played against the course par of 72, or 'hole for hole' as in matchplay. Description

name: Een zaak van mensen
description:
This game was published as a publicity stunt to promote starting your own business. It involves secretly bidding your assets in categories like 'service', 'personality', 'Quality', etc. to lure the next customer away from the other entrepreneurs, and into your own shop.

Last player to have assets (cards) in his hand wins.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Jerusalem Bus Stop
description: In Jerusalem Bus Stop you play a tourist wanting to see all the major sites in Jerusalem. The board, while now outdated, is based upon a map of the city with the major locations spread out by different routes through the city and "?" spaces and bus stop spaces along the route. You move by rolling a die and when you land on a "?" space or a bus stop space you draw a card. Question mark cards require you to answer a question about Jerusalem correctly and rewards with bonus movement. Bus stop cards teleport the player around the board to different sites. The first player to visit all the major sites wins.

name: The Christmas Game
description: To be the first player or team who has given all of their money to charity by answering various Christmas trivia questions.

name: Das Autospiel
description:
This card game comes with a deck of 90 cards:

- 24 car factory cards (A,B,C,D)
- 36 car parts cards (1,2,3,4,5,6)
- 18 chassis cards (L,M,R)
- 6 money cards (jokers)
- 6 crisis cars

Each player is dealt 13 cards. Object of the game is to collect a complete factory, all 6 parts and 3 chassis of the same color.

But the players must first collect (lay on the table) a complete factory, before they can start to lay down part cards. And the 3 chassis cards can not be laid out before the 6 different part cards are on the table.

name: Team Out! Baseball
description:
From the box description:

Team Out! is the ultimate card game for those who love to be part of the action at all times! This 60 card deck with its blistering action cards makes everyone a target and a power.

Each player is dealt seven cards; then it's time to PLAY BALL! Prevent opponents from forming a team of MLB PLAYERS, while building your own. Use awesome Action cards like the Double Play card to throw opponents' players out and draw again, bomb pitchers and remove them from the game! No one is safe in this game -- play Action cards on any opponent.

name: Skittle Bingo
description: Bingo with a skittle twist. Players spin a roulette wheel style device to draw numbers for play in bingo.

name: Kikeriki
description:
From publishers website:
On the farm there is a lot to do: The animals have to be woken and fed. Sometimes they hide themselves. The ones with a good memory can find them. If you know the colors a little and have some luck with the dice, you can collect the most animal cards.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Farming, Memory
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Kallisti
description:
Free download / print and play game. From the description at the download page of the POEE UK Resource Center (http://elstiko.googlepages.com/):

Kallisti is a fnord game. Board games usually have four sides. Board games are usually flat. Board games usually cost money and aren't downloaded and assembled by your own hands. Kallisti beta testing has been abandoned in favor of PUBLIC RELEASE. Kallisti is now yours and you may test, amend and bastardize to suit yourselves. Enjoy! Or don't! It's up to you! Kallisti is a game for 2, 3 or 5 players Ages 5 and up. It is freely distributed (KopyLeft) All Rites Reversed. Reprint what you like. We hope ERIS would approve. The fnord has 5 sides, each side has 5 parts, there are 5 characters, you use a pentagonal spinner for movement, there are 5 suits of cards with 23 cards in each suit. Over the five parts of your part of the board you traverse 23 spaces. The first player to the 23rd space wins. Kallisti is brought to you by eL_sTiKo of the Cuckoo Trail Cabal, East Sussex, Saturn.
mechanics: Acting, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: (Public Domain), (Web published), Distraction League of the Cuckoo Trail Cabal, POEE UK Resource Centre

name: Camorra
description:
This game is played on a simplified map of Naples. The board shows 4 administration offices, about 100 houses of 4 different categories and clearly marked streets and places.

Each player chooses a headquarter, where his actions begin. He will hire some tokens, send them out to claim a street, a place or occupy a house. Houses are the only possibility to earn money, but money is much needed, because every location must be defended (with money) against hostile take-overs.

Hiring new tokens is always possible, but the more money you collect, the more they cost. Streets and places are needed to accelerate the movement of the tokens and can only be used by their owners.

Winner of the game is the player who occupies 3 administration offices first – or 4, if a longer game is desired.

name: Schere, Stein, Papier
description:
Each of the 3 players has 10 double sided playing pieces:

- 3 x Rock/Scissors
- 3 x Scissors/Paper
- 3 x Paper/Rock
- 1 king (showing Rock, Scissors or Paper on both sides)

The game is played on a triangular board of 45 hexes. Each corner section of the board is reserved as staring position for the 3 players, but the arrangement of the pieces can be freely chosen.

Object of the game is to capture the opposing kings. The player with a king is the winner.

Each turn, a player can move 1 stone and flip over 1 stone. Captures are done by comparing the upper(valid) side of a stone using the well known Rock-Scissors-Paper mechanism.

name: Obstsalat
description:
The game "Obstsalat" (=fruit salad) was included in Spielbox 1/87 as part of the "Spiel zum Herausnehmen/Game to Remove" series.
The board is divided into 4 parts. Each part is the playing sector of one of the 2-4 players.

Object of the game is to move all 6 playing pieces to the final space in the middle of the board. The first player reaching this, is the winner.

Movement is done by throwing 2 dice, one normal die and one colour die. The normal die determines the number of spaces a playing piece can move, the color die enables the use of shortcuts of the appropriate color, though throwing black lets the piece move backwards.

Jumping over pieces is not allowed and landing on an occupied space lets the piece go back to the start.

name: O.S.U.opoly
description: As you might expect, this is a Monopoly version based on The Ohio State University. The game functions exactly like Monopoly, however, as you may expect, the locations on the board are based on locations in the vicinity of Ohio State. Locations include: South Campus, The Oval, St. John Arena, Ohio Stadium, Long's Bookstore, and many others. Of course, since this game was produced in 1986, some of the locations are dated and may not exist any more, like Papa Joe's, which sadly burned down more than 10 years ago.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Road Runner
description:
Road Runner is a free print-and-play game based on the Looney Tunes cartoons. All players are coyotes, and all are trying to catch the Road Runner, while stopping the others from doing it first. It is available at:

http://www.dangermouse.net/games/roadrunner.html
categories: Animals, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Secret Mission
description:
The setting is the American Revolution. Players are secret agents racing to send a secret message from Boston to Philadelphia. The first to reach Philadelphia wins.

On a player's turn, he rolls the dice to determine how many steps he must move. He can choose the direction to move. Some spaces provide a card. Cards are a mixture of good events, bad events, and also tools that can be kept and later used to overcome obstacles on the map.

This game is published in the World magazine, which is a children's magazine published by National Geographic, in the 80's.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Racing, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame

name: Jacob und seine Freunde
description:
Jacob, a comic figure drawn by Sven Hartmann, is a cat. He has 4 animal friends, Pump, Flap, Pingi and Patsch - all are seen here.

The game is played on a 9x8 board. 20 tiles show 4 x Jacob and his 4 friends. The tiles are randomly placed on the board face down. Each player puts the playing piece of his neighbor on an empty space of the board and the game can begin.

Object of the game is to collect 4 tiles with each friend of Jacob. The player who achieves this first, is the winner of the game.

Movements of the playing pieces are handled in a very unusual way: each row of the board shows a number, which indicates the distance that a pieces must move (in any direction). If a piece lands on a tile, the player looks at it secretly and keeps it, if he does not have it already. If he finds a piece already in his collection, he puts it back on a empty space of his choice. This can not only confuse the player's memory, it can also be made in a more strategical way, because the movements of the playing pieces are defined by the already mentioned number of the rows.

name: Malcolm in the Middle
description: Players answer questions about the Malcolm in the Middle television show while collecting money for right answers. Wrong answers have the money going to a jackpot. The first player to collect $100 wins.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Battelo
description:
Battelo is a memory and strategy game. Players move their panda bear through the forest according to the memo tiles they draw and try to be the first to collect 4 different colored leaves in their backpacks.

Age: 4+

name: Clown
description:
Remember the clowns clothes!

Objective for the game:
Try to remember how the clown on the clown card was dressed, and give the clown on the basic card the same clothes before the timer runs out!
The player who has collected the most points after 10 turns wins.

(From the box - translated from Danish)

name: Steward
description:
Steward

In STEWARD, your mission is to manage and multiply the riches that have been entrusted to you.

Great riches are in your hands • What will you do with them

Make different purchase in order to produce olive oil, clay pots, food grains, clothes and more. Buy and export stone to build houses or temples or become the biggest copper producer in your area. Discover the Biblical Principles that will make you a Great Steward! Never forget to tithe on all your income. It will be the key to your prosperity. Use strategy to succeed in the challenge that has been entrusted to you and by doing so become THE BEST STEWARD.

STEWARD • A captivating game that you will certainly enjoy and that will be the source of many unforgettable moments with your family and your friends.

name: Hickery Dickery Clock
description:
Hickery Dickery Clock is an easy game for children age 4 and up, about telling time and matching funny faces.

Object: Race against Timothy Mouse by striking each hour of the clock before turning up all 4 Timothy Mouse cards. Players win by matching all the hours on the clock before the last Timothy Mouse card is turned up.

Contents:

5 piece jigsaw game board with clock hands
deck of game cards with clock pictures

name: Alpenreise
description:
The board shows the German Alps and the villages and cities situated in that area. The different locations are connected by lines.
The players draw a card and place a flag into the according location. In addition they draw cards from every color on the board, which then represents their travel route. Other cards are telegram cards (describing a special occurrence) and pass cards (which are used to travel over mountains).
The players roll a dice and move accordingly. Whoever manages to visit all his locations and returns to his starting point first, wins.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mad Gab Mania
description:
Classic Mad Gab goes digital as Mad Gab Mania adds visual and audio clues as well as other challenges that creates a whole new way to play. Programmable Game Buzzers let teams compete head to head for lightning-quick play!

Features:
- Steal points by unscrambling "Scramble Swipes."
- You make the choice and control the game with "Pass or Play."
- If you're behind, you can get help from "The Equalizer."

name: The Original Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer
description: Take Rudolph's place at the head of Santa's sleigh as you guide the team through adventure-filled skies. Learn to be a leader and to share. Pick up action cards along the way with messages that give children of all ages life-long lessons about teamwork, diversity, consideration and more. Look for Rudolph's red nose to appear magically on select action cards. Be the first to place all your Rudolph gifts under the tree and win.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: King Chip
description:
King Chip: The Computer Game That Doesn't Require A Computer

1980's computer trivia for 1 to 6 players with 4050 questions and answers in 5 levels with the categories:

Data Communication
History & Current Events
Hardware
Jargon & Acronyms
Potpourri
Software

Includes a 'Certificate of Authenticity' assuring that this copy came from the first 10,000 game production run. This copy is No. 10,007!

Published in Markham, Ontario, Canada

name: Komm raus, du Wurm
description:
Several colorful worms are hiding in the earth (slots in the game box). Only their head is showing, their tail (different length - 6-9 segments) is hidden. Now Flip the bird is trying to pull them out of their hiding place.

Each player rolls a die (that shows the numbers 2-6, and a wild card). He moves Flip that number of spaces along his track. If there is a worm at this spot, he pulls out that many segments. If this pulls out the worm completely, he collects it. Goal is to collect 3 worms.

Ages 4 and up.

name: Das große Hessenspiel
description: New Essen 2006 game from Kosmos about facts of the German federal state Hessen.

name: Schatzjagd
description:
This game was published in the German zine "Pöppel-Revue" 6/86. According to the description, the original title of this game from Derek Carver was "Loot".

6 or 8 (!) players start with 2 treasure hunters and 1 guard in the middle the board to search for 16 treasures of different value. The board has 8 rings with an increasing number of spaces on them; the 16 treasures are placed at some of the 28 outer spaces of the board.

The tokens can have 4 different colors and 4 different shapes in a 8-player's game (3 and 3 in a 6-player's game), but each player has 3 equal tokens. That means, one player may have 3 blue round tokens, another 3 red square tokens, a next 3 yellow hex tokens, and so on - each color and shape on a total of 6 tokens.

Unique is the idea, that treasures can only be dug out by more than 1 player! How many and what kind of tokens are needed, is marked on each treasure chest, which covers the treasure (e.g. 3 tokens of different shape, or 4 tokens of 4 different colors).

Once, a treasure is dug out, it belongs to the whole group of tokens, but it must be transported back to the middle of the game board, where only 1 player can claim it. Needless to say, that several alliances, (broken) promises and other bluffs are usual, especially since the guard pieces can attack the hunters to steal the treasures from them.

The game ends, when all treasures are dug out, or when one player has claimed a certain amount of treasures - or when a certain time limit is reached.

name: Tactoe Tactix
description:
Noughts and Crosses ( Tic-Tac-Toe ) with a twist. Each row of the vertical board can be slid one space left and right. If, by moving the row a token moves over an empty spot below then it will drop. If the token is moved over the edge of the "board" then it drops out altogether. This means that only tokens placed in the middle column are safe from ever being ejected from the board.

The game has much more scope for strategy than normal Noughts and Crosses, either by (re)moving your opponents pieces or moving your own.

name: Spics
description:
The game equipment for Spics consists of 36 pegs, 6 each of 6 colors, and a circular board with 36 holes arranged in 3 concentric rings. The holes are marked with the same 6 colors as the pegs, and are arranged so that no two holes of the same color are adjacent.

In the 2-player game, one player places 3-12 pegs in holes of matching colors, and the other player attempts to place the remaining pegs correctly from the back of the board - the holes go all the way through, and are not marked on the back. Points are lost for every incorrectly-placed peg. The players then switch sides.

In the 1-player game the player creates his or her own puzzle by placing pegs while trying not to pay attention to the other holes.

name: Peanuts: The Game of Charlie Brown and His Pals
description: Based on the Charles M. Schulz comic strip, this game has players rolling a die and moving around a board to Hideouts or the Booby Hatch in an attempt to collect a sequence of 5 cards (Charlie Brown and Violet; Schroeder and Lucy; Linus and Shermy; Patty and Pig Pen; and Snoopy), or 4 cards plus the "Peanuts" card. Contents are a board, 4 wood pawns, 21 cards, 1 die.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Elvis Trivia Game Collector's Edition
description:
What was Elvis’ highest-grossing film? What was the first song Elvis recorded? Answer these questions, spend some time with the “King of Rock & Roll” and play a game bursting with fun, interesting facts about one of the world’s greatest entertainers!

Spanning his boyhood and rise to fame to his films and final concerts, this collector’s edition takes players on a photographic journey showcasing 1,000 question and answers and 200 colorful pictures, packaged in a collectible tin. Earn bonus points for singing an Elvis song.

name: Scrabble Brand Turntiles
description: Turntiles is a Scrabble brand game for ages 8 to adult. Played without a board, players have one minute to use their 7 large double-sided wooden tiles to form words crossword-style. Point values for letters are the same as Scrabble. A player may change an opponent's previous word by turning over a tile from that word and adding at least one new letter from his/her tiles. Contents include a drawstring bag with 61 tiles and 1-minute timer.

name: Stupid Little Soccer Game
description:
A newer version of this game was released in March 2015: Little Football Game. Better rules, more tactical and strategic decisions to make and less luck. You can choose between six different teams. They all have there own strengths and weaknesses.

"Stupid Little Soccer Game is a card game for 2 players. It is played in less than 30 minutes. Both players manage their football club. They try to buy the best players. After that, they do their best to win an exciting football match."

The game consists of only 23 cards. Download them, print them and make your own free game in just a few minutes.

You can find the manual and a good playing example at:

http://www.elveneargames.nl/SLSG_en.htm

This is a free game downloadable from the publisher's site. Just print and play.

name: WoRDWeRX
description:
WoRDWeRX is played on a 5×5 grid. Each player in turn writes a letter in one of the 25 spaces on the grid. Letters may not be re-used. The object of the game is to be the first player to make a 3+ letter word.

WoRDWeRX was written as a quick play-by-email game in the fall of 1996. It lived for some time at the Cheapass website. WoRDWeRX was included in Chief Herman's Holiday Fun Pack.

name: Snakebite
description:
This is a press your luck game with components based on a Native American game called the Stick Game. With the new rules it is similar to the dice game Pig Dice.

Players toss the sticks. Each snake that is shown on the result of a toss counts as a point. A player can stop tossing and store those points or toss again. If the player ever gets a "snakebite" (two snakes shown and the man), all points from that turn are lost.

name: Golfette
description: Board game based on Golf. Nine hole course on the board is played twice. The course has all the usual hazards, bunkers, water hazards, out of bounds, and rough. Recovery from hazards is achieved using two packs of cards, distance and direction of shots from a chosen club determined by two different size dice. The game can be played by up to 8 players in pairs or two to four singles.
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Tompsett Productions Ltd

name: Die wilden Fussballkerle: Das Rennen
description:
You can count on cool bikes and fast tracks, because the Unbesiegbaren Sieger (Unbeatable Victors) have challenged the Wilden Kerle (Wild Boys) to a bicycle race. Round after round, the bikes race over the track, but everywhere, the low tricks of the opponents lurk. Using honey-feather-cannons, roller-bicycles and other mean things they try to push the competition out of the race. Every inch counts, and so a lot of riders lose the overview in the all-out trick-cards duel.

The game consist of: 1 Gameboard, 20 Pawns, 10 Wilde Fußballkerle, 10 Unbesiegbare Sieger, 1 measuring stick, 20 trick cards, 10 power chips, 1 cloth bag.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Armada
description: This game comes from a company called Chad Valley and was produced in the mid 1920's. The object of the game was to shoot down and therefore sink your opponents sailing ships using balls fired from two working lead cannons.

name: Dilex
description: This game comes in a box (7¾" x 5¾"). It is a crossword puzzle type game. The game comes with lettered dice which are rolled and then those letters are used to help make a crossword puzzle. The game comes from a company of the same name (DILEX COMPANY) and appears to be from the early to mid 1950's.

name: Abenteuer USA
description:
Every player undertakes a road trip through the USA. While traveling the player's goal is to visit all locations as fast as possible. To prove this to the other players every player has to get a postcard from each location.
The players have to answer questions whenever they don't land on a location, but on an open field. The cards have questions divided into three categories: easy, medium, hard. All questions are in English and you have to answer in English (note that this is a German game).
If a player hits a special location, he takes the postcard from that location, reads it out aloud and places it in front of him. Whoever visits all 15 locations first wins.

name: DOT-O
description:
From the box:

It's easy to get started: Just play a Number 1. Then build a pile from Number 1 to Number 5. BUT BE CAREFUL! An opponent may get you with a DOWN-A-DOT-O card, which will send your pile a tumbling!... Until you counter with a ZAP-A DOWN-A-DOT-O! Then play it safe with ADD-A-DOT-O NO DOUBT-O, and maybe you will win!

name: De Einsteincode
description: De Einsteincode is a cardgame with 36 number cards and 16 code cards that form the letters x,y,z and t. With the letter cards a code is formed that should be guessed by the other players.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Memory, Word Game

name: Zygomar
description: Zygomar is a clown with the multiple aspects who will pose a series of varied challenges in the areas of observation, speed, anticipation, memory, mime, or even logic.

name: Jungle Jaws
description:
Jungle Jaws is a simple children's game that involves catapulting your insects into the jaws of the waiting Venus Flytraps The winner is the person who gets the most bugs into the jaws of the jungle plants!

This is a great looking game with a 2 level board - four colorful Venus Flytraps on stalks and 4 sets of 4 plastic insects in different colors. You also get 4 leaf themed catapults to launch your insects. The board is held together with 1 large elastic band and the jaws of the Flytraps also snap closed thanks to elastic bands too.

The nice thing is that each bug is different instead of 4 identical ones and that the game looks great when assembled.

name: Keep the Customer
description:
An industry-training boardgame to teach healthcare professionals and para-staff the finer points of customer service excellence from the customer's point of view so they are prepared for those tricky situations before they are faced with them in reality. Uses roll-a-die-move-around-the-board mechanics and a set of scenarios taken from real-life to role-play and discuss.

Components: 65 cards, board, game pieces, and a Healthcare Edition Facilitators Guide.
Also comes in a Call Center edition.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: The Story Game
description:
This addictive game draws out the life stories - the funny, the embarrassing, the touching, the profound - things you've always wanted to share and maybe a few things you didn't. You're sure to learn something new about the other players whether you've known them for 20 minutes or 20 years!

Wannabe storytellers of the world, unite - you have nothing to lose but your boredom!

www.thestorygame.com

name: Len Choa
description: Len Choa is one of a number of "Leopard Games", abstract hunt games played on a triangular board. This is the simplest of them, from Thailand, with one tiger facing six leopards on a board of ten points. First observed by westerners in 1836 but probably older.

name: Running for President
description:
The gameboard is a map of the United States displaying 128 cities. There are four types of cities. Depending on the type of city a player’s pawn lands a player may raise funds, spend funds to get vote chips, declare vote chips for a state in the hopes of getting a plurality to earn that state’s electoral votes or go head-to-head with another opponent in a debate. Lines connect the cities to regulate the movement of the players’ pawns.

The players divide $72 million dollars and each chooses a different city to start the game. To move, a player rolls the die and advances that many cities unless the roll in a one and that allows a free move to anywhere on the gameboard. The city landed upon regulates what a player’s actions are on that turn. After taking one’s turn the player advances the calendar pawn one day. The game is over after seventy-two days. The players add up their votes and each state’s electoral votes are awarded to the player who has the most votes. Ties go to whomever rolls the higher number. States where no one has any votes goes to the player who has declared the most popular votes in that region. The player who has the most electoral votes is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jagd über Etappen
description: East-German cycling game. Each player controls a team of 4 cyclists. The game is not dice controlled and not with cards either. In fact it has quite a tactical system, the rules are quite simple but don't depend on luck. Per turn each cyclist can use either 3,4,5 or 6 action points to move the same number of squares (each number can be used only once). There can't be more than one rider on a square (except the blue ones), so riders can eventually be blocked. The red marks are intermediate sprints, where 4 points are awarded to the winner. The blue squares are punctures. There are also bonus points for a cyclists who helps another cyclist (for example after a puncture), this bonus is added because of 'comradely behavior' (the communist regime clearly showing here). At the end of the race every cyclist gets points (80 for the winner, 76 for the second,...). Now the players add up the finishing-points and bonus points of their 4 cyclist to determine who wins the game. The board (58*32cms.) looks surprisingly beautiful and well designed for an East-German game, the cyclist are also well produced, in plastic. Nice vintage game for collectors of sports games.

name: Buck Rogers in the 25th Century, A Card Game
description: A children's card game with numbered cards colorfully depicting characters and spaceships from the comic strip.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Science Fiction

name: Swissair
description:
Swissair is played on a large world map. It shows 90 airports of different values, where the 39 most valued ones can be purchased by the players. There are several flight routes on the map also; routes attended by Swissair can be run for free, while flying on other routes are with costs.

Each player has 1 airplane as playing piece. 30 flight cards tell the players, which routes they must fly with their airplanes. Money is paid when a route is completed.
Purchasing airports can be advantageous also, because players landing on them must pay airport taxes.

The game ends, when all 30 flights are completed. Winner of the game is the player with the most points; owned airports and money earned is converted to points for that reason.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: König Krösus
description:
The gameboard shows 5 rows of 8 spaces. The rows are numbered from 100-500 and marked 500-2500 at the side.

The 40 spaces of the board are filled with 1 coin of different values. During a turn, a player must take 1 coin from the bottom and he can place any number of coins back. When a coin is placed back on the board, the sidewards marked amount of money is collected.

Winner of the game is the player who has earned 50,000 first.

Apparently developed from The Economy Game reducing it to the pure and basic mechanism.

name: Torment
description: Crossword game. Cards provide categories and three different grids allow for different levels of play. Players fill in the blank grids "across" first for five points each and then add "down" answers for ten points each. A bonus is added for completing the grid. Includes pads of grids, pencils, eraser and "egg timer".

name: Merry Motorist Game
description:
This game is a race to the finish. Several pitfalls and twists and turns await your journey home. This game is similar to an advanced chutes and ladders as some paths let you skip past sections and others send you back. Action cards also affect your play along the way.

The board itself is a giant puzzle and comes in 6 large pieces that fit together to form the board.

name: B.S.A. Cycle Race
description: Small simple cycling game released by the Chad Valley Company released somewhere in the 1930's. Movement is decided by dice rolling, certain spaces have text in them that can cause bad luck. The game was released to promote the B.S.A. company who were well known for their motorbikes but they also had a range of bicycles in their catalog in those days.

name: Resi und Rudi Ringel
description:
Description of the game from the Spielbox:

Resi and Rudi Ringel, the two young caterpillars, were brought to life by Brigitte Pokornik. Resi and Rudi want to know which of them is faster! Ready, set, go: The race over stick and stone is on. On a player's turn, he rolls the die. The end of the caterpillar is always placed ahead of the head, so long as the color collar is ahead as well. Then, the caterpillar's head is moved to that color. If a player rolls a color that the head is already on, then he may put a barrier up in front of the other caterpillar. That player must now navigate past the barrier. As soon as a caterpillar touches the goal flag, the game is over.

name: Hungry Hound
description: This is a battery operated kids game that has a motorized hound dog in the middle of the game which spins around, opening and closing it's mouth as players try to flip small bone-shaped chips from small spring-loaded paws into it's mouth. It is very similar, if not identical, in game-play to "Mr. Mouth"

name: Daisy Racy
description: The lambs frolic and romp on the meadow. The mother sheep have eaten almost everything in the meadow so they must make their way together with their lamb over to another grazing spot. To ensure that none of them gets lost, the little lambs must always stay close to their mothers. To encourage them not to forget in their exuberance, they are given daisies as rewards if they follow their mothers instead of running on ahead.

name: Galathea ekspeditionen
description:
Follow in the footsteps of the Danish Galathea 3 expedition. The biggest Danish scientific expedition in 50 years. It plays two ways; get fastest through the ships route, or fill the log book first, both ways you have to have the right answers.

Contains: 1500 questions in the categories: Expeditions,nature & technology, history & culture and geography.
25 picture cards, 1 board, 6 game pieces, and a dice.

name: International Airport FRA
description:
This game was published in 1988 in association with Frankfurt International Airport - Flughafen Franfurt Main - in Germany. It comprises two distinct games, the "Passenger Game", in which players race to move their passengers through the airport, whether arriving, departing or in transit, and the "Air Traffic Control Game", in which players attempt to move their planes using the least amount of energy.

The game provides publicity for Frankfurt International Airport and was later reissued simply titled Airport, without the Frankfurt branding, by Verlag Herder.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Charmed: Le Pouvoir des Trois
description: In Charmed - the Power of Three, the players strive to obtain the coveted Power of Three. Each player is one of the characters of the TV series, either one of the three Halliwell sisters (Piper, Paige, Phoebe), or one of the three leaders of the underworld (the Source, Cole Turner, the Seer). The players act in teams, using the powers of their characters to overcome their adversaries.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mecki & Co.
description:
A game with 120 hedgehog spines! Players try to fully "outfit" their hedgehog with spines before everyone does, using a counting mechanism to help train facility with numbers.

Ages 4 and up.

PROMOTES FIRST COUNTING AND FINE MOTOR SKILL.

Contents:
• 1 wooden game board (370 x 370 x 10 mm)
• 120 spines
• 1 basket
• 1 dice (1-3)
• 1 dice (1-6)
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

name: Bingo Bongo
description: Green jungle everywhere, a large palm tree with the last coconut of the season and some very cheeky monkeys. Be careful, only the fastest up the truck will get the coconut!

name: Bug Collector Card Game
description:
This game for ages 4 and up has two sets of cards. One contains the characters from the Pixar movie "A Bug's Life", the other is a series of jungle scenes with the characters hidden in them. The jungle scenes are spread out on the table and the character cards are in a deck. As the cards are drawn from the deck you have to find which jungle card contains the character.

There are also two bird cards which return some bug cards from your collection to the deck.

name: Numerology: The Science of Numbers
description: Game uses numerology to help the players understand themselves and the world around them.

name: Your Surprise Package
description:
The object of the game is to guess what prize you are about to win. A player begins the round with the cash value of the secret prize. Cash is taken away for each clue given about the prize and the time used by the player in asking yes-or-no questions about the prize. The player with highest value in cash and prizes after a predetermined number of rounds is the winner.

The game is a faithful reproduction of the short-lived game show hosted by George Fenneman, although it is sometimes referred to as Surprise Package due to the "Your" on the cover being very small.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Real-time

name: Iraqi Conflict
description:
Card game with variants for 2-5 Players.

Simulation of the post US Invasion Reconstruction Period of Iraq. Insurgency and Civil Wars are treated as separate conflicts, thus encouraging negotiations and card trading with Factions you are not directly competing against. 100 Card common Deck. Cards are specific to certain Factions. Hands are Scored at the end of every Turn. Highest total score at game end wins.

name: Let's Get Personal
description: Let’s Get Personal is a controversial, conversational game for adults that gives you your chance to express opinions on a wide variety of topics. Your partner must correctly guess your answer to the situation before you can continue around the unique playing board. The game is a forum for finding out more about your friends and yourself in a light-hearted format that encourages involvement without risking embarrassment.

name: Realms: Elves & Orcs
description:
Jarn watched as the orc hoard rushed forward, heading right for him and the other elves standing beside him. They all stood in a straight line before their sacred forest home, each having sworn an oath to protect it from these foul folk.

Overhead the high elven king rode the winds upon the back of his dragon steed, but even with such a mighty beast on their side, Jarn did not think he and the other elves would hold the day. The mass of green orcs were to many he feared, and his folk far to few.

Realms is the newest Mini-game from Bad Baby Productions. Take the side of the bright elven nations or the foul orc hoards, as the two battle for control of the world.

A fast paced fantasy game of warfare, spells, magical items and mighty beasts, all will be under you control as you battle your foe. Can you out last, out fight and out maneuver your enemy, or will you fall to their sharp edged sword.

name: Occhio!
description:
Perfect information abstract strategy game.

The game is played on a circular board.
Every player starts with six pieces of two kinds (plus other four pieces to "set free").
At your turn you have two moves (move two pieces, or move a piece twice).
It is possible to jump over other pieces (friendly ones or enemy ones), but only in straight line.
A piece is eliminated when, at the end of a turn, it is adjacent to two opponent's pieces.
Goal of the game is to reduce opponent's free pieces to one.

A variant in the rulebook adds some random factor.

This game won the "Best of Show" prize for the best Italian game in the "Lucca Games" convention, year 1997.

"Occhio" is the Italian word for "Eye".

name: Wörterschlange
description: A sort of Dominoes. The children place the cards next to each other. They can choose to take the same words or singular and plural of a word or they match a word to the picture.

name: Three Rings
description: A simple board game that involves rolling a four sided die and moving ones pieces over the board. The object of the game is to flip your opponents three pieces over. The rules for the game and an image of the gameboard can be seen at http://www.freewebs.com/threeringsgame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bootsy
description:
CONTENTS
game board
5 boots
1 hopscotch card
1 token stone

OBJECTIVE
to be the first to get your boot home

A roll and move children's game with a fun and clever twist: instead of using dice to move the game uses a hopscotch. So you have some control over the movement.

name: Portfolio
description:
Portfolio is a strategic game of finance and asset allocation that's fun, fast-paced and easy to learn. Players buy stocks, bonds, and mutual funds and accumulate cash all while dealing with inflation, economic factors, quarterly loss and profits as they compete to build their personal Portfolio. There are trivia questions that allow players to choose, from easy to more difficult, for money rewards.

Re-implemented by:

Petfolio (Children's Version)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: An Income of Her Own
description: Players compete as teams or individuals. Starting with a $1000 loan each entity moves on a separate track. Each space rewards cash, penalizes cash, results in a chance event or quiz about business. Before the game begins the players decide on the end game or victory conditions. Money is recorded on a ledger.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Siege of Bodenburg
description:
Siege of Bodenburg is a set of rules for a miniatures wargame scenario. The setting is a highly fictionalized battle in late medieval or early Renaissance Europe. According to game historian, Jon Peterson, Siege of Bodenburg is noteworthy as an early influence on Gary Gygax in the development of the miniatures game, Chainmail and eventually, Dungeons & Dragons.

In the scenario, Count von Boden is expecting a wagon train of supplies from Wernigerode to arrive but is instead attacked by invading Huns and Turks. The castle needs to hold out until the wagon train and its defending Lansquenets arrive, or until the rest of the Count's knights return from the tournament in Quedlinburg.

The rules are close tactical, with each figure representing a single man. They are designed for 40mm Elastolin figures and accessories, but since they give movement allowances and firing ranges in numbers of sectors (squares) rather than inches, the game could easily be played in other scales or even as a board game. The rules are fairly elaborate, with sections for hidden movement, sallies, scaling ladders, supplies, morale, etc.

Siege of Bodenburg was published in Strategy & Tactics Volume I, Numbers 6-10. It is misspelled "Siege of Bodenberg" on the cover of issue #6 and on the map in that issue. Bodenstedt also printed up copies of the rules which he gave out in his store and at conventions.

name: Hot Dog
description:
Dog and Cat - the tricky cat-catcher.
A memory game for children aged 5-14. Lead your cats (represented by black and white plastic sticks) through the dog labyrinth. Whoever manages to rescue most of his cats from the lurking dogs wins.

The idea is to get your 'Cat Pins' across rows of dogs and to the other side of the boards. Each player attempts to do the same. 'Dog Stops' are secretly placed by each player in their own board which players must avoid while crossing.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Memory

name: Love and Marriage
description:
A single card is distributed to each player. The cards are numbered 1,2,3,... with ten cards more than there are players. Players have three minutes to find a partner and put their cards on the score chart, which is numbered 100,95,90... Each team's base score is divided by the difference between their cards. For example, players with a base score of 90 and cards 41 and 45 would score 22.5 points. The player with the smaller number in each pair gets a 5 point bonus.

At the end of the round, first place gets 5 points, second place gets 4 points, etc. At the end of five rounds the player with the highest score wins.

There are several variants:

1) Lying - players do not have to reveal their actual card numbers.

2) Cheating - players can cancel a marriage if they find a better partner. Players who are dumped receive a 5 point bonus on the round. Emptied spaces on the score track are not refilled.

3) The Big Trick - play the game with two different groups. With one group, describe the game mathematically. With the other, describe it romantically. Compare the differences in behavior of the players.

Love and Marriage was created for a middle school teacher who was looking for a good interactive classroom game on the subject of love and marriage. It was included in Chief Herman's Holiday Fun Pack.

name: Plotz!
description: With a box cover featuring characters from Johnny Hart's comic strip "B.C." this game has players rolling dice and competing to be the first player to place his marble in the correct hole of a grid. The first player to place three marbles of his color in a row wins.

name: Royal Flush
description:
Royal Flush is a spielbox game of the early 90s. It's a cross between Perudo (but with cards) and Poker. Instead of rolling pairs you bid with Poker hands.

Originally published in spielbox magazine.

name: Fury
description:
An old German game from 1961, probably a tie-in to the TV series "Fury" which ran in Germany from 1958 onwards. Up to 4 players move along a string of numbers (87 in total) on the board by rolling a die, 13 fields have special meanings (actions to be taken described in the rulebook), influencing movement positively or negatively.
(game number assigned by Noris Spiele: 204)

name: Battle for Mukden
description: Original game by Masahiro Yamazaki published in Command Magazine Japan #16 in 1997.

name: Battle of Leyte Gulf
description:
Mini-game.

Comprises 4 scenarios of the different phases of the battle:
1) Entrance of Leyte
2) San Bernardino Strait
3) The Chase
4) Surigao Strait

110 Counters.

name: Axiom
description:
In Axiom players compete in the art of knowing dictum and slogans. It can be played with two players to a maximum of six teams consisting of many players.

The idea of the game is simple. You're being asked a question. If you know it you can progress three steps forward on the score board. If you know it after you've given a set of choices, you only take one step forward.

The first player who reaches the end of the score track wins.

name: Tumbling Bob the Builder
description: In this game players add buckets to Bob the Builder's ladder trying not to tip him over. The object is to be the first to get rid of all your buckets. Targeted at the 4+ audience.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: (Unknown), Crown & Andrews Ltd., International Playthings, Inc., Jumbo

name: El Tour
description: Spanish cycling game based on the Tour de France. The game uses dice but also some cards that are used for a sprint, there also is a flat tire card. The game also includes a double sided board with different stages, it even includes some roadsigns.

name: Hunt and Seek Worldwide
description:
The game contains 4 double sided boards, with a detailed image of an exotic location from around the world printed on each side. There is also a set of cards displaying objects that can be found on every board. The objects are hidden within the images so that they mingle with the background, making them hard to spot.

At the beginning of the game, a single board is selected. On each turn, a card is turned face up and players try to spot the object as fast as possible. The first one to do so wins the card. The winner is the player who accumulated the most cards.
