name: Dungeonation
description:
Self-published Heroquest-like game.

This whole game is being redesigned from the ground up (2015).

name: Börja läsa
description:
A game in Kärnan´s line of wooden games for children. This is an educational game to help children learn to read and write. The game features 77 wooden tiles with letters and 8 double-sided boards with pictures and some letters. Players connect tiles to make the words matching the picture on each line.

5 years and up.

name: The Game of the Wizard of Oz
description:
A roll and move game in which players move counters from different initial positions: Dorothy starts in Kansas, the other players in positions ahead of her (Scarecrow, Tin Man, and Lion, in that order.) The point of the game is to reach the Witch's Castle and then return to the Emerald City.

Similar in design and mechanics to the game Kentucky Derby (1938), and of typical quality of other Whitman Publishing games (paper boards, flimsy boxes, and punch-out paper pawns of other games) it looks as if Whitman didn't spend a lot on the construction of their games, apparently blowing all their budget on the purchase of the character license.

The game contains:

Linen paper game board
1 dice
4 wooden markers
Two part box with color pictorial cover (measuring 7"x13"x1")

The featured art, though crude, is apparently inspired by the MGM Wizard Of Oz movie.
categories: Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Racing
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Quadroschach
description: Chess variant for 2 players (using a bigger board), 3 players (2 vs. 1) or 4 players (teams or individual)

name: Jan Murray's Treasure Hunt
description:
Each player will act as quizmaster for another player so everyone can compete. A random category for each round is determined by the Bid Wheel. Every correct answer earns the player fifty dollars. A round consists of four questions for each player. The winner of round chooses a card which represents a treasure chest and its treasure. The player also spins the Bid Wheel. The player may now choose between the known amount on the Bid Wheel (range: $250 to $2000) or take whatever happens to be on the card (range: $0 to $25,000)

The player who chooses and keeps the $25,000 treasure chest card is the immediate winner. Otherwise, the game goes the full four rounds. The winner is the person who has the most money after four rounds of play.

The game is based on a popular television series of the fifties.

name: Your First Impression
description:
The players must deduce which of the six given historical figures is the correct one. The players choose and ask the questions on the cards given to them while the quizmaster responds according to the answer key. The player who gives the correct answer scores points depending on how many questions were asked by the players. The first to score one hundred points is the winner.

The game is loosely based on a television series designed by Monty Hall of Let’s Make a Deal fame. Mr. Hall’s name is misspelled on the box lid.
categories: Deduction, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Diamantenfieber
description: A fishing game with semi-precious stones. Players hide magnetic stones in 12 heaps of non-magnetic stones, then try to fish out as many magnetic stones from all heaps as they can.

name: Kænguru Ræs!
description: Roll-and-move game for children. Each player represents a kangaroo racing to arrive first at the finish line. Along the route, the players can pick up special cards that are needed to overcome certain obstacle squares.

name: Swingolo
description: A simple balancing game for children (5+ years). Players set the wooden bugs on to a big flower that stands on a small base and try to keep it from falling. The game comes with 29 wooden pieces.

name: Jungolo
description:
A board game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher:

"Game where you have to be clever like a monkey and have an elephant's memory. Little monkey's jump from tree to tree with different colored coconuts. Difficult to bring back the right coconuts since the monkey's mischievously hide them."

name: Tesoro
description:
A board game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher:

"Amusing strategy game where pirates loot ships to find gold pieces. Who will get the most ?"

name: Slam Dunk
description:
From the back of the box:
"For 2 or more players (two teams). Ages 8 to adult.

"There isn't much time left in the Slam Dunk Grand Final, & the opposing team is one point ahead.

"It's your turn but the team cards show your player with the ball has the worst shooting range in the team. Will you turn over a game card & try to pass to your best shooter or will you take a chance with the dice on a fast break. Only you can decide.

"The Slam Dunk Board Game has been created in Australia by professional basketball players. It is a game of strategy, chance & trivia, & reproduces the entire basketball contest with passing, two & three point shots, turnovers, rebounds & fouls.

"As Andrew Gaze says the Slam Dunk Board Game has all the excitement [sic] & action of real Basketball."

name: Ballongjakten
description:
In "The Balloon Chase" players are trying to find five balloons, one of each color, for their game boards.

3 years and up

The game is published in Sweden under license from Bar-David, but there doesn't seem to be any other edition of the game.

name: Bewitched
description: Join Samantha (Elizabeth Montgomery), Endora (Agnes Moorehead) and Darren or, as Endora called him, Darwin (Dick York), in this trip around the board, trying to use or not use magic to complete tasks.

name: Tron Skirmish
description:
A set of 6 mini-games based on the Tron world. All 6 games use the same cards so once you have made the cards they are good for all the games. Uses a standard 8x8 chessboard. One player is Tron and his friends. The other player controls the minions of Sark and the MCP (Master Control Program).

http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Tron.html
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Vector V5
description:
Vector V5 is a game of combat between small, fast starships in the distant future. The emphasis in creating these rules has been to provide players with a fast exciting game after a game or two, players will probably not have to refer to the rules at all.

The most innovative aspect of VV5 is the movement system, which is based on the real physics of movement in space. All too often, science fiction films and games assume that starships will behave in the same way as terrestrial ships or aircraft. The truth is quite different as you will see. Once you have played one or two games, the movement rules will become second nature; they're actually much simpler than those used by most other games.

Rules, counters, map, and ship record cards are freely available in Adobe PDF format.

name: Dondi Potato Race Game
description: Dondi Potato Race Game from HASsenfeld BROthers was based on a Comic Strip Character of the time. Simple roll and move game.

name: Focus: Uusi suuri tietopeli
description:
Focus is a trivia game quite similar to Trivial Pursuit. It contains 400 cards with total of 2400 questions in six categories: miscellaneous, science and nature, entertainment, sports and leisure, geography and history.

Collect a token from each category to win.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Slide 'n' Ride
description:
Movement based on color matching. players take turns rolling their ball shaped man down the slide into the pool to see which color the ball will stop on, then the player will transfer their ball onto their life preserver marker and move to the space on the board that matches that color. First person to the balloons wins.

box contains four balls and life preservers, slide pool with ladder, and game board.

from the box

2 skill building games help build these learning and social skills.

color matching
counting
taking turns
winning and losing

no reading required
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: A Christmas Carol
description: Simple board game with trivia added. Using Charles Dickens "A Christmas" as a backdrop, the game allows each player to take the role of one of eight characters from the book, like Scrooge, Tiny Tim, or Fezziwig. The game has players moving around the board collecting tokens. Half of the tokes are gained from reaching one of the buildings on the board, and the other half from answering trivia about "A Christmas Carol." Most questions are easy enough to answer if you've seen a few of the movies, some are more specific to the book. Once a player collects all the tokens, he returns to the center of the board for the win.

name: Get Rollin'!
description: Get Rollin! is a dice rolling game. Each of the four players has an eight space track on the board, a playing piece and five six-sided dice. A large bell is placed in the center space of the board. The leader for a round rolls one die to determine the target number. Immediately after that all players begin rolling all of their dice as fast as possible. Any time a player rolls the target number they must place any dice with that number in the center of the board and call out how many dice along they are toward getting all five with the target number. They then continue to roll the rest of their dice. When a player gets all five of their dice to match, they ring the bell and win the round moving one space on their track.

name: Kalevite Maa
description:
Kalevite Maa ("Land of Kalevs" in translation) is not sophisticated game yet it provides entertainment for parents and children alike. The object of the game is to be the first player to collect three items depicted on a secret quest card. The items - tokens with a picture of an item - are randomly distributed on the game board face down. Players take turns by moving their pawns on the board by one step. If the move ends on an unexplored token the player will claim the token unless the token is a monster in which case the monster has to be defeated first by rolling dice. Some items - sweets, to be precise - boost a player's speed or combat ability.

Kalevite Maa is a promotional boardgame. It is published by a sweets producer - "AS KALEV" - and 3/4 of the relatively large boardgame box is actually filled with sweets. Yet, it is an interesting and engaging game with components of outstanding quality.

name: Remember
description: Remember is a very simple Concentration type game using Slot Machine type symbols like Cherries, and Lemons and Bells. He/She who matches most WINS!

name: Pacific Storm
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple strategic game of the conflict between Japan and America in World War II. The area mapsheet portrays an area of the Pacific from New Guinea to Kyushu. The players control land, sea, and air forces. Each unit is rated for attack, defense, and movement.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Le jeu des 7 dictionnaires
description:
French game based on a show of the RTBF (Radio Télévison Belge).

The player rolls a dice and advances, depending on the type of square he lands on, he might have to guess a definition, guess the author of a quote or even find the words that fit an appropriate combination of another word and its adjectives.

Some areas are specially indicated "dictionnaire" (which means dictionary) and on these areas the questions are related to different categories ( exotic word, lost word, regional word, literature, culinary word, French slang (argot) or words from the francophone world (ex: Quebec, l'Île Maurice, etc.). Each category has a color and a small wooden dictionary.

When a player has a correct answer on one of these areas, he wins the appropriate dictionary. To win the game, the player needs to get a preset number of dictionaries (determined at the beginning of the game by the players).

name: Latin Intervention
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple abstract game about the Cold War struggle for influence in Latin America. The winner is the first player to control five Central American countries, using methods such as monetary aid, agents, Marxist revolutionaries, or military presence.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Die drei ???: Geheimsache Ufo
description:
Deduction card game based on the Three Investigators stories. The 3 ??? are Jupiter, Bob and Pete (in the German version - Justus, Bob and Peter). There are 3 types of suspect cards, place cards and mystery cards and 3 cards which show all 9, plus 3 detective cards (Justus, Bob and Peter), 4 player pieces and the gameboard.

Guess the gameplay could be described as Cluedo meets Go Fish!

name: Wordlink
description: This Scrabble-like game is made in India and is for 2 to 4 players, with a solo game option. Like Scrabble, players draw 7 tiles from a pool of 100 (including two blanks) and try to form words, crossword fashion, on a 16 by 16 square grid. The board includes bonus squares that double, triple or quadruple the word score. There are also squares that allow the player an extra turn. Scores are based on the number of letters in the word - the letters do not have differing point values: they are all worth one point each, except for blanks, which are worth nothing but can be used to represent any letter.

name: Zenergy
description:
More than a boardgame, more than a word game or puzzle, Zenergy is a unique creative sculpture game.

Using the provided wooden blocks, you are asked to symbolize in sculpture ideas ranging from everyday events and objects to abstract concepts.

Challenging yet entertaining, thought provoking and often hilarious, Zenergy is a deceptively simple game and one that will provide hours of fascination.

Rebuild your imagination - play Zenergy.

For teams of 2 or more players, aged 15 to adult.

Contents:
54 wooden blocks
250 cards
1 board
2 dice
counters
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Riachuelo's Naval Battle
description:
The Riachuelo’s Naval Battle is a war game for two players, that reproduces the riverine naval battle of June 11, 1865, where, during the War of the Triple Alliance (known in Brazil as the Paraguayan War). In this battle the admiral Barroso achieved an important victory, destroying a great part of the Paraguayan fleet.

The Naval battle of Riachuelo, was on the Paraná river, in the province of Corrientes, Argentina and is considered by the military historians as one of the most important battles of Triple Alliance War (1864-1865). It is also known as one of the main naval battles of the Brazilian Navy and it guaranteed the supremacy of Brazil in terms of naval control.

The game comes with the following components:
11"x17" Color Map
Rules Booklet with Designer and Historical notes
Player aids
Ship cards
45 counters

The game Riachuelo’s Naval Battle is the first game by Riachuelo Games to be released in English.

The Print-n-Play (PDF) version can be found at:
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=474

The Printed (DTP) version can be found at:
http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/

name: Scavenger Hunt II
description:
Find the items on your list...but first find your list!!

Players explore a board made of face down tiles claiming tiles to build their list and finding the coins for their tiles (items in the list).

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for any two different piecepack sets, totalling eight suits.

name: Luftwaffe 46
description:
Second Ediiton Notes

With the end of the 2nd. world war, the world enters a new political configuration headed by two great blocs: the United States and the Soviet Union. Despite the climate of hope in the division of defeated Germany, a series of suspicions begin to emerge among the old allies. The Russians with control of so-called Eastern Europe awoke among Western allies suspected of a possible breakthrough in 1946.

The Americans along with the British began to reposition the bulk of their troops on German frontiers and began a program to ship supplies and ammunition to their units. In 1947 the Russians also began to move in this chess, with the increase of their military personnel in occupied Germany. In 1948 the first course occurs when Stalin’s armies block Berlin, barring access to supplies and new troops.

The American response comes in two nuclear attacks, one on Moscow with a new American bomb called BlueToddler and another attack on the Soviet heavy industries in the Urals with 3 small tactical bombs known as Nuke Candy. The Russians advance their conventional forces on the allies and a new conflict begins. The allies are now mortal enemies, on the one hand, the Americans, the English, and the French, and on the other hand the Russians and the Chinese, who proclaim themselves communists in 1947, joining the so-called Soviet Federation.

In 1949 is invented by the Russians the engines of macro combustion enabling the introduction of so-called combat mechs. These armaments recover the ground lost by the Soviets, pushing the allies to the borders of Poland. In 1950 the first Russian nuclear bomb explodes over New York, taking the world war to the American soil! In 1951 the Allies entered with their mechs of combat in Europe, bringing the conflict to unimaginable levels.
In this scenario, a powerful organization arises, formed by old Nazis who dream of having a great Germany again: the Werwolf Korps. Hidden in the Bavarian Alps in deep Nazi fortresses, they emerge as a fighting force with fantastic weapons and black magic. These represent one more weight in the pendulum of history.

Luftwaffe 46 is a jet fighter game set in the world of Hotwar, where the war doesn’t end in 1945 but continues as Germany launches its other jet plane projects and fights the allies in dogfights. The rules were made for you to play with miniatures in 1/300 scale, in the absence of them, we supply markers to replace them.

What you will need to play:

1 measuring tape
2 six-sided dice (known as d6)
1 smooth surface (a dining room table for example)
Rulebook (you are reading it now)
Paper and pen
Miniatures for 3D printing (STL FILES) - Available for download, links in the end of the rule book
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Oz Quiz II
description:
A light-hearted quiz game about Australia.

Players (represented by stickers stuck on Australian one-cent coins) move around a cartoon map of Australia answering questions in five categories. "Up The Creek" cards can also be drawn, which can have a positive or negative effect on the position of a player.

The game comes in a foam esky (an esky is an Australian Cooler), and was released to celebrate Australia's bicentenary in 1988.

It is the sequel to the very similar Oz Quiz.

name: Ile Jokisen Kapakkakierros
description:
Ile Jokinen is a Finnish stand-up comedian who created this satiric take on Monopoly. Players are going through pubs and are in constant danger of losing all their money. Luckily every time you pass 'start' the state pays you your unemployment benefit so you can keep on roaming in the pubs. Also the main goal is to be the first to get to a 100% invalidity so you could leave on a pension.
So there are two ways of wining. Be the first to get the invalidity or the last with some money left.

name: Crosse Attack College Lacrosse
description:
Quick-playing but detailed simulations of college lacrosse. Instant download, print and play game.

Features Easy to set up & play: Just shuffle the action cards and play. (If you want to keep score, enter the player and team names onto the provided score sheet

All play derived from 100 "action cards": Each card is 2-sided.

Statistically accurate: Most college teams from the 2005-2006 season, along with the players, are rated in every major statistical category.

Each team and player rated in several categories: Every statistic you would expect to be covered is here. goals, assists, shooting percentage, ground balls, face-off percentage, penalties, clears, assists, man-up shooting percentage & goalkeeper save percentage are all here.

Keep score as you play and compile stats

name: Seek
description:
From the rulebook:
You have heard of a man called Jesus of Nazareth who is performing many amazing miracles; you want to find Him to become one of His disciples. The object of this game is to seek for Jesus in order to answer three questions: (1) Where is He? (2) What is He doing? (3) Who is with Him? The first player to answer these three questions correctly wins the game.

name: Battleship Missile Strike
description:
From the game package:
How will you do in the line of fire?
Seek and destroy your opponent's ships in this all-out, no holds barred dice duel. Secretly set up your tokens on your battlefield and brace yourself as your opponent attacks. Was it a hit or miss? Fire back and see if you can be the first player to sink all of your opponent's ships, and win!

From Erik Arneson's website:
Players first play tokens (numbered 3 to 11) on each of their five ships, making sure to put them in order from lowest to highest -- although duplicate numbers are allowed. To attack, each player rolls three dice and chooses two. They place those two dice next to a token, and if the total equals the value of the token, a hit is scored. Rolls of 2 and 12 are always hits. Unfortunately, this clever Battleship-based dice game is not very easy to find. Your best bet is to look in drug stores and grocery stores.

name: The Brownie Game
description:
Designed in conjunction with the Girl Guides Association.

"Part of the fun of being in the Brownie organization is trying to collect badges by achieving efficiency in a number of categories. The object of this game is just the same. Players have to collect interest badges by successfully answering questions on the subjects chosen."

Players try to collect five badges and be the first to collect the trefoil badge. Players roll a dice to move around the board. Upon landing on an interest badge space, they must choose one of the tiles from a face down selection. Most of the tiles represent Brownie badges in several categories, a few are hazardous events, and one shows the trefoil, crucial to winning the game. To collect a badge of the revealed category, the player must answer a trivia question relating to the category. Badges are available in the following categories:

Animal Lover; Artist; Book Lover; Brownie Friendship; Cook; Collector; Conservation; Craft; Discoverer; First Aid; House Orderly; Music Lover; Pony Rider; Rambler; Safety in the Home.

If the question is answered correctly, the badge tile is placed on the player's arm card (representing the badge being sewn onto the player's shirt sleeve). If it is answered incorrectly, the tile is turned face down again. When a player has collected five badges on her arm card, she must try to find the Trefoil badge from the face down selection in order to win the game.

Players can steal badges from Brownies who trespass on another player's campsite. Bonus badges can be won by landing on toadstool spaces and answering a general knowledge question. The game can end prematurely if too many Brown Owl spaces are landed on.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Vamos tras Eros
description:
Which would be your answer to the question: In what exotic place and with whom do you want to have hot sex?

With Vamos Tras Eros you can know your friends' reactions to this kind of questions, situations and test related with love and sex.

Vamos Tras Eros is sexy and hot race in search of the final tile EROS, the first player to arrive will have to opportunity to.....
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Dizzy Dryer
description: Dizzy Dryer was a simple kid's game along the lines of Don't Wake Daddy... throw foam "clothes" into the dryer, hoping that Dizzy won't spit your clothes back out.

name: Gallery
description:
From the box: GALLERY is a boardgame in which you must get the best painting collections and then show them in your own galleries, fully joining yourself into the exciting world of the art collecting.

The game mechanics are: "buy property", "strengthen property" and "wait for other players to land on it and have to then pay you". Its originality resides in the fact that, in order to "strengthen property", you must build up your art collection. The better your collection is, the more deadly it becomes to other players who must spend money when they land on it. Players compete among themselves to obtain the best sets of pictures to fill in their galleries.

Game components:
- A boardgame.
- 171 painting tiles.
- Two dice.
- A cloth bag.
- A wood hammer.
- 6 pions.
- 12 gallery property cards.
- 42 fortune cards.
- Million "Galleys" money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mimix
description: The board shows 16 different faces that are smiling, grinning and so on. Players in turn draw cards which show one of the faces. Now the player tries to imitate the shown face. The game continues as long as any player acquires 5 of these Mimix-cards.

name: Rail Masters
description:
From the publisher:

"Venture into America's romantic past. It is time when the young Nation is struggling to survive the tragic Civil War years in which over 620,000 lives were lost; families torn asunder; and the assassination of a President is being secretly planned. It is also a time when a small group of men rose against all odds amassing great fortunes and political power by laying their steel ribbons across America's vast plains and over her towering and majestic mountains. These were America's RAIL MASTERS....

The year is 1862 and President Lincoln has just signed the Pacific Railroad Act granting you $100,000 and a steam locomotive. Your assignment is to safely travel across the United States and deliver five special spikes to your holding company. The first Railroad to deliver all five spikes wins.

Who will be the next RAIL MASTER?"

The Rail Masters Trust Company is a Trivial Pursuit inspired train trivia game with added economic and pick up and deliver mechanics. Players take the role of one of six holding companies from 1862 and start with $100,000 granted by the government. Starting from the roundhouse, players roll and move around the board answering train trivia questions to get extra moves. There are six spike squares of five different colors the players are aiming to land on where they can purchase a spike from the government. The train playing pieces have slots to hold two spikes maximum, so spikes must be delivered to the roundhouse before more can be picked up. On Rail Crossing spaces, "community chest" type cards are drawn that decrease or increase a player's money. Players can sell their spikes to any other player at any time for any price.

The trivia questions are all multiple choice or true and false, so you don't need to be a train trivia expert to be competitive. If playing against a REAL train buff, you can always take away the multiple choice from that player and make them answer the questions outright to even the field...
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Nubian Jak
description:
Nubian Jak was created in Britain and developed in the USA. It has 8 topics: Leaders & Icons, TV & Film, Modern History, Art & Literature, Sport, Science & Engineering, General Knowledge, Music & Theater. The game combines wit, skill and luck to outplay your opponents by getting three pyramid pieces from one area of the board to three new homes.

Nubian Jak uses multiple-choice questions on cards with the correct answer giving an instruction to move forward or throw again. In most cases the least likely of the 3 options carries a penalty for the wrong answer. There is also a Super Challenge Format, which is played by asking the topic card questions without giving the multiple choice options as clues. The correct answer gives the bonus, while any wrong answer incurs the penalty on the card.

Nubian Jak can either be played in singles involving 2-8 players or in teams of 3 with each Jak represented by a player.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Truth, Dare or Chocolate
description:
From the publisher's catalog:

From the makers of the wildly popular Strip Chocolate, comes a new and revealingly delicious adult dessert game - Truth, Dare or Chocolate. Chocoholics has given the age-old game of Spin the Bottle a new chocolate twist. If you are hungry for dessert and some very seductive action, turn the lights on low, spread out a comforter by a cozy fire and get ready for some embarrassing, but titillating fun. You will earn points for telling truths, taking dares and tattooing your partner with delicious Chocoholics Body Frosting. Be the first to earn 20 points and you get to present your partner with your Ultimate Dare! Chocoholics Truth, Dare or Chocolate will be the most memorable dessert experience you have ever had.

name: Fairy Tale Road Rage
description:
A cut-and-assemble board game printed in the end-papers of "LittleLit", a collection of fairy tales as depicted by independent comic book artists. The game, by "Jimmy Corrigan: Smartest Kid on Earth" author Chris Ware, is a fairly simple roll-and-move progression where players "drive" the various denizens (Big Bad Wolf, Frog Prince, Grandma) of a blighted, suburban fairy-land in an effort to gather like-colored "story chits". The chits are assembled on a separate board for each character, and "will complete a story of amusing and rakish details- particularly if read aloud, and with dramatic relish." Certain spaces, when landed on, have special, game altering effects, such as "Heisenberg Attack", which forces all players to switch characters with the person to their right.

"One person play: All rules are the same, though exchange between other players is, obviously, impossible. Do not despair; someday you will grow up to be a famous cartoonist and all of the kids who made fun of you will have miserable jobs and be desperately unhappy, but you will get to draw stories for lots of money about how you still hate them all."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Storytelling

name: Bombshells
description:
Armed with a ren faire costume and a Player's Handbook, you've decided to cross the final frontier: dating. Vie for the attentions of the bombshells, but watch out... who knows what mood they're in.

On a player's turn, a Bombshell is chosen that the players will vie for. Each player who wants to approach the Bombshell places one of their Offer cards face down, within the range of cards that the Bombshell will accept.

Then the Bombshell's Mood is revealed, which says how the Bombshell is scored and if there's a card limit.

There is a round of adding to offers from those who approached the Bombshell. The offers are revealed, and whoever has the best offer scores the Bombshell.

name: Gaia
description:
In Gaia players add tiles to the ecosystem and make bets on each species. There five different types of species in the game.

This is a free print and play game from Neuroludic. It is currently only available in French.

name: Talk Dirty to Me, Lover
description:
From the box:

Talk Dirty To Me, Lover is the original adult "party-down" dirty dice game. Players or teams compete for points using word dice to form complete sentences. Extra points are givene for dice that are shared in a crossword fashion or for sentences of 5 words or more. A huge selection of words lets any player talk as "sexy" or "dirty" as they please. And if your mouth gets you in trouble, blame it on the dice! A great go-anywhere party game.

Contents:

Forty-two (42) Six-Sided Word Dice
1 Two-Minute Sand Timer
1 Rule Booklet

name: Army Brats
description:
Army Brats is a game to be played with a standard piecepack. The players are in military school, and are trying to get kicked out for excessively poor attendance. Players can work on getting demerits by getting caught having enough forged absentee passes to skip half or more of a school day (pair through four-of-a-kind), or to dodge homework by missing three or more days in a row of the same class (runs of three or more).

Players acquire these forged passes by moving to an adjacent classroom of the desired subject, and then either dealing with the non-player student in that room, or forcing a trade with another player. The types of trades you can make depend on the sort of pass you have for your current classroom.

Once a player gets herself "caught" with a demerit-worthy set of passes, she receives more demerits for a strongly incriminating set of passes.

The first player to 20 demerits wins, and is free from the hard military life!

name: Dinosauriernas hemliga dal
description:
Dinosauriernas hemliga dal means " The secret valley of the dinosaurs. "
Two dinosaur families are competing for the power in the secret valley.
This tactical game is recommended from 6 years and up, and works for adults.
In the game, the purpose is to try and catch the opponents dinosaurs while avoiding the other player´s dinosaurs and the bloodthirsty T-Rex who belongs to no one.
The dinosaurs all have different amounts of strength and can´t catch other dinosaurs who are stronger than them selves.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Oopstix
description: This is a dexterity/balance game with four tall sticks that have little branches on them. On your turn, you hang your own sticks on these which can be straight or wildly curvy. As you play, any that fall off as a result of playing them become yours to try and put up. First person to get rid of all of their sticks wins.

name: Dédales
description:
Players are heroes trying to get out of the labyrinth. The player who finds the most economic route out wins the game.


Was availible - Now link doesn't work.


{Available for free download (in French only) from the Neuroludic website: http://www.neuroludic.com/}


Archive.org download (cut & paste full URL):


http://web.archive.org/web/20070622014854/http://www.neuroludic.com/dedale/dedale.html
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Maze, Mythology, Print & Play

name: Cubeword
description:
Cubeword is a crossword style game. The game consists of 25 letter cubes packed into a plastic carry case. 24 of the cubes have letters on 5 faces, with one side left blank, with the last cube bearing the numbers 1-6. Each letter appears in one of nine colors.

The basic game involves creating a crossword arrangement of words, either by adding cubes, rearranging existing words or rotating cubes to reveal new letters.

14 additional rule sets are included, with a few variants on the basic rules and a variety of additional games which take advantage of the number cube and the colored letters.

name: The Popular Game of Broadway
description:
The Popular Game of Broadway celebrates four of the historic thoroughfare's architectural landmarks:
The Metropolitan Life Towers (built in 1909) The Times Tower (1903), the Flatiron Building (1902) and the Woolworth Building (1913). The game offers players the thrill of the big city within the comforts of the parlor - a perfect armchair traveling experience. -- from the book The Games We Played by Margaret Hofer (2003).

This is a variation on Pachisi, strongly related to Milton Bradley's Parcheesi, but obviously, marketed by a competitor. In his biography of Parker Brothers, The Game Makers, Philip Orbanes describes Broadway as a deliberate attempt to re-theme their popular seller, Pollyanna, for boys. Ultimately, Broadway was dropped after the 1933 catalog, while Pollyanna persisted for most of another four decades.

name: Cuberty
description: 'Word games grow up in Cuberty' - Cuberty is a 3D word game played with cubes. Words are formed using stackable cubes. Where Cuberty differs from other word games is that words can be formed vertically as well as horizontally, using the black and red lettered side of the cubes, but also the blank sides to provide spaces between the words.
publishers: Game Ideas Ltd, Invicta Games, Trends UK Ltd

name: Alamo to Appomattox
description:
American Civil War wargaming rules for army level games being played with 2mm miniatures.

Enables entire battles of the size of Gettysburg to be played on a normal size wargaming table, with each battalion being represented by its own stand.

The rules are based on the Blenheim to Balaclava rules with modifications added to account for the specifics of the American Civil War
categories: American Civil War, Book, Civil War, Miniatures

name: American Chopper DVD BoardGame
description:
From the press release:

This game for two or more players takes participants into Orange County Choppers (the shop where the show takes place) to face numerous tasks, tight deadlines, unexpected surprises and the wrath of Paul, Sr. himself. It features hundreds of challenges, games, trivia and clips, and is hosted by Mike Rowe, the official voice of American Chopper. Each space on the board corresponds with on screen action, and players must answer questions to earn bike parts in six different production stages for the win

name: Escape
description:
From the press release:

The game has 108 cards for three to six players. Kids and adults can match wits against opponents while trying to rid themselves of all the cards in their hands. But in this new card game, opponents can openly discuss how to stop each other (within limits). Trying to stop someone from going out normally occurs when a player only has 2 or 3 cards left in his or her hand. The game scenario is in constant change. One minute a player is on offense, trying to win himself. The next minute he’s on defense as he works individually or as a team with other players to stop someone from going out.

name: Bear in the Big Blue House Who's In My Room? Game
description:
Bear in the Big Blue House, Who's In My Room?, is a child's puzzle building game for ages 3 and up.
This game helps children to learn game rules and complete their puzzle with four pieces that specifically match one of four puzzle outlines. To play the game, each player takes turns by pressing a lever on the front of the house resulting in a puzzle piece popping out. The puzzle piece is kept if it matches the player's puzzle outline. If the puzzle piece does not match the player's puzzle outline, it is either passed to the player with the matching puzzle outline (Easy Game) or inserted into a slot in the roof of the house (Advanced Game). The turn passes to the next player, and the game progresses until a player completes their puzzle. The Advanced Game contains two Bear/Luna pieces that allow a player who popped it out on their turn to keep it until another player ejects a piece that matches the player's puzzle.
The puzzles are colorful and include Bear's missing friends, Tutter, Treelo, Ojo, Pip, and Pop. Using the lever to 'pop' out the puzzle pieces adds a fun element for young children.

name: Crazy Eights Dice
description: Another classic children's card game done as a dice game. Plays just like the card game but without the cards.

name: Ascot
description: This early game from John Jacques featured a very unique method of determining the winner of the race. The game itself was a large wooden box. It had up to 8 horses attached to the box with wires. A hand crank on the side of the box attached to the horses by a variety of gears was turned resulting in a different horse winning the race. Players bet on which horse would indeed win the race.

name: International Game of Spy
description:
At first glance, this game appears to be a multi-player variant on earlier games in the vein of L'Attaque. Players set up pieces of hidden value, advance them, and capture opponents pieces by moving into occupied spaces and having the piece of greater rank.

However, there are other differences beyond the multi-player capability. Players do not seek a hidden flag; rather, they strive to reach visible target spaces in their opponents' territories that may only be occupied by a Spy piece. Challenging is optional; i.e., multiple players may have pieces co-exist on the same space as long as a player moving in declines to ask, "Who's there?" Finally, each player has a piece that cannot be captured called the Secret Police, which may only capture an opponent's Spy.

The first player to move his Spy onto an opponent's Palace space or Coat of Arms space is the winner.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Castle Cannon Shoot
description:
Castle Cannon Shoot is a two- to four-player shooting-gallery game in which the object is to fire all your fire “cannon balls” into the courtyard of the rotating castle.

Each player selects eight marble-like “cannon balls” of one color and places them in their own shooting alley. The castle is set spinning, and all players simultaneously attempt to shoot their cannon balls up an inclined ramp between the rotating ramparts into the castle.

The trick for players is to time their shots to avoid the ramparts of the rotating castle.

As soon as a player has used all their cannon balls, they close their own gate to avoid any other player shooting into their alley.

name: Monopoly: Bath Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Bath, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Alpages: La guerre des moutons
description:
An abstract strategy game on the theme of sheep herds in the mountains. Each player has sheep, dog and eagle pieces. They start on one side of the map and must be the first to reach the opposite side.

Published in Jeux & stratégie Nouvelle Formule #3.

name: Time Capsule
description:
Publisher:
"The object of the game is to visit 5 time zones, drop off a ring at each zone, and be the first player to return to the present."

name: Garfield Pizza Pie and Hairballs Game
description:
From the Great American Puzzle Factory product catalog:

Players collect sets of four silly card slices to create an entire pizza of points, while avoiding hairballs other players are throwing their way!

Ages 4 and up
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Gobble Gobble!
description:
From the "Are You Game" website:

"Moooo, Oink-Oink, Quack-Quack, Gobble-Gobble! Spend a fun-filled day on the farm as you race to see who can move their farm animals across the board fastest. Spin the spinner, make your animal's sound as you move, but careful where you land - you'll go back to start if you end up on the wrong color. Gobble, Gobble! is a simple-to-learn game that introduces children to decision-making and strategy. Includes 4 each: turkey, pig, duck, and cow playing pieces, 4 color cards, 1 spinner, game board, and instructions. No reading required, great fun for 2 to 4 players Ages 3 to 8."

name: Cousin-cousine
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #60.

Stratego-like game in the context of a rivalry between two little villages. The loser must organize the pétanque competition !

name: Inference
description:
Publisher:
"The object of the game is to be the first player to go from elementary school through college while answering inference questions."

name: Bummer
description:
In Bummer, players use 5 dice to try to score points. They set aside scoring dice and may continue with the rest.

Bummer predates Farkle and has different scoring methods. Players score on 1s and 5s and also three of a kind, four of a kind and straights in a single roll.

name: Monopoly: Chester & Cheshire
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Chester & Cheshire, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sandown
description:
Themed around a horse race, players place bets before a wheel is spun and the result determined and bets paid out.

The game has been described as a themed version of Roulette with less betting options.

name: Skull & Bones: A World of Pirates
description:
A mixture of history and myth, Skull & Bones: A World of Pirates is the new strategy board game from the history geeks who brought you the acclaimed Galactic Destiny.

2-6 players are the Captains of a crew of pirate scum! Travel the seas with an innovative knot system, raid ports, cargo fleets and other pirates.

Pillage, raid and gain renown: Fame, Fear, Fortune -- who will be the most dreaded dog of the sea. Includes exciting rules for in game gambling!
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Mythology, Nautical, Pirates, Travel, Wargame
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: American Trivia Challenge: Tennessee Edition
description:
This game is the Tennessee Edition of the American Trivia Challenge line of games. The questions are divided into multiple categories, including:
1. Business
2. People, Places, and Things
3. Arts & Sciences
4. Government & History
5. Fun & Games
6. Etcetera
7. Home State

The players must move around the board, correctly answering questions at each category stop along the way.
The game includes: 1 playing board, 1 numeral die, 1 compass die, 6 game pieces, 6 flag holders, 4800 trivia questions, and 800 home state questions.

name: Wild Fire
description:
From the intro:

Wild Fire, or WF, is a table top miniature wargame for 10-30 mm figures. It is focussed on reinforced platoon level skirmish games, and is suitable for one off games, or campaigns, but can be used to play games as small as squad size. It uses the same system as Baptism of Fire: World War II Skirmish Wargaming.

It's been reprinted together with the WWII rules in Baptism of Fire II: WW2 to Modern Skirmish Gaming.

name: Mini Golf
description: Using three dice players play a three hole course moving ball pegs on a peg board. There are different dice for woods, irons, and a putter.

name: Super Speedway
description: Players roll dice to move their car pegs around the track peg board. There are different dice for aggressive and normal racing and a pit stop die. This game is a very simple Indy style track on which you move a peg from hole to hole:- 7 per lap. Each player sticks to their own lane and has their own die which gives one of +1,+2,+3,-1,PIT,MISS. If in the pit, you use a pit die to decide whether or not you come out or stay there awhile.

name: Ryskland
description: This is basically Risk using the United States, instead of the world, as a map. There are 51 territories (the states and the District of Columbia) in which to place the four colors of plastic chips (each representing "an army of 1,000 soldiers). Set-up, by alternate picking of territories, and die roll combat is identical to Risk. The came contains 153 cards (infantry, cavalry, and "governor" cards for each of the 51 territories), and card play is significantly different from Risk, as a card from a stack of shuffled infantry and cavalry cards is picked every time a territory is conquered. If a player acquires both the infantry and cavalry cards for a state, the player is awarded the governor card for that state and immediately takes that state over. If another player has the other card, there is a one-die showdown to determine control. Play continues until all 102 infantry/cavalry cards are drawn, and the winner is the player with the most territories at that time. The game is well-made, with front & back box printing, a mounted board, plastic insert, 153 cards, 6 dice, 4 sets of 64 plastic chips, and three rules booklets (English, Spanish, French).

name: Mr. Game
description: Mr Game is a self contained game module system that contains the parts, boards and instructions to play 20 games: Baseball Bagatelle, Beat The Banker, Buck Dice, Checkers, Eight By Eight, Fox and Geese, Happy Face Puzzle, Help Your Neighbor, Hoop-La, Hoses and Ladders, Morris The Farmer, Parchisi, Queen Bee, Ship Captain Mate and Crew, Shuffleboard, Solitaire, Spin A Winner, Steeplechase, Tic-Tac-Toe, and Tiddly Winks. The central Mr Game figure is used in many of these games, making standard games unique to Mr Game (for example, one of his arms shoots the shuffleboard disks and the balls for Baseball Bagatelle). Designed and play tested with target audience of Ages 5 and up
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Educational, Racing
publishers: AS Company, Kärnan, University Games, Waddingtons

name: Leap-in-a-Line
description:
This is a childrens game that is based on Connect Four. The box contains a school bus shaped board, an alphabet road, 106 tokens and an instruction book. The tokens are divided into four different colors. Each color of token has a different picture set. These sets include shapes of various sizes and colors, letters with both uppercase and lowercase of various colors and pictures of different items with the word written on it(ex. a picture of a dog with the word dog written on it).

The different tokens allow the same board to be used for five different learning games.

name: Do You Sudoku? Game for Kids
description:
To play, players roll the die, make the sound of the animal on the die, then try to place that animal on their grid. This is a kids version of Do You Sudoku? that involves 6 animals pictures on a 6 X 6 grid instead of the numbers 1 - 9 on a 9 X 9 grid.

From the publisher's web site:
Find a Home for Every Animal on the Farm!

Oink! Moo! Baa! Our Do you Sudoku? Game for Kids brings the logic solving challenge of Sudoku puzzles together with cute farm animals. Here's a fun way for children and parents to play together while developing patterning and logic skills.

Players roll a die, make the noise of their favorite animals and try to place the animal tile onto the correct space.

The Rules Are Simple
No animal can appear twice in the same 6 square box or in a line up and down or in a line across.

Contains 30 puzzle cards (60 puzzles), 108 animal tiles and 1 die.

Ages 6 & up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Show & Tell Game
description:
A storytelling game for 2 to 4 players ages Ages 3 - 8.

The game consists of a board, spinner, and grab bag full of little toys. On each turn, a player gets to pick a toy from the bag. When a player lands on a storytelling space, he must tell a story involving all of the toys he has collected and the picture on the space he landed on. The first player to tell two stories wins.

name: Hokie Football
description:
The object of Hokie Football is to score more points than your opponents while getting rid of all cards in your hand. Cards represent the yard lines on an American football field, and players can score points by playing touchdowns and getting rid of cards. Each hand ends when one player is out of cards.

Players start at mid field and move towards the end zones by playing one card per turn. If a player cannot play a card from their hand, they put points in a pot, and the person who goes out of cards at the end of the round gets all of the points in the pot. Playing touchdown cards scores for the player.

The player with the most points after multiple hands wins.

name: Suomussalmi
description:
Suomussalmi is probably the best known battle during the 1939-40 ‘Winter War’ between Finland and the USSR. It took place around the village of Suomussalmi and along the road leading to this village from the hamlet of Raate. The battle was fought between the 163rd and 44th divisions of the Red Army, the latter being a motorized division, against a composite Finnish division which was eventually called the 9th and had only a few artillery units and nothing else in support of its infantry battalions. The battle was fought from early December until early January and resulted in the complete destruction of the Soviet divisions.

The map covers the area around Suomussalmi and Haapavaara. It is divided into hexagons (hexes) each approximately 2.6 km across.
The counters for the two armies are slightly different in the information they contain as well as in the color. Soviet units are red and Finnish units grey. The unit size designations and arm-of-service designations are the standard NATO designations with two possible exceptions. Two lines at the top of the unit marks a battalion and three a regiment.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: DGA TV
description:
from the publisher:

A co-operative game about running your own TV station.

We are Producers working together to bring Award Winning programming to the viewing public. We run 7 Studios, featuring everything from Children’s Shows to Current Affairs. We have to deal with the critics, ratings, sponsors and the actions of people behind and in front of the cameras.

With skill and luck we will avoid Cancellations and earn Awards.

This game has the flavor of casino games such as Blackjack. We try to put together as popular a TV program as we can, i.e., as high scoring a card hand of the best crew, top ratings and committed sponsors to counter the negative hand of mounting drops in ratings, loss of viewers and sponsors as well as some troubles among the station crew.

Expect lots of talk and debate. Clever teamwork and risk-taking are also needed or we will lose our shirts as the Cancellations pile up. Be careful, everything can quickly spin out of control. Good luck!

Includes: 8 game boards, rules, 6 movers, 7 success markers, 1 program marker, 41 thumbs up and 45 thumbs down cards, rules summary chart. © 2006

name: Westminster Abbey or Glorious Victory!
description:
The Battle of Cape St Vincent,14th February 1797.
Each unit represents one ship of the line. None of the frigates or other ships present are represented, as they played no part in the battle.
There are 15 British ships and 27 Spanish ships, identified by their national flags.

name: Office Gossip
description:
Office Gossip is game of scheming and intrigue set in an office environment for five to thirteen (or more) players. All players but one are dedicated office managers just doing their best to help the company. One player is a gossip who’s decided that the best way to get ahead is to eliminate competition by slandering the other managers. Will you figure out who the gossip is before you get demoted to “sanitation engineer”?

Office Gossip borrows almost all of the same play elements of the well-known public domain game Werewolf, also known as Mafia. Where Werewolf requires a player to stay out of the game to act as a Narrator, Office Gossip uses a custom set of cards to eliminate the need for a Narrator.

Home Page: http://www.invisible-city.com/play/435/
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play, Real-time
mechanics: Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: WarFair
description:
This is a cardgame for 2 to 6 players.
Players are Army Sellers that only see money in their life!
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Use the right combinations of Army/Nation to sell the best army at the higher profit.
But be aware... CIA, FBI and INTERPOL are always on your traces.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play

name: Tournament
description:
This is a cardgame for 2+ players.
Players compete to win Medieval Tournaments.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
To do this they have to set up a lot of combinations of: Horse, Army, Shield and Soldier.
Different Torunament needs different combinations.
categories: Card Game, Medieval, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Set Collection

name: Karamo
description:
Similar to Jenga but instead of stacking a player tries to draw or push as many sticks as possible out of the pile of wooden sticks with the sliding stick. Whilst doing this the other sticks are not allowed to move & if they do the player has to put it back on the top of the pile & it is the next player's turn.

The winner is determined by points achieved by capturing different sized logs.

Similar to:

Fire
Log Jam

name: Jetsons:  Rosey the Robot Game
description: Spin and Move children's game based on the TV series The Jetsons.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Colonial
description: A solitaire game simulating the colonization of Mars. The player takes control of space colony, with a main goal of expanding the colony to 2000 colonists. Over time, the player has random events like disease, meteor storms and so much more to deal with!

name: Squominos
description:
This is a tie-in to the 2005 Charlie and the Chocolate Factory movie.

Each Squomino has an Oompa-Loompa in a colored uniform on each of its four sides. Players link pairs of matching Oompa-Loompas by placing the Squominos in a spiral shape.

Players start with 7 Squominos. If they cannot play a Squomino on their turn, they pick one up from the pool. The winner is the first to run out of Squominos.

Therefore the choice is which Squomino to use, not where.

There are 58 Squominos, including 3 wild cards (which can match anything). Oompa-Loompas are in just four colors: green, red, yellow and blue.

This simplicity makes the game suitable for Ages 3 and up.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Card Ball
description: This is an odd Monopoly clone, because it isn't exactly a clone. You qualify batters, make hits, score runs, and collect teams you defeat. While the board looks awfully familiar to a Monopoly board with just the spaces representing teams rather than streets, the actual implementation of the roll & move mechanic is different and there is no trading that can occur.

name: Laurel and Hardy
description: "A delightfully funny game of monkey business".

name: MENSA Challenge your IQ Pack
description:
From the box:

A compendium of puzzles and games to stretch your brain to the limits.

This pack contain a set of ingenious games, puzzles and activities designed by MENSA, the international high IQ society, to hone your mental powers until they're razor sharp. There is a book containing series of IQ-type puzzles that will test both your speed of thought and mental agility. In addition there is a board game that will provide the whole family with hours of puzzle-solving fun, and another that helps to build vocabulary.. There are 3D-puzzles that will put you through many hours of mental struggle as you try to reach seemingly impossible solutions. But you don't have to be a genius to enjoy this pack.

There is two boardgames in this pack. The first, Wild Words, is a word game for any number of player. The players must move their counters accordingly to a die roll and respecting certain restrictions. On a 10 x 16 board with a letter in each square. Every player will have to collect an equal number of letters and have a limited time at the end of a round to form a word with his collected letters.
The second game is called Puzzle mountain. Its a kind of Snakes and ladders for six players, themed on mountain climbing. You have to be the first to reach the summit after leaving the base camp. There are crevasses and ropes, you have to solve a puzzle-card to climb along the ropes or not falling down along crevasses.

The pack contain:
book of MENSA puzzles, 100 puzzle-cards, a 2-sided game board, dice and counters, puzzle cubes, tessellated tiles and instructions for the games plus all solutions.
categories: Dice, Number, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wheeling
description: One of the old all-time classic English games. The game represents a race from London to the Anchor's pub at Ripley.

name: Würfel Kick
description:
A football (soccer) board game produced and published by Ravensburger Germany just before the World Cup 2006. Each player has only one pawn (pl. piece) and 3 six-sided dice. The dice are used to move the pl. piece, but:

The first die has this value 1,2,2,3,3,4
The second 1,2,3,4,5,fault
The third 2,4,6,6,fault,fault -> (long running but 33% of chances to get the fault side of the die)


Who scores first 3 goals is the winner...

The board of the game is like a football stadium, with some lines and holes for the pl.pieces movements.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Royal Battles
description:
Royal Battles is a strategic board game of small scale battles played with playing cards and chess pieces. In Royal Battles players compete to defeat each other in head-to-head combat. Each player builds an army of 4 units (represented with chess pieces) and maneuvers them on a battle board made from a tile grid of playing cards. Each unit has a special ability that sets it apart and it is the combination of units and abilities that will determine the difference between victory and defeat.

Requires playing cards (standard poker or bridge decks) and chess pieces.

name: Nya Företagspelet Kapital
description: In this game, players try to make as much money as possible by buying and selling stock. The companies you can buy stock in are actual Swedish companies. Things get shaken up by Unforeseen Event-cards, as well as taxation and meddling from the minister of economics and the minister of budgets. Another unusual feature is that you can take a loan, that last for 15 real-world minutes.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Brocante
description:
Brocante is a interesting trade game, with a significant bit of luck, but also an important tactical element.

The players earn money while playing the lottery, and by reselling the objects which they accrue. The easy way is in the price of the objects. In each type, there are four prices. Most expensive is to be sold first. The prices are 3500, 2500, 1500 and 1000. Players collect the eight objects in a set, without doubles.

Players try to buy the objects that would complete other players' sets, especially to double the price when selling to the player who needs the object (and reap greater profits).

But, while objects are purchased from most-to-least expensive, they are sold least-to-most expensive.

name: Yggdrasil
description: Taken from the ASG description: Yggdrasil is an abstract strategy game that takes 2-4 players to the world of Scandinavian mythology and its many capricious gods. Thor, Odin, Frigg and Loki are reborn to impose their will within the nine worlds. Yggdrasil, the tree of Odin, is the force that keeps this fragile system functioning. The players must manipulate the runic stones in order to gain the most points and thus win the game.

name: The Game of Pirate Gold
description:
Listed in American Games, 4190. 1946, Adventure, Board game.

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

name: Easy Cheesy
description:
Easy Cheesy is a smash & grab to see whose mouse can snatch the most cheese & drop it safely into its own nest ! Watch the mice wobble as they gobble !

Their magnetic mouths are ready to chomp, but their bouncy rubber bodies can send them out of control !

Great fun for the kids !

Contents

1 x Cheeseboard

4 x Rubber mice

4 x Plastic handles

16 x Cheeses
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Heroes for Hire
description:
The magistrate leaned back from his desk and sighed. He had so much to do and little time or money to get it all done. In his hand was a report of goblin raiders attacking farms to the north. On his desk where other requests for aid, complaints about bandits along the high road, undead shambling about a local graveyard and many more calls for aid.

Leaning forward the high magistrate called in his assistant, a small, frail looking man with small eyeglasses perched on his thin nose. “Yes milord?” the small man asked with a swift bow.

Handing the report on the goblin raiders to the his assistant, the Magistrate told him to give the job to, “That dwarf, what was his name? You know, the one that help us out with the troll some weeks back. He and his band of adventurers did a good job on that assignment, let us see how they fair with goblins.”

With a bow, the bespectacled man turned and left, calling for a runner to go find the dwarf, who know doubt was drunk in some tavern, rewarding himself with the gold he had earned on his last job for the city’s chief trouble shooter.

This is Heroes for Hire, the newest Mini-Game from Bad Baby Productions. Take the role of a city bureaucrat, as you seek to solve one problem after another. Most of your day-to-day dealing though, has to do with adventurers, their hiring and then sending them off to solve one of the many problems that plagues your city. Can you build up a stable of reliable heroes who will slay the dragon you need dead, or find the grand treasure that you need to offer as a wedding present to the king’s third cousin. Seek glory through the blood and sweat of others, and rise to the top position within the realm.

name: Iran: 2007
description: An Axis & Allies variant based on the "what-if" scenario of a US and NATO vs. Iran conflict set in 2007, using the card system of A&A: D-Day. Requires pieces from A&A: Europe to play. Includes WMDs and other new features.

name: Aunty Ruth's Apples
description:
Aunty Ruth sends us into her orchards to gather apples. Fill the boxes and bring them to her little store by the highway, where lots of people stop by.

There are four different apples to pick -- some for eating, for making cider & juice, for baking, and for sauces. Each player spins to see from which orchard to pick apples. But watch out for the wormy ones or those chewed up by deer. When everyone has had a turn at the spinner, we help to fill as many of the different boxes as we can with the apples we picked.

Contents:
35 cards
1 spinner
store charts
rules
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zeppelin: Peter Strasser's Blitz
description:
Zeppelin covers the battle between Peter Strasser's German Naval Airship Division and British aerial defenses during World War I. This game was published in the first issue of battle-market magazine dated Spring 2007.

It contains 1 A4-sized maps, 2 A4-sized tracking aids, 50 1/2" counters, and four pages of rules. An accompanying article is included in the same magazine. All A4-sized components are back printed on the maps for other games in the same magazine.

The German side includes three types of zeppelins. Accidents may occur. The German player secretly plans his raids and the British player assigns defenses. The planned raids are revealed and any not negated by weather are resolved.

Each turn represents one month, and the game does have a variable endpoint.

Length of gameplay is an estimate.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I

name: Eloise Rawther Exciting Card Game
description: This game combines three different games; all are set collection games. One is a version of Snap, the second is a passing game, and the third is version of Go Fish where you have to act out the picture on the card to get a match.

name: Take Two!: 32 Board Games for 2 Players
description:
The book contains 32 game boards and rules for each game. From the back cover:

"All you need to play these games are markers - stones, buttons or paper clips. Some games are easy; some are difficult. But as you play you'll find you get more and more crafty! Does the cat always catch the mouse? Is it possible for Black to escape the blockade?"

name: Chifoumi
description:
This is the classic Rock/Paper/Scissors game adapted for children. It includes figures for each item and two bags. Players draw one figure each at the same time to see who advances through the board.

It also has a new item: "well" that wins against scissors and rock and loses against paper. There are two boards a simpler and shorter one and a longer with special spaces that have different effects on the players.

Ages 4 and up

name: The America's Cup Game
description:
From the intro the rules:

"The America's Cup Game is an entertaining Australian-made family board game suitable for 2 to 6 players aged 7 years and upwards and with an average playing time of 15 minutes. It is easy to set up, the rules are easy to follow and the game can be conveniently stored when not in use.

The board is modeled on the America's Cup course, by now familiar to most Australians. Basically, each yacht progresses around the course according to the number thrown on the dice. If a yacht sails onto a Red mark a Wind Shift Card must be turned up to see whether wind conditions are favourable or unfavourable."

name: Curious George Beginning Middle & End: card game
description:
From game box:
Players race to assemble card sets that illustrate beginning, middle and end. A delightful game of sequencing featuring the antics of Curious George.

name: The Adventures of Robin Hood Game
description:
This is the original Robin Hood Game which claims to have been inspired by Warner Brothers Technicolor Production Co.

It is a roll and move game with players acquiring cards depending on what spots on the playing board they land on.

name: Runt i världen
description:
In this game, players are traveling around the world and score points by visiting various places around the world. The goal is to visit at least five different continents and return home, but even though the first player to complete his journey gets a points bonus, other players can still win by visiting more places.


Travel to all the continents... Europe, North America, South America, Africa, Asia and Australia to get points along the way

An exciting tactic game for 2-4 players in from 6 and above.

The game board is a map of the world, devided into 286 squares (13x22). One (1) square is red with a big white S, six (6) of the squares are red with a white number - there is one on each continent. The 24 squares have a white circle with a number on (10, 20, 25, 30 or 50).

Before the game all the "white" spaces gets a blue token on, with the consistent number of the field; this will leave 10 tokens of each 10 points in spare, which is put aside together with the red "proof tokens".

All players start on "S" which is located on a field which have Iceland to the west, England to the south and Norway to the east.
The players take turns by rollin the die (D6) and move the amount that the die shows. They can move North, South, East or West (not diagonally) and can move in zig-zig (Example on the roll 5: North, West, North, West, South). A player can not move into or pass a square where another player is on.
When a player lands on either a point-field (white circle with red numbers) the player takes the point on the board, if it have not been taken before. If a player lands on one of the red fields on each continent, the player can take the matching number from the pool if (s)he do not have this number yet. The red "proof tokens" are put infront of the player, visible for everone.
Each time you pass Equator you get 10 points from the pool, as long as there are still points left to take.

When you have at least fice (5) of the six (6) "proof tokens", you can move back to the "S" , and this will give you 100 points.
Second one back to base get's 50, third gets 25 and the last don't get any points for returnin. When everyone is back you add the points (Home-coming, red tokens (75 points each) and blue tokens (10-50 points each). The player with the highest score is the winner.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Up the Ladder
description:
A children's roll and move game combined with a touch of dexterity.

The game board is a huge ladder, the playing pieces are little men carrying sacks on their backs. Each player has four of these with four different sack colors. Driven by dice, these men walk up (and occasionally down) the ladder, trying to reach the top. When three men stand on the same rung, though, the rung topples and all the men fall down, bringing down all those below them, too.

name: Spider-Man 3 The Battle Within Game
description:
The ever-popular Spider-Man is back! Based on the movie, Spider-Man 3 combats foes and villains in New York City!

Capture as many villains as you can to help spider-Man win the battle within! Play cards to capture villains or liberate your opponents' bad guys.

The Battle Within Game could fairly be described as a deluxe edition of the Spider-Man Crime Stopper Card Game, adding a game board, but keeping the same gameplay. For ages 6 and up and comes with 50 collectible cards.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Betsy Ross and the Flag
description:
Betsy Ross and the Flag is a game from Transogram that is advertized on its cover as a "Thrilling Historical Game" and as being part of the Landmark Games Series. Ages 9 and up

Each player is Betsy Ross carrying a sewing basket with which to "sew" the original flag. Players obtain 13 flag pieces by visiting the Town Hall in each of the 13 Colonial States. When the flag is completed, the player races to deliver it to the Flag Committee. The first player to enter the blue circle and greet the Flag Committee with a completed flag wins the game.

name: Magical Tower
description:
Magical Tower is a game in the Wooden Balance Game series by Daiso, the Japanese 100-yen store chain. The game is cheap but has nice wooden components. It bears a striking resemblance to Villa Paletti.

The game has plain cuboid wooden pillars and colourful flat semi-circular and arc-like pieces. Players take turn to use the pieces to build a tower-like structure and the player who causes the tower to tumble loses.

name: Pooh's Go-Together Game
description:
This fun learning game teaches young children to group things which go together with Pooh and his friends.

Includes 36 cards, one Collector Card, and instructions.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Blood Flow
description:
In this game the players race around major blood vessels gathering oxygen from the lungs and delivering it to the capillaries where it is exchanged for carbon dioxide. The cards are used to conserve oxygen by an activity such as sleeping or perhaps use it at an alarming rate due to stress. The winner of the game is the first player to return the carbon dioxide token to the lungs.

The game is recommended for children Ages 6 - 12, and its components include a game board, a dice, instructions, and token used to represent oxygen, red blood cells, and carbon dioxide.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sentence Zone
description:
From publisher's website:

If you're looking for a fun way to improve writing and grammar skills, this game is for you! For 2 to 6 players, grades 1st and up. Rules are easily mastered. The Sentence Zone can be played at six levels - from Level 1 in which the player builds a subject and verb sentence, to Level 6 in which the player builds complex sentences with independent and dependent clauses. With over 500 color coded cards, students are sure to be unique and entertaining every time. A great reinforcing individual activity where a player keeps track of his score from day to day, trying to top his previous score, or a great group activity where competition drives creativity and learning. An instructive and enjoyable way to shatter the tedium of English grammar lessons!

name: Ding Dong
description:
A house with 12 flats. Each flat contains a stack of images. The top image shows who lives here. Then the doors are closed. The dice decides where you can ring. But you can only open the door, after guessing who is living there. If you are right you get the image card.

Nicely made memo game.

name: 99 Nightmare Street
description:
From the box: A speedy spooky numbers game!

Mr and Mrs Morbid are throwing their annual Halloween party. As usual they've invited some very strange guests... and you've been given the job of answering the door to them all!

You've got to keep track of how many peculiar characters arrive and leave because Mr and Mrs Morbid have invited more spooks that their creepy house can hold!

You can't turn any guests away, but you're in trouble if you let more than 99 guests in!
categories: Card Game, Educational, Fantasy, Horror, Humor, Math

name: Monster!
description:
From the box: A mad game of well-mannered monster mayhem!

General Gargoyle has a strange collection of pets. They are some of the weirdest looking creatures you have ever seen. General Gargoyle sometimes has a bit of trouble controlling his crazy creatures - it's the third time this week that the monsters have sneaked out, and the General has enlisted your help to catch them all, for which he is offering a reward!

So catch as many monsters as you can! But beware, the reward that the General is offering is extremely generous, so others will be trying to capture the monsters too!

name: Line Drive
description: Simple card game which has a number of options depending on which card you select. Game comes with Field as part of the Game Box, a set of cards for both players, score sheets, 4 markers to show players on the base paths and an instruction pamphlet.

name: Take a Wild Guess
description:
Take a Wild Guess is an interactive trivia game. It consist of 1,050 trivial questions requiring a number for an answer. The questions are difficult enough so that no one is expected to know the correct answer, but everyone is required to “take a wild guess”. The person reading the question competes against the other players, who work together to arrive at a consensus answer. The interaction between the other players generates conversation and laughter and often a reasonably close guess. Points are awarded to those that are closest to the exact answer and to any answer that falls on or within the “margin of correctness” (50% either side of the exact answer).

There are five categories animals, 19th century America, science, military, and the 21st century.

Sample Question:
During the last Ice Age's coldest stage (approximately 18,000 years ago), the average temperature in what is now Kansas was how may degrees Fahrenheit colder than today?

The correct answer is 18 degrees.

If the reader was closer than the consensus answer of his opponents he receives 1 point for each player. If the consensus answer was closer each player, except the reader, receives 1 point.

Bonus points are awarded if the closest answer falls within the specified margin of correctness. For this question the margin of correctness is 9 degrees to 27 degrees.

name: Le'Tour Colorado
description:
