[NOTE: There are two other animal cracker games, so don't get confused!]

This one is a simple children's game. The board contains spaces with numbers, as well as spaces without numbers. Players place their pawns on a non-numbered spot to begin the game. A card is drawn showing a number that corresponds to one of the numbered spots on the board. Players take turns attempting to land on that spot. How many spots a player moves on his/her turn is determined by a spinner. Whichever player lands on the spot first collects the card.

Another card is drawn, and the same routine continues until all cards are distributed and the winner is the player with the most cards.

name: Lecardo
description:
Lecardo is a card based game which has six games in one package, the two main games being Lecardo Football and Lecardo Farmers both of which use game 'boards'.
As a war time publication it is very minimalistic - rules and the two game boards are printed on one two-sided A3 sheet of paper; the cards each fulfill three different functions
categories: Card Game, Farming, Sports, Word Game

name: Murkku
description:
Murkku - a puzzle to solve for the kids

2-4 players
Ages 5 and up
The length of the game about 30 minutes

Idea of the game:

To over throw your opponent and get rid of the ants.

name: Basquete S.A.
description:
From the Publisher: Buy, sell, trade... In this game you'll also be the star of your team, creating strategies to beat your adversaries e win the championship. Your team fans are a important aspect - the larger the crowd in your arena, more money you'll make. Therefore you'll be able to buy the season best players for your squad building a super team.

NBA licensed game.

name: Don Pipas
description: Game of tour of order. The players must avoid all the dangers and take his(her,your) gentleman to except in the castle

name: Tartarugas comilonas
description: I Play of order. By means of issues of dice of colors the players must lead to the tortoises to the basket of food

name: Disney's Dinosaur Aladar's Quest
description: Aladar's Quest is a board game based on Disney's 2000 movie, Dinosaur. After a flaming meteor destroys much of prehistoric earth, Aladar and his friends must race to reach their new nesting grounds. Players advance by spinning a color wheel. Rock slides and attacking Carnataurs are obstacles that can set players back. The first player to reach the nesting ground is the winner.
categories: Animals, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric, Racing

name: Stop!
description: Pictured in Games We Play, this game involves moving your own trucks across a rural map/maze while blocking your opponents passage.

name: Spell a Spell
description:
This game will determine who the most powerful wizard is. You cast your spell using magic letters, spell words, and spell cards.
Creativity, quick thinking and imagination create a challenging game for the whole family.
The winner is the wizard that left untouched while all the other wizards are turned into bewitched wizards.

name: InQuest Board Game
description:
From the publisher:
InQuest Board Game is an exciting interactive, competitive and challenging game of fun, crime, mystery, forensics and law. For 2 to 8 players. You can win by answering questions in six informative categories at three levels of complexity. “No crimes to solve and no clues to track.” Show off your social and observational skills by answering questions yourself, or ask someone for help… but will they tell you the truth? Are they really your friends?

name: Command Horizon
description:
Set in the 26th Century, the Command Horizon universe offers the chance to collect armies from the various powers, factions, companies, mercenaries and pirates that all compete for power and resources in Human Space.

Thus far, Man has found himself alone in his corner of the Galaxy, but it is only a matter of time before he meets other races whose technological development may equal or even surpass his own.

name: Firefly Gin
description: Card Game with a Firefly/Serenity Theme. Gin/Poker type mechanics. Seven Suites 12 cards each. Win by making combos. Specific cards also can be discarded to produce one of eight different special effects. A quick way to get that Firefly fix. The rules are available for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/FFG.html

name: Oly-opoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

A customized Monopoly set focused on Olympia, Washington, USA.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Spot-a-Plane
description:
The board represents a military strategy map of enemy territory with numerous objective spots from Take Off to Mission Accomplished.

The players advance through the map by identifying silhouettes of friendly and enemy planes. Success allows the player to move forward the number of spaces listed on the card. Failure requires the player to back up as noted on the card. Other spaces on the map include the Army Flash and Danger Flash spots. These force the player to draw a card and follow the instructions noted.

First person to the Mission Accomplished space wins the game.

name: Bivouac
description:
This game is played on a 6x11 board, with a marked 2x2 area on each side (see diagram on website). The 2x2 areas are the goals, while the spaces that immediately surround the goals are the encampments. Surrounding this are the spaces that are called the runs.

On each turn, each player can do one of the following moves:

* Move a stone out of the encampment into an adjacent (orthogonal or diagonal) empty cell in the Run.
* Move a stone into an empty encampment cell from an adjacent (orthogonal or diagonal) cell from the Run.
* Slide a stone in the Run on any orthogonal direction into an empty cell. Jumps are possible over any stone. There are no captures in the Run.
* Inside an encampment the stone may move to any empty (orthogonal or diagonal) adjacent cell. Captures are possible (not mandatory) by jumping over an enemy stone - if the stone lands inside the encampment. Captures can be multiple.

The player that either occupies his four Goal cells or captures all but 3 of the enemy stones wins.

name: Seattle Seahawks Trivia Game
description: Sports Trivia Game about the Seattle Seahawks Professional Football team.

name: My First Matching Game
description: Children's game Ages 3 - 5 that teaches shape and color recognition.

name: HIT
description:
[From Publisher, text on box cover]

Hand Is Tough
If you think you can control yourself, YOU ARE WRONG!
At least your hands may not when you are in HIT.
HITTING the 102 pieces of 14 different game cards is trouble enough, plus tricky guys play in thunder speed, you must get rid of it by your own hands and mouth! Can't you? Check it out! To see your hand is tough or not.
Remember: "NO PAIN, NO GAME"

HIT is laughter making game, can be learned in 5 minutes. Thunder like game speed makes players losing control with their hands, hit the cards whatever they want it or not. Individual thinker falls in a group mind is not amazing in HIT. Actually, playing HIT, losing is better.

It's a game published by a HK company.

name: Commonwealth Navy
description:
From the Rules: The game is intended to be a representation of Target practice as carried out by the Navy; the figured squares in the centre of the board representing the Target, and the shaded squares around the edge of the board representing the course taken by the competing Ships.

The ships always move one square at a time, along the course, in a clockwise direction. The four squares, colored Red, Blue, Green, and Yellow are the starting points, or Stations, from which the Ships commence their practice.Each player in turn rolls the die or spins the teetotem and counts the number in following the arrow. If the end result is a square with a number the player score that value and then moves to the next square.

When all players have gone through 36 stations the player with the highest score wins.

name: Game of SIM
description:
The Game of Sim is a paper and pencil game played by two players, Red and Blue, using six dots ('vertices') arranged in a hexagon. Players alternately draw a line between two dots. The first player to draw a triangle of their color between three dots loses.

The game cannot end in a tie. 15 moves is the maximum. If the game actually lasts 15 moves then the loser will actually complete two triangles at once!

An electronic version is available at: https://wideaperture.net/sim/.

Simmons, Gustavus J. "The game of SIM," J. Recreational Mathematics, 2(2), 1969, pp. 66.

Gardner, M. Mathematical Games, Scientific American, February (1973), pp. 108-112

E. Mead, A Rose, C, Huang, The Game of SIM: A Winning Strategy for the Second Player, Mathematical Report No. 58, 1973, McMaster University.

L.E.Shader, Another Strategy for SIM, Mathematics Magazine, Vol. 51. No. 1, pp. 60-62, 1978.

name: Tutankhamon (en busca de la civilización)
description:
Game where the players make excavations in Egypt to find treasures of the Egyptian civilization.
Casuga Guina published two games.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Filibuster
description:
The battle is for the treasure islands. You have to defend your own island and conquer your opponents island. On the boardgame you have tropical islands, reefs and treasure islands.

Filibuster is a loosely pirate-themed game where players take turns to move black and white plastic ships across a 13x13 square tile board. Apart from sea tiles there are skerry tiles (that cannot be entered), island tiles (which offer protection) and two treasure island tiles (which are the objectives of the game).

Each player has ten corvettes and three galleons at their disposal. Corvettes can land on islands but cannot sink other ships. Galleons, conversely, cannot land on islands but can sink an enemy ship by entering its tile at the end of a full 5-step move. The game ends when one player lands a corvette on the other player's treasure island.

Although there's no explicit art credit, the board bears the legend "Tegnestuen Den gyldne nøgle", Danish for "Studio The Golden Key", the firm name used by the Pagermans (professional artists both). The cover painting, however, showing generic pirate ships closing for battle, has a clipped, unreadable signature that doesn't seem to match either of their names.

name: Snarfquest Miniatures Bonus Pack
description:
An expansion for the first edition of Snarf Quest.

Includes all the miniatures (Snarf in five different poses, plus Telerie, Suthaze, Aveeare, and Raffendorf) and ten bonus cards never seen in any other pack!

Available with blue, black, white, red and yellow borders.

Expands:

Snarf Quest
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval

name: 101 Dalmatians: Spin for Spots
description:
The puppies have lost their spots. Help get them back!

Our playful puppies need their spots! Spin the spinner to be the first to put all the spots back on your puppy!

For 2 to 4 players, Ages 3 and up.

Game Contents: 4 Stand-Up Puppy Playing Pieces With Cardboard Bases, Eight Plastic Assembly Stands For Cardboard Bases, Reusable Puppy Spots, Spinner, And Instructions.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Kingston On Board
description: Kingston On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the city in Ontario, Canada. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Queen's Football Club and Children's Wish Foundation.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Rockford On Board
description: Rockford On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the city in Illinois. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Comprehensive Community Solutions Inc.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Rich Man, Poor Man, Beggarman, Thief
description:
Starting as "beggarmen," players circle the board working their way up the ladder of success. Beggars can get "charity" from non-beggars, rich men and poor men collect regular incomes, and thieves can steal from rich and poor alike. There's fast money to be made through investments and playing the horses, and faster money through gambling on a dice throw--but developing real estate is safer. The many options and sudden changes of fortune make this an exciting, free-wheeling game.

(Description from Nov. 1985 issue of GAMES Magazine, p. 45)
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Bids As Wagers, Income, Investment, Loans, Market, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Track Movement

name: Dogs of War
description:
Players build teams of Mercenaries (Mercs) and send them on missions.

The player with the most money at the end of the game wins. Players can keep their money hidden from each other.

Roll high on 1D6 to determine turn order.
Each player starts with $100,000.
Shuffle the deck.
Each player is dealt 7 cards.

The game ends when a player goes to draw a card from the deck, and there are no cards left.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting

name: Monsterjagd
description: Reaction game for children where players spin an arrow on a board, then try to be the first to find a card that matches the type and color determined by the arrow. The cards depict monsters in four colors, and three different types: father, mother and children.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bilder-Bingo
description: Bilder-Bingo, or picture bingo, from the European Language Institute, is a version of bingo in which players try to complete their bingo cards by recognizing various pictures and/or German words. The game includes 32 bingo player mats and 100 cards, all containing pictures on one side with the corresponding words on the other. The rules include a variety of ways to play the game.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Memory, Word Game

name: Ninchen Lotto
description:
This is a lotto or bingo game that can be played on two levels, depending on the child's age.
There is the standard lotto, with tiles getting turned over one by one, and the first child recognizing it as being on his board claiming it; or the memory version,
where the cards are spread out face down, and the children take turns turning up a card. If it matches a picture on her collecting board, she keeps it and goes again.
If not, she puts it back face down, and play proceeds to the left.
The winner is the first to fill his board.

Artwork by Dick Bruna, the Netherlands

name: Doctor Who: The Time Travelling Action Game
description:
There are many alien life forms roaming the stars, plotting and scheming to alter and control the course of time.
You are the Doctor traveling through time and space in your quest to defeat these forces of evil and save the universe from harm.

Slot the TARDIS with its own light and sound effect into the middle of the unique electronic revolving game board and you're ready to start your journey through time.

In this fast paced and exciting board game, be the first to locate and defeat four of the Doctor's most deadly foes. Time however is unstable and there are regular shifts in the continuum. Whenever this happens the board will rotate and the enemies you are trying to overcome will move and reappear in new dimensions.

Contents:

1 Electronic revolving game board
1 TARDIS model with light and sound effect
1 Pack of game cards
6 Doctor playing pieces
72 Energy tokens
1 Spinner
1 Leaflet


Requires 3 x AA batteries - not supplied.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Seigneuries
description:
Live the adventure of the Seigneurs in New France.

The game of SEIGNEURIES is based on a true historical situation, i.e. the difficulties French faced when settling in Canada. Prior knowledge of the historical context of the game is not necessary in order to play. In playing the game, you may arrive at a situation which is not in strict
accordance with History, however the game should certainly give you a lot of enjoyment.

OBJECT OF THE GAME
The game consists in populating a Seigneurie, and in building the components of a village.

The winner of the game is the first to complete a Seigneurie with 31 censitaires, 1 mill, 1 church, 1 school, 4 roads.

While turning around the board, you encounter squares which make you harvest, trade, feed you people, tax you population and acquire buildings.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Tsuwamono No Michi: The Way Of The Warrior – Samurai Wargame Rules
description:
A set of small scale skirmish action rules based in Japan between the years 1550 to 1620 Sengoku Jidai - The Age Of The Country At War.

Become a Daimyo "Warlord" and control your Samurai and Ashigaru, gain help from Sohei "Warrior Monks" and Ronin "Men Of The Waves". But be cautious other Daimyo are plotting your downfall, the populous are not to be trusted and Akuto "Evil Lawless Bandits" seek every opportunity to strike.
Remember to keep your Shinobi "Ninja" close by and ready to use.

A very fast, furious and fun set of rules that will allow you to become totally engrossed within this period of Japanese history. Tsuwamono No Michi is not a set of rules for the faint hearted!

Covers 15mm and 25mm scales.

name: Where in Space is Carmen Sandiego
description:
Help Carmen Sandiego Steal the Planets. Space Travel! Ghastly Galaxies! Plenty of Pluto!

Explore space and join Carmen Sandiego in her pursuit of the greatest treasures of all: the planets. Players race through the Solar System, visiting the planets and answering questions about them. Can you figure out whether Venus is closer in size to Earth, the Moon, or Saturn? How many moons surround Uranus? If you answer correctly, you capture a planet, but be careful--the other players are hot on your trail.
categories: Educational, Space Exploration, Trivia, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Conclave
description:
From the publisher's site:
From Priest to Cardinal...Become Pope in a Day!

Play the Politics of Papal Selection & Examine the Hierarchy & Bureaucracy of the Roman Catholic Church that has existed for two Thousand Years!

Discover the History & Mysteries surrounding the Vatican. Study its Shocking Story, its Contributions, Doctrines, & Teachings! Uncover its Murky Past, its Violent History, its Bizarre practices & Strange Customs! Learn about Religion, Theology, Biblical and Intriguing Papal History!

Discover the Churches’ Strange Trivia & Historical Facts often unknown to many, and ignored by most!
All this and much, much, more when you Play CONCLAVE! The Game of the Papacy!

2 or More Players, Teens to Adult

Components:
- 1 Game Board
- 1 Deck of Trivia Cards
- 1 Deck of Penitence Cards
- 1 Deck of Indulgence Cards
- 6 Playing Pieces
- 1 Custom Papal Die
- 1 Sand Timer
- 1 Page of Easy Instructions

name: Exact Change
description:
Exact Change - Where having exact change wins the game.

In exact change players add up or subtract from the money amount to win the pot. Players add one coin at a time and you strategically try to be the last player to put the coin down. If you are you win that amount.

The player with all the money wins.

name: Kansas City Scene
description:
Kansas City Scene is a Monopoly variant taking place in set in the KS/MO city. The board spaces are late 1970s-era business from the city.

Part of the Hansen's City Scene Games Series.

From the publisher: Have you ever wanted to own the Kansas City Chiefs, Macy's, the Kansas City Star, or run the Board of Trade? Now is your chance by playing Kansas City Scene.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Denver Scene
description:
Denver Scene is a Monopoly variant taking place in set in Denver, CO. The board spaces are late 1970s-era business from Denver.

Part of the Hansen's City Scene Games line.

From the publisher: Influence the Water Board, make the Canadian connection, join the right club, and deal with the old-moneyed businesses - all part of the Denver Scene.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Candy Land: Fun on the Run
description:
From the publisher: "Every child’s first game in a new compact size for fun on the run! Move along the candy path and be first to reach the Candy Castle and win the game! No reading required to play."

The change for this travel game from the traditional game is the inclusion of a spinner to determine movement instead of the usual cards.

Re-implements:

Candy Land

name: Quizimaze
description: Quizimaze combines knowledge, strategy and luck into one game. The object is to manipulate the existing maze into a dynamic everchanging maze to facilitate your moves in order to score and at the same time delay your opponents from scoring by trapping them in the maze. All the while obtaining points from four categories, science & technology, arts & language, social studies and leisure & games. To win quizimaze you must answer questions correctly and manipulate the maze to your advantage.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tri-Chinese Checkers
description:
A 3-dimensional variant on Chinese Chess. The board consists of 3 tiers. All player pieces begin on the bottom tier, but the only way out is up to the middle tier. The middle tier is an open grid, and connects to both the top and bottom tiers. The top tier is a copy of the bottom tier, but reversed -- it contains the destinations that the players are racing to reach. Each player tried to be the first one to get all 10 of his pieces from his starting zone on the bottom tier to his destination zone on the top tier, making standard Chinese chess moves and hops (but extended to 3d).

The game supports 2-4 players.

name: Nabuko
description:
From the editor´s webpage:

PARTICIPANTS. 2 players.
OBJECTIVE. Leaving the opponent without cards.
GENERAL IDEA. Each player has in its hands 24 of the most prominent general and conquerors of history. The way to organize them and how to use them determines the winner.

KEY.
1. Knowing the history of every conqueror to use their items that are crucial in fighting.
2. Remember the position of the rivals cards.

Each of the cards of the game reveals the skills of 48 generals and conquerors from the history of the world and deploy them in a single battle. The objective? Each player must enforce the conditions of each conqueror to use strategically and achieve victory.

name: Magical Circle Guruguru
description:
A simple dungeon crawl simulating card-game based on the Japanese comic/animation "Magical Circle Guruguru".
The boss card is placed in the center, the rest of the cards placed in an expanding circle, all cards partially covering at least 2 other cards. Each turn, a player may advance in the dungeon by picking up one card that isn't covered by any other card, and follow the instructions on it.

name: Hime-mekuri
description:
Hime-mekuri = Princess-flip. A home made card game based on the classic Japanese card game "monk flip". All cards are amateur art of existing anime characters, and a fair number is pretty erotic.
Players take turns drawing cards, and playing cards. Some cards allows you to add the play pile to your collection, others to steal some cards from the collection of others, and some cards are weird chain reaction that forces cards out of other players' hands.

name: Qué Artista!
description:
The players, individually or in teams, make fun art activities, drawing, acting and modeling with mass.

Make a model of a "sea horse" an they try to recognize your work, drawing "The Three Musketeers" or acts "Lord of the rings"

If you manage to be understood you can be the awarded artist... and winner of the game!
The cards that indicate the activities are divided into two groups, two levels of play:
Beginners and advanced.

Que Artista! is a very complete game to enjoy with family and friends. Exercise and test your ability to express in a very fun way: drawing, acting and modeling with mass!
mechanics: Acting, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Team-Based Game

name: The Petsberry Board Game
description:
From the manufacturer:

When morning dawns in Petsberry, USA, you'll find fish, birds, kittens, & puppies around every corner. You're a pet shop owner! Kids Make wise advertising decisions, hire the right people, expand your business - or just slander the competition!

It's all in the Petsberry board game!

name: Return of the Armies: The Battle of Prairie Grove
description:
A game of The War for Southern Independence Series. This is the smallest game of the series with only 2 map sections. The game depicts the Battle of Prairie Grove, Arkansas fought on December 7, 1862. Confederate General John Hindman attacked one of two Union Armies that were split. In the game, Gen. Hindman must defeat Union General Francis Herron's Army before General Blunt's Army can attempt to rescue the attacked Union force.
The game has Exclusive Rules for this battle that include Confederate poor training and poor supply situation, Union fatigue & Union recklessness.

The War for Southern Independence Game System is a tactical gaming system which comes with standard rules and unique rules for each individual game.
The system uses hexes with each representing 435 yards and each strength point on the troop counters represents between 100 and 350 men. Each artillery point represents 2 cannons. Game turn length represent 30 minutes of time.
The game system is loosely based on the old SPI's Blue & Grey system with a modified combat system using a D10 with rolls based on odds rather than a CRT. Leadership rules were added as leaders often made the difference in an ACW battle.
Other battles in this series are:
Elkhorn Tavern, Oak Hill, Fort Donelson & Iuka.

name: Noah's Ark Lotto
description: "Each player takes a large card. Separate the small cards and place them face down on the table. The first player draws a card and tries to match it to his large card. If it matches, it is placed on the card, and the player draws another card. He continues as long as he draws a matching card. when the card does not match, it is returned face down to the pile. The next player then takes his turn. The first one to fill his card is the winner.

name: Math Mat Challenge
description:
In this game the mat gives players equations, after which they do the math and stay on the right answer. The game gets faster when more answers are given. The players that take too long to do the math have to stop, after which only one player remains.

Factor Frenzy looks very much like this game, here you only use your hands to give the answers.

name: Potato Head Kids Game
description:
The Potato Head Kids Game is a spin-and-move game for children Ages 3 - 6. Though it adopts the movement mechanism from Candy Land, it also includes a tactile component through the gradual reconstruction of your character.

From the box:
The Potato Head Kids are so excited about their new clubhouse that they've gone all to pieces - a shoe here, a body there, arms and hats everywhere. Can you help put them together again?

Spin the spinner and move around the gameboard. Land on the right spaces and win the missing parts of your Potato Head Kid. But be careful, on some spaces you can lose parts too. Then you have to go around the gameboard again and win them back. Enter the clubhouse first with a perfectly put-together Potato Head Kid and win the game!
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Harry Potter 3-D Mini Game
description:
There are two versions of this game:

Capture the Pixies: Pixies are loose in Lockhart's classroom - capture the most to win.

Escape the Dursleys': Rescue Harry with the Flying Car. Escape before Uncle Vernon catches him to win.

Both games have the same name, but exist out of different castles. In both games you have to roll with dices to get further in the game.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Monopoly: Fisher Scientific Centennial Edition
description: This is a re-theme of Monopoly to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Fisher Scientific, a laboratory supply company. The houses and hotels have become "labs and research centers." The cards and board have been changed to include Fisher Scientific related text, and the pawns are pewter miniatures of: an Erlenmeyer flask, Fisher Scientific catalog, Bunsen burner, microscope, mortar & pestle, and apothecary weight.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Happy Clown
description:
Here come the happy clowns. Can you help them with their balancing act? Don't let the pieces fall off! The player who attaches all their juggling pieces onto the clowns first wins the game. An advanced game variation with die is included for added challenging fun.

It is a children's game. Composed of two cardboard clowns intersected with each other. The aim of this game is to become the first who gets rid of all the pieces in his/her hand. Players have to put the funny items into one of the clowns hands or feet.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: And the Winner Is...
description:
From the box:

You've sat on the edge of your seat waiting for the envelope to be opened. Now you can bring the excitement home with the trivia game devoted to Hollywood's big night, and that little golden man they call Oscar - with the winner, the losers, the speeches and the stories from behind the scenes. Multiple choice questions make it perfect for parties or help winning this year's office pool. Ages 12 and up
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Square
description:
A straightforward edge-matching placement game consisting of 32 square tiles (called 'stones' in the rules), each a red plastic frame inset with a white plastic square which has symbols cutout on the edges. Each edge has either no cutout (a blank edge), or half a square, circle or diamond.

Players take turns to add tiles to the layout, always matching edges. Scoring is simple: whenever a player completes a square or rectangle of tiles of any size they score points equal to the number of tiles in the square or rectangle.

Each player starts with 10 stones, and must play if possible each turn. If not, they take a stone from the reserve. As soon as one player has played all his stones the game ends and the scores are tallied. Any stones remaining with a player count as -1; if he has taken from the reserve at any time during the game then each stone remaining counts as -5!

The game was made in England by Merit, and appears to date from the 50s or 60s (no date is given on the game materials). The so-called stones are nicely made components that fit neatly into the small square box.

The rules suggest that there are 35 stones in the game. The combinations of symbols that appear on the stones are:

4 symbols the same (all 4 possible stones)
3 symbols the same, 1 different (all 12 possible combinationss)
2 pairs of 2 symbols, matching pairs are adjacent (all 6 possible combinations)
1 pair the same and 2 other symbols, matching pair is adjacent (12 of 24 possible combinations, including one of each mirror-image pair)
4 different symbols (1 of 6 possible combinations).

name: Gamble
description:
To Gamble uses a seesaw and two sets of cubus-weights in red and yellow colors with number 1 to number 10.

The idea of this game is to collect as many of your own and of your opponents weights as possible after 10 weighing actions.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management

name: Serpentino
description:
This simple game consists of tiles with parts of cute colorful snakes. The players try to make the longest snake.Serpentino is a Dutch game for younger children. There are two ways of playing, one more suited to very young kiddies.

The 54 cards are used, to form seven snakes. Four of the snakes have seven parts to their body plus a head and a tail, whilst three other snakes have four parts to their body plus, again, a head and a tail.

Four children can play the simpler game. The cards are shuffled and placed face-down in a stack. In his turn, a player takes the top card and if it is a head, he places it in front of him. Now, on future turns, another card is drawn. If it is a body part, it is added to the head and so on. The idea is to for each player to make a snake as long as possible after drawing a head, but if a tail is drawn, that completes the snake and a new snake must be 'started' by drawing another head card. Unusable cards are discarded and are shuffled once the draw pile has been exhausted. The winner is the player who has made the most snakes or, as an alternative, the player who has made the longest snake.

The slightly more difficult game only uses the four snakes with nine parts. A single child can probably have fun just making snakes, perhaps consisting of a head, 40 body parts and a tail.

name: Risky
description: The idea is to collect on a round course as many stones of your color as possible and to bring them to your destination.

name: Doppelspass
description:
It's a soccer game that was published 2005, one year before World championship 2006.
Two dice move 3 pawns and 2 goalkeeper over the field to score more goals than your opponent.

name: Wunderwelt Wissen: Das Spiel
description:
Players act as editors in search of interesting themes for the next broadcast.

To win you have to have knowledge in six different categories (like history, technology, nature, ...)

It's a trivia game relating to the tv show "Wunderwelt Wissen".
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Tatu Brasilis and Steps and Snakes
description:
Tatu Brasilis
Help the Armadillo to arrive in the party in a unforgettable journey inside Brazil. You will help him to cross some dangerous and will discovery the beauties of the country.

Steps and Snakes
In return of the party of the Armadillos, you goes to follow our friends Armadillos to the beach and learn a lot of things about trips, like dangerous and good ways to have a good trip.

name: Hexagonal Chess for three
description:
This is a variant of Hexagonal Chess by W. Glinski - a variant designed for three players.

Each player starts from his own board corner of the hexagonal board (120 degrees from his rivals). Rules of pieces movement are the same as in two-player version (with the exception that there is no main front-back board axis but every player has his own one determining pawn movement). The player who checkmates any of the enemies' kings wins, the checkmated player and the third one (a.k.a. "observer") both lose.

name: Lien Poh
description:
This is a Hokkien gambling game played in South-east Asia. Lien Poh literally translates as 'turning treasure'. The cube is the Poh or 'treasure' and the metal box is the Poh Kam or 'treasure cover'.

Most Poh have the same face on all sides, with the functional part being the red and white colouring/marking. The red portion is a stylized Chinese character, Tong, and the white portion is another character, Ying. However, there are examples where the design is completely abstract and sides may have different designs.

There are known instances where the characters are 寶 and 通 (bao and tong).

In order to play the game, a betting diagram is roughly drawn on paper - a square sheet is divided into four triangular areas by two diagonal lines. Punters bet on which area the red side will end up facing.

The person operating the game puts the Poh into the Poh Kam, leaving a bit of room for the Poh to be rattled around inside. It then settles into the smaller part of the metal container and the Poh Kam is closed all the way. The whole block is then spun. When it comes to rest, the block is placed in the centre of the diagram so that each side lines up with one of the 4 areas. The cover is lifted and the red side will be facing one of the 4 areas - punters who bet in that area win their bet.

The game is described in C.T. Dobree's book, Gambling Games of Malaya (q.v.) and it mentions that the name of the game in Kelantan is 'Ewok'. There's also a description of how operators of the game could cheat at it.


The game is also described in Stewart Culin's book "Chinese Games with Dice and Dominoes" on pages 507-508. He writes:

The po tsz', or covered die, is not, properly, a die game at all. It consists of a small wooden cube, which is placed in a square receptacle in the top of a brass prism, over which a brass cover fits very closely. A specimen exhibited by His Highness, the Sultan of Johore in the section of games at the Columbian Exposition consisted of a wooden cube about one-half an inch square, having one-half of each face painted red and one-half white. The prism in which the cube fitted was slightly convex on the bottom, and, when placed upon a smooth surface, could be twirled rapidly. The game is played by placing the box containing the po in the center of a square crossed by diagonal lines, which is drawn upon a mat. One of the four divisions of the square is painted red. One of the four divisions of the square is painted red. The players lay their bets upon the other divisions and the box is spun rapidly by the gamekeeper, who repeats the operation until it comes to rest squarely with the corners corresponding with the indersecting lines. The cover is then lifted, and those who have staked opposite the red side of the die win. The banker wins when the red side comes opposite the side of the square painted red. There is said to be a current notion, amounting to a superstition among the Chinese in Johore, that if a player stops the box as it is spinning the luck will surely go against him.

Another specimen in the Sultan's collection, called at Johore, kong poh (Chinese t'ung po), "current treasure," furnishes an explanation of the name po. It consists of a wooden die, with a face 1 3/8 inches square, and three-forths inch thick, which fits into a brass box with a broad base. A wooden cover fits over the box. This die is not spun, but is concealed in a bag which accompanies it, and there adjusted by the gamekeeper. The face of the wooden die is carved with the characters t'ung po, on one side in the ordinary, and on the reverse in seal characters, the character t'ung being painted red, and po white. The inscription t'ung po "current treasure," occurs on the face of all modern Chinese coins, and the common name of the game is evidently derived from the character po, which occurs on this block.

It should be noted that when Culin refers to "po tsz'" he most likely means "tóu zi" (骰子) which is usually translated as just "dice" and not "covered die." When he refers to the die with the characters "t'ung po" written upon it, he is refering to tōng bǎo (通寶) which means "open treasure" not "current treasure."

name: Elf-Mann-Ho
description:
From the author:

"Elf-Mann-Ho is a chess-like game for fast-thinkers. Skilled moving of the fast runners, the goal getters and other players is the way to win the game. Goals are shot at with a twenty-sided die - a really realistic boardgame about soccer."

The game contains:
1 board
1 D20
2 D6
1 D8
10 "normal" soccer pawns in red and yellow
2 goalies
2 forwards
6 runners
6 dribblers
1 ball
1 knitting needle to measure how long (and where) the ball is shot
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jenga Cubes
description:
Jenga Cubes is part of the Jenga series of games. The logo printed on the tower matches the Jenga logo on the rest of the series.

The game consists of 25 dice-like black cubes, each with blue, green, and red faces. The cubes stack nicely inside a Plexiglas tower that has slots cut out on alternating sides at each level (24 on the tower and 1 dislodged cube). It is possible to carefully push out cubes leaving the above cubes in place by ensuring that that the remaining cube supports the ones above.

The rules of the game differ from those of the traditional Jenga in which, the players will each be assigned a color (by way of rolling one of the dice) and will try to make one of the faces of the tower all of their color (e.g. orange player will try to make one of the faces of the tower orange).

Every turn the player will roll the dislodged cube, and take the color face-up and push it against in the tower (using any side) until a cube on the opposite side falls out. If it is not possible to push that color, the dice is re-rolled.

Note: if the cube that comes up lands with the face-up of your color, you get another turn (no limit on turns as long as your color keeps coming up).

name: Luftikus
description:
Each player gets 6 tiles in different colors.
6 tiles with a star are placed on the table in a circle.
The Luftikus, a single pawn, is placed on one of the tiles.

Assembly-Phase:
The players are taking turns in throwing the die and moving the Luftikus in the circle by the number of the die. The color where the Luftikus landed can be taken away out of his 6 tiles. If it reaches "green", the green tile of the active player is placed aside. Then the active player rolls the die again and hits "blue". His blue tile is set upon his green tile from the turn before to start a tower of tiles. He can play so long until a color is hit that is already in the tower. When all player have finished their turn, that player with the first finished tower gets the left over tiles of the other players as points.

Disassembly-Phase:
Then the tower is build down, accordingly to the first phase.

name: Die harte Nuss
description:
Content:

24 Nest-cards (green back)
36 Nut-cards (brown back)

The animals of the woods get themselves ready for winter.
The hamsters collect nuts and provide supply nests at different locations. The players take the role of the hamsters trying to get supply nests by combining several nut cards together.
The player with the most supply nets wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Math

name: Eroberung des Weltraumes
description:
The whole world is eagerly watching the efforts of the big countries to reach the moon and the adventures of their astronauts.
In the game each player is astronaut and commandant of a space ship. He has to try to lead his space craft safely to the moon through all danger and afterwards to return to the earth first.

name: Elkhorn Tavern-The Battle that Lost Missouri to the Union
description: The game is one of five in the War for Southern Independence Series. This is a simulation of the Southern campaign to retake Missouri: Elkhorn Tavern (also known as Pea Ridge)in April 1862. The game uses a a bombardment chart and a single d10 combat system with modifications for terrain and odds. Units are counters of infantry, cavalry, and artillery. The game is based on the old Civil War SPI quad system. The Series uses a set of standard rules and special rules that apply to each battle. Map scale varies from 176 to 450 yards depending on the game. Other games in the series are: Oak Hills, Fort Donelson, Iuka, and Prairie Grove.

name: Robomaso
description:
From publishers website:

Low-budget original boardgame for 2 – 4 players, packaged in the foil as a magazine. Strategy "shooting" game with robots at the space ship. Players gain various improvements and weapons for their robots. Each game is different thanks to the variable setting of the space ship. In each game a different strategy leads to a victory...

Robomaso (could be translated to English as Robocarnage) is a humorous Czech sci-fi game similar to RoboRally but yet significantly different.

Each player has two robots of various war clans, with whom he/she moves every round under some restrictive, but decision allowing rules, and tries to survive and hunt other robots. The ultimate goal is to complete a set of program instructions (chits in-game) for some kind of weapon, the robots should originally destroy.

The game also features the modular tile placement, which takes place on each round before the movement, and brings a a different playing board each time, for much better replayability.

Having a very nice price for such a game, it is a cheap print on waxed paper, cut-before-play, but with some colour (robots, some important chits and tiles, etc., most tiles and chits are essentially black and white, which just fits well for a space theme), and especially if laminated can remain for a long time.
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Bürokros
description:
From publishers website:

Low budget original board game for 2 – 4 players, packaged in the foil as a magazine. Strategy and combining game from the political scene in some unnamed country. Each player try to gain a post in four main departments – the Ministry of Finance, the Church, the Espionage and the Ministry of Defence.

Bürokros is a humorous Czech political game.

Each player leads a political party and tries to gain power in a country by installing his/her people to one of four offices. But the installment itself brings no power. You have to have most influence in the office to gain various posts.

You have to crawl the pyramid up to the top to gain power over the office. Some of the higher posts also bring specific powers, you can use each round, as long as you're in the function.

You can also gain some other powers or effects by wisely investing. You can recruit faster, or send enemies to prison. only the one, who can rule all of the offices can rule the country.

Having a very nice price for such a game, it is a cheap print on waxed paper, cut-before-play, but with some colour (all the chits, the board itself and the power cards are black and white), and especially if laminated can remain for a long time.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Die diebische Elster
description:
The goal of the game is to get the most colored rings on your finger.

You roll the dice. Then, you either get a ring (face down in front of you, random color) or you can ask someone for one. If you ask someone you have to ask for a color that the asked person owns. Otherwise you will not get a ring in the color you asked for. If you have 3 rings of the same color they are safe (on your finger).

name: Tetris
description:
Each player receives an individual board which they try to fill up with Tetris tiles. These are taken blindly in real time. Pieces must be played from the bottom up, as in the video game. Unwanted pieces can be given to opponents, who must play them. The object is to have the fewest open spaces on one's board when the game ends.

This should not be confused with the Tomy Tetris or Tetris Tower 3D.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Puzzle, Real-time, Video Game Theme

name: Limbo: The Game of Catholic Trivia!
description:
Limbo: The game of Catholic Trivia for all ages," Limbo is a blend of Catholic trivial pursuit and, well, Bingo. Players, starting with the player who most recently went to confession, take turns rolling dice to choose a difficulty category (from Level 1, "feel plenty of guilt if you miss this question," to Level 5, "Sister's star pupil"!), then choose a category (Liturgy, In the News, Martyrs Saints & Sinners, Books, and Old-Time Religion). A question is then asked, Trivial Pursuit-style from a box of questions, and if the correct answer is given, the player can "mark off" a "Bingo" card with a white marker.

The first player to get five spaces in a row, horizontally or vertically, Bingo-style, wins.

name: Guiearth Saga
description:
This game is attached with Tactics magazine #66 in Japan. This game is fantasy multi-player game covering the era of reconstruction after the long and chaotic war against dragons.
This is the first of Okamoto's triology. The second is Victory in the Galaxy covering sci-fi and the third is Shadow of K's Birlcess covering horror.
These 3 games are real gem which is truely original at the date. Unfortunately even in Japan these games are almost forgotten, because these games were attached with not the boardgame issue but with the RPG issue of Tactics magazine. So that, most Japanese board gamers had no chance to see these games.

name: Ironrod: The Search for the Tree of Life
description:
Ironrod: The Search for the Tree of Life is an LDS game based on Lehi's vision of the tree of life in 1 Nephi 8 (from the Book of Mormon). The board features a weaving path that goes through the Iron Rod, the Mists of Darkness, the Great and Spacious Building, and the River of Filthy Water. Players draw colored cards that determine what square s/he will go to next. Some special cards allow you to skip ahead, go to a certain part of the board, or force you to go backwards on the path. The winner is the first player to reach the tree of life.

From the publisher: Around 600 BC there lived a prophet named Lehi. Lehi dreamed about a straight and narrow path that led to the Tree of Life. In the center of the path was the Ironrod. By clinging to the Ironrod and pressing forward, one could reach the Tree of Life. Along the path, one must be very careful not to slip away and get trapped in the Mist of Darkness, the River of Water, or the Great and Spacious Building. The consequence for slipping away would cause a prolonged arrival to the Tree of Life. In order to win the game, one must reach Lehi and the Tree of Life by taking the shortest path. The surest way to reach the Tree of Life first is to stay on the path and follow the Ironrod.

name: Over There
description:
This Milton Bradley Game (#4168) was produced in 1918 after America entered WWI. The cover artwork of American soldiers in the field in Europe is superb, but the game itself is simple. It comes with 10 counters (5 of each color) and 1 dial. The game board features 5 lines of 26 dots on each line.

The object of the game is to capture your opponent's men. Players use a spinner to determine the number of spaces they can move on any given turn. With each spin, the player can move any of his five pieces. In order to capture an opposing piece, a player must spin and land by exact count on the opposing piece on that line. There is a "shell hole" on each line that offers safety from capture.

Capturing a piece closes that line, and the capturing player can then place his free piece on any other still open line, increasing the opportunities to spin the exact number needed to capture another enemy piece on that line. The first player to capture all of the opposing pieces wins the game.

name: 9 Treasures
description: "Who gets the best cards gets the best treasures... The treasure seekers try to receive as many matching cards as possible to have valuable treasure-maps!"

name: Guzzlin' Gators
description: This game very closely resembles Hungry Hungry Hippos, except the hippos are replaced by alligators and the lever mechanism that causes the heads to eat the marbles operates a bit differently, requiring more pushing than pulling. The game includes twenty plastic marbles for the gators to eat along with a rule sheet providing multiple variations on play.

name: Auctioneer
description:
Auctioneer is a game in which the players take the place of dealers and collectors from overseas, who by buying and selling aim to build up a collection of antiques and objects d'art. The winner of the game is the player who by shrewd dealing, has aquired all the available property and money, thus eliminating his opponents.

Each of the 48 articles illustrated in the game is a genuine work of art and all of them may be seen at the Victoria and Albert Museum in London

name: Viatge per Catalunya
description:
Simple game of competition in which the players must travel around Catalonia visiting certain places determined randomly by cards.
For ages 8 and up. Contents: one mapboard with the map of Catalonia, 87 illustrated visit cards, 6 travel cards, one die and 6 tokens.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Educa Sallent SA, Sallent hnos, S.A.

name: Red Actions: Interventionists
description:
A supplement for the Russian Civil War game Red Actions. It adds a number of "interventionist" units of various nationalities. It also revises a number of components for Red Actions.

Available for free download from:
http://perfectcaptain.50megs.com/request.html
categories: Book, Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Asalto: Jaime I conquista Mallorca
description:
Wargame published in Spain. Edition with few means, is an incunable. It reflects the Catalan conquest from Majorca to the Muslims in 1229.
Components: book of rules, dice, map and four counter sheets.

name: Geozoo
description:
Idea of this game is to build up a landscape on the board. For this purpose sections of landscape cuttings are placed on the board. The players get points for these placements.
Winner is the player who has the most points when the landscape is finished.

name: Raumschiff Galaxis
description: Each player tries to bring 5 freight containers to the space stations with his space ship. The players block each other though, and the destination computer is playing up. Winner is the player who has delivered his freight containers and returned back to the basic field first.

name: Lass mein Känguruh in Ruh!
description: During the drying season all kangaroos are very thirsty. It is necessary that they reach the next water hole. The kangaroo pairs, mother and baby, must overcome the obstacles and reach the rescuing water hole. Those who reach the water first, may drink first. The player of the first kangaroo wins.

name: Schischaukel
description: Each player tries to collect as many points as possible by good placements in the 5 downhill ski-races. The winner is the player who has achieved the highest score after the last race.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Doktor K. jagt 006
description:
A trick-taking card game around Agent 006.
The players try to get as many tricks as possible. In the tricks there may be identity cards which can be traded in for agent equipment cards.
The players with 6 or more equipment cards wins the game.

name: Max & Moritz
description: The players try to play a coup of Max & Moritz. Whoever succeeds in playing a coup may give away a chip. Whoever gets rid of his chips first wins the game.

name: Hastings 1066: Ein Ritter Spiel
description:
HASTINGS 1066 EIN RITTER SPIEL
Release date: March 2008

Duke William of Normandy has crossed the channel to win the English throne. Harold Godwinson has rushed south to meet him. What follows is a classic battle that will change world history.

In Hasting, two players take on the roles of William and Harold. They command their armies and try to herd their enemy into a killing ground. It is the ultimate game of skill.

Ein Ritter Spiel is a dice-less battle game that allows players to be a general without the danger of real warfare.

Ein Ritter Spiel games come in a box with a 21x16 inch hard board map, an order of battle, laminated rules, and wooden counters.

TYPE: Ein Ritter Spiel – Dice-less War game
PLAYERS: 2 to 10
AGE: 12 to adult
DURATION: 1 hour
COMPLEXITY: Moderate
REPLAYABILITY: High

name: Krunch-A-Commie
description: Quick, simple miniature rules for armor and infantry combat of the 1950's and 1960's.

name: Wuffi komm heim!
description: The small dog gang is on a bone hunt. The player, who collected three bones with his dog first, wins the round.

name: Stop Light: The Amazing Magnetic Race Game
description:
Stop Light is the amazing magnetic maze game. Magnetic traffic lights change like magic at any of 100 intersections.

There are two ways to play. In the first a card is drawn and the first person to get their car to the location first wins that card. Another card is then drawn and play continues in this fashion until all 18 cards have been collected. The winner is the person with the most cards. The alternate way to play is the Cross Town game. The cards are not used in this one and the winner is first player to cross town by hitting the fewest red lights.

Magnets are placed in the plastic base according to the instructions and then the game board is placed on the base. As the players car moves on the board the magnet in the bubble in the car may flip from red to green depending on the magnetic action caused by the base.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: South Carolinaopoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

Hey Let's Give a Cheer! Carolina is Here!
Can’t get enough of USC? Here’s the game for you! Buy, sell and trade University of Carolina properties such as The Horseshoe, Williams-Brice Stadium, Cock-a-Boose Railroad, and Carolina Mall. Choose your token and advance to Register and Proceed. Who knows? You may be the next Cocky!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Emanations
description:
Link your stones to gain points.
The object of the game is to gain the most points by forming links between your stones. Players take turns placing a stone. If the stone can be linked to any other friendly stone(s) in one of the eight directions (north, south, east, west, northeast, northwest, southeast, southwest), then a line of friendly pebbles is placed on all spaces along the paths connecting the stones. A connection cannot be made if an enemy stone lies along the path to the friendly stone.

The score corresponds to the number of pebbles owned by each player. The game ends when there are no remaining moves. The player with the most pebbles wins.

name: Gwiazdy Okej!
description:
You don't have to wait till the stars are right! If you want to summon your favorite Mythos creature, make the stars OK yourself!

The players first create their own star diagram on the piece of paper and then play various cards to recreate it on the board.

Good clean fun for the whole Whateley family.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Des Kaisers neue Kleider
description: The emperor and its royal household walk proudly in the palace garden. Everyone made the cunning weavers manufacture a marvelous dress for him. By great fear to be considered as too stupid neither the emperor nor its officials dare to throw a view on their shade. There they can recognize that they are naked in reality. Fortunately a small boy, who sits in a tree in the palace garden, and the players don't let themselves deceive by the stupid trick of the weavers. Gradually the boy and the players hold the naked image before the faces of the vain emperor and its attendants. A little to search they must thereby, and the cunning weavers try likewise to donate confusion. Who finds three of the twelve naked images first, exposed the treacherous weavers and wins the game.

name: Auf Nummer sicher
description:
Pay attention to your own moves - as well as to the move of your co-players. Because only the player who is able to make an error free move at last can win.
The difficulty consists of the fact that no pawn of the same color may stand left, right, above, down or diagonally beside the set cone.

name: A Hole in Your Pocket
description:
Objective: to be the first player to hold a hand of plus cards that add up to one dollar without having any minus cards.

Players are dealt a hand of five cards. Players draw one card from draw pile. Minus cards may be discarded by discarding a plus card of the same value at the same time. If there are no minus cards in a player's hand, play moves to the next player. Play continues, with the discard pile being shuffled to form a new draw pile, until one player reaches the objective.

name: Concentrate on LDS Presidents
description: This is a family card game aimed at the LDS (Mormon) community. It utilizes a concentration/matching ruleset to have players to learn and utilize facts about LDS church leaders in order to make matches.

name: Mirror Game
description:
(from the back of the box)

An exciting game which is also both amusing and instructive. The game commences by turning up a pattern card. Each player then attempts to form a mirror image of the pattern using 2 bricks and a mirror. The first to succeed wins the pattern card. The player collecting [the] most pattern cards wins the game. Using the mirror can be tricky, and an understanding of the symmetry of a pattern is an advantage in the game.

name: Pi-Pa-Poker
description: It is a kind of memory game where the three syllables "Pi" "Pa" "Poker" must be found.

name: Hold to the Rod: Primary Edition
description: Like "Hold to the Rod: Book of Mormon Edition", this game is a simplified version with easier trivia and tasks for a younger audience.
publishers: Deseret Book, Teancum Games and Products

name: Gospel Explosion: the Acts of the Apostles
description:
From the text of the author's patent:

"The game is played on a game board of the Ancient Mediterranean World. Each player is given several playing pieces representing Apostles, early leaders in the Christian church. He moves these around the board winning converts and establishing churches as quickly as possible. Unlike most games, players do not compete against each other. They cooperate as the early Apostles did to spread Christianity throughout the world. Competition is provided by the game itself, through two sets of cards, many of which inflict persecution or misfortune upon the various churches and Apostles. An intelligent group of players, cooperating with each other, can overcome this opposition and successfully spread Christianity throughout the Roman Empire, thus winning the game."

Gospel Explosion: the Acts of the Apostles has been awarded U.S. Patent Number 4441718.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: UNO: Chicago White Sox
description:
Another Uno variation. This features the theme of the Major League Baseball (MLB) team, the Chicago White Sox

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Manager" card and rule, which does not correspond to any card/rule in regular Uno.
publishers: Fundex, Mattel, Inc., Sababa Toys, Inc.

name: Fingers Harry
description: Game is advertized as the Wildest, Wackiest most Wonderful Magnetic Chase Game Yet. Its a game of cops and robbers. Its trying to keep the robber from getting the money or trying to catch the robbber or trying to keep the robber from catching you.

name: Fraktarnaspelet
description:
Most possibly a game published by the transportation company "Fraktarna" as a company-promotional item.

(Translated from Swedish from the box back):
The exciting transport adventure through Europe.

Fraktarnaspelet is a realistic transportation game where each player gets the chance to feel the speed and excitement as a truck driver through a Europe not only filled with nice roads and friendly cosiness.
Here you get to meet grumpy border guards, Bascian guerrilla, mafiosi and a stern traffic police. The reward is the number of points you receive as you deliver your cargo in time to the right place.
The player who manages to first return to his starting position after getting together 50,000 points through diligent freighting is declared the winner.

name: Dolphin Game
description:
Contents: Board, 4 dolphins, 25 shells, 52 sand cards, 2 water stones

The four dolphins want to find 5 pearls, which are hidden under the shells. Do they succeed before the sand covers all free fields, or surrounds a dolphin? If they do the game is won.

name: Point
description:
Point is thinkably simple. The basis for this game is the classical Pachisi for which Nuernberger has put together some exciting new versions.
In spite of using dice POINT is not a game of pure chance. The dice bring in some surprising effects. You win with your own head.
In POINT the pawns are dice whose values increase during the game. The aim field is divided in different values. Using a combination of aim values and dice values there is an almost endless possibility of many different strategies.

There are the following versions playable:

- Poker POINT
- Happy POINT,
- Lucky POINT,
- Funny POINT,
- Penny POINT,
- Dracula
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Aha
description:
Content: board, 3 big dice, 3 x 6 wooden chips

The players try on there turn to achieve as high a score as possible according to the given rules.

This is game No. 4 (of at least 12) in a family called "Miniplays".

name: Pro
description:
Content: 3 white dice, 3 black dice, 1 red die

2 players try to roll as many high score rounds as possible. The player with the highest total wins.

Game No. 1 (of at least 12) in the family called "Miniplays".

name: Charon
description: The aim of the game is to move as many pawns as possible to the opposite corner. The player who has all his still in the game remaining pawns in the opposite corner wins. Even if one player has left only one pawn on the board, he wins the game by having the one pawn in the opposite corner.

name: The Play's The Thing Comedy Set
description:
An expansion set to the game: The Play's the Thing: Game of Shakespearean Theater.

The set features cards from the plays: As You Like It, Twelfth Night, and A Midsummer Night's Dream.

Each set allows players to dash and duel around the Globe Theater board, while bringing the characters, the words and the plots of Shakespeare to life in a fun, engaging way.

Each of the three card sets inside this expansion set includes:
Character Cards - with questions and facts about the memorable characters of each play.
Script and Quote Cards - that bring context and meaning to Shakespeare's words.
Plot Cards - that help you understand Shakespeare, instead of just reading it.
Cast Card - that identifies the major players of each featured play.

Expands:

The Play's the Thing

name: Wonka-Tonka
description:
Content:
board, 6 Indians, 1 wooden feather container, 18 feather, 1 color die

Carefully the small Indians slide from totem pole to totem pole in order to get the prettiest feather from the hiding place. But pay attention - another Indian may sneak a feather away from you. Who will catch the most feathers?

name: Gridlock
description:
Players take turns placing their pyramids on an 8x8 grid (chessboard). Then players in turn, drop pieces, placing them on their side facing away from them. If the pyramid is still facing away from them at the end of the game, they earn points for it, depending on size. When a piece is dropped, it can "turn" one or more other pieces - that is, change the direction of other pieces along the path in which it is pointing, so that those pieces are also pointing away from the player who dropped the piece. The number of pieces a piece can turn is dependent upon its size; a large pyramid can turn three other pieces, a medium two, and a small piece only one.

On your turn, you choose a piece to drop, and then you turn the correct number of pieces in front of the piece you just dropped, so that they are all pointing away from you.

However: only pieces that are lying down are turned. Pieces that are standing upright are left standing upright. This means that in some cases, particularly early in the game, you won't get to turn any pieces even if you drop a large piece.

Rules can be found on Wunderland.com

Game System

Icehouse Pieces

name: Hungry Harry
description:
Hungry Harry makes use of the game box as a stand to place the score tray in and stand Hungry Harry up.
The idea is for players to take turns taking aim and throwing the balls into Hungry Harrys mouth and they are then fired from his guns and into the scoring tray. Players score 1 for a red hole, 2 for blue and 3 for green.
There are various ways to play the game and these are explained in the rules.

name: Gushers 'n Dusters
description:
Gushers 'n Dusters is an educational game about the petroleum industry and the risks and challenges of exploring for oil and gas. Designed for middle and high school students...

In addition to providing insight into important elements of the petroleum industry, Gushers 'n Dusters presents concepts of geology and economics. Through role play and strategy development, players come to understand basic scientific and entrepreneurial principles while...enjoying fun-filled competition and risk-taking.

Whether they play oil company executives, drilling company specialists, or shrewd bankers, students learn about the free enterprise system and confront the need to respond to national energy shortages in the hypothetical nation of Kortu.

Game parts include map board of Kortu, study prints, practice boards, drilling boards, seismic surveys, drilling rig and lots of play money.

name: The Flea Market Game
description:
"Take a trip to the flea market... shop for all of your favorite things."

Players move around a colorful monopoly-style flea market board as they collect items in categories like antiques, clothing, and jewelry. The first player to collect all 6 tokens and fill up their box on the board, wins.

Includes game board, 4 tokens, 8 dice, 24 game pieces, storage insert, and instructions.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Die Story vom Pferd
description:
This game is mainly a "Think: Memo Crime" variation for children.

Players roll a die and move forward a track. As long as they come on an empty field, they take two "word cards" and then tell a story containing those words. After this the cards will be laid down on the track. If you land on a field with such cards you have to retell that story (without looking at the key words). First player at the end of the track wins.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Spartacus: Gladiator Rules
description:
This is a set of free rules to let you fight Gladiator Combat of Ancient Rome.
Players can use paper chits or real miniatures (painted is better) for gladiators and then "move, roll and fight" until death. You can fight battles between 2 gladiators or you can create teams to face each other. The plays goes very well also with 4+ fighters.

Free rules available directly on the designer's website:
http://www.andy.watkins.dsl.pipex.com/wargames/spartacus/spa...
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Frankfurter Fragen
description:
Frankfurter Fragen is a stand-alone extension to "Frankfurt - das Spiel zur Stadt"

It consists of 300 question cards with about 700 questions about Frankfurt trivia. They are printed on both sides, the front being blue with symbols consisting of a short question/answer and the back being red with a more detailed reply.
The front also has special questions and remarks for the original game which do not apply when playing the extension only.

There's 2 ways of playing
1) being the first to collect 10 cards
2) being the first to collect 5 cards with identical symbols on the front

The latter can take ages even if you have some die-hard locals around. It is published in German only as the target lies on natives and newly inhabitants who want to know more about their city.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Grandes Reporteros
description:
"Big reporters"

The information appears in the teletype. Send your reporters to the place of the facts! Be the first one in closing the edition of "El Matutino" (The Morning one")!

... Sport ... politics ... events...

name: No Peekie
description:
From the box:

The only puzzle which gives you the answer first and defies you to accomplish it!

Roll the ball to "START". Close the lid and there on top is the answer! Keep the lid closed and, following the arrows, merely roll the ball from "START" to "FINISH". You have two minutes to do it. FRUSTRATED?? Then take a peek...take as many peeks as you feel necessary. You start with 100 points, and each time you take a peek, it costs you 10 points! If you can't get the ball to "FINISH" within two minutes, you score ZERO. Highest score wins!

name: Vertikado
description:
Content:
64 round wooden sticks, 1 wooden box

The aim of this game of skill is to build a tower out of the round sticks, in order to make as many points as possible with the value of the sticks.

name: Bowl
description: Bowl by Tudor has a dual action pin reset and an automatic Gravity Ball return. You rolled your ball on to a lane with pins that look just like a real bowling alley. The pins are numbered above the pin area so that you know which pins are left standing after a roll. The ball rolls back to you because the back of the pin area is raised a bit to force the ball back to you by gravity. At the end of a frame you push two tabs together to reset the pins. Game comes with a scorepad for keeping score.

name: Woody Woodpecker's Up the Tree Game
description: Object of game: To be the first player to follow Woody Woodpecker to his tree house. Moves made based on spinner result.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Jack Be Nimble
description: To be the first player to place all of his candle pieces on the candle holder and then place the flame on the top of the candle.

name: Titany Icebreaker
description: The Titany is sinking. You have to get your passengers into the lifeboats to save them but the order in which the lifeboat is filled is crucial. Play a card out of order and you'll score minus points. The captain and engineer can increase the capacity of any lifeboat and the baby can be put on board a lifeboat at any time. At some time you have to close the lifeboat to more passengers or risk it tipping over. Game comes with German instructions but cards are language-neutral.

name: Cipher
description:
Cipher - "A New game with Numbers" - "A real contest of wits"

This game uses an acetate scoring area and crayons so that the scoring area can be used repeatedly.

In a two player game one player plays for even numbers and the other player plays for odd numbers. Blocks are turned up and plugged into an evolving equation with numbers of the appropriate odd/even type scored by the appropriate odd/even player.

In a four player game players play two on a team for the odd or even side.

name: Double Game
description: Double Game is a dexterity game in which players score points for fitting balls into the board with a special device.

name: INFO Baseball
description:
"The classic card game that provides fast paced enjoyment for the whole family, from the first card played until the last."

The Red Sox Edition consists of 120 cards, each representing a Red Sox player's batting or pitching record in his best year. Players from throughout the team's history are included [1901 - 1993]. You select players from your hand according to their strengths and weaknesses, and score points by playing a card with the best value in a particular category (i.e. most home runs) of all the cards played."

This game is a baseball themed trick-taking card game with two suits - pitchers and batters. A player leads with a pitcher or batter and declares which of the 5 stats will be compared (ERA, RBI, etc). The card with the best stat takes the trick. Optional rules for a trivia element of gameplay.

name: Film ...ab!
description:
Content:
1 video-cassette with 34 b/w-movie-clips, board, 1 ring, 1 die, 8 writing blocks, 8 pencils,

All players watch a movie clips and write down items with e.g.a "b" in the beginning. After the end of the film clip they read their words and get points for the proper ones.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia, Word Game

name: La Ruta del Quijote
description:
You are Don Quijote de la Mancha, the most famous personage of spanish literature. You must complete a route riddled with adventures and misfortunes and during the trip to pick up the complete equipment for el caballero andante (walking gentleman) ... only by this way you will be ready to face your last battle against the El Caballero de la Blanca Luna (Gentleman of the White Moon).

Content:

- 1 board
- 4 game pieces
- 36 cards
- 1 dice

name: HAZARD
description:
Components
* The Game Board
* 3 Red Playing Pieces
* 3 Yellow Playing Pieces
* 4 Blue 'Bridge' Pieces
* 2 Dice
* And The Game Instructions Leaflet

The game was devised by Charles Foveaux-Kirby, aged 15, who won the "invent a board game" competition organized by the "free time" TV programme, Thames TV in cooperation with Invicta

Objective:
For a player to occupy each of the 3 finish circles using the exact score on each dice thrown.

Just a test edit.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Top 3: Fußball
description:
Which team has won more international cups - Brazil or Argentina? Your task is to put three randomly drawn soccer nations in one of five categories in the correct order. You score points for correct guesses - the less your opponents know, the more you'll score!

"Top3 - Fußball" (= soccer) was released soon after the Nürnberg trade fair in 2008 as one of three card games in a new series of trivia card games made by KOSMOS called "Top3".

The categories are so specific that even players who are very much interested in the given topic (like soccer in this case) probably will not know the correct answers. Instead, every player has to probably go with a best guess answer.

name: Disney Character Story-Boards
description:
Entering the magical world of Disney, spells great fun for the entire family.

Choose your favorite Walt Disney story and complete your very own Story-Board just like the film-makers. Roll the dice, twirl the spinners and watch the characters come to life as they take their position on the board.

Merlin helps with the fun, but watch our for mischievous Tinker Bell as she tries to stop you from becoming the first to play all your cards!
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., Mattel, Inc., Paul Lamond Games Ltd, The Great Games Company

name: White House
description:
In Franz-Benno Delonge's White House, two players fight for the U.S. Presidency. But being elected isn't as easy as it seems, as the other candidate will want to put a negative spin on your campaign at every turn.

A number of cards representing States or groups of States are set up from left-to-right on the table. The final one, of course, is Florida.

Each player holds an identical set of action cards in their hand. These action cards are further divided by colour, indicating the type of action the player will attempt. Possible actions range from complimenting your opponent all the way down to "dirty tricks".

The game is a bluff/counter-bluff game. One card colour counteracts another colour, but is crushed by the third colour. Given that each player begins the game with the exact same cards, a battle of wits and nerves is sure to follow!
