name: Doctor Who Empires
description:
"Dr Who Theme. Various races fight for control of the Galaxy."

The players take control of one of seven races: Earth Empire, Cybermen, Dalkes, Movellans, Sontarans, Rutans, Ice Warriors, Gallifreyans, Great Vampires, or Vardans. Each race has a special ability.

The object of the game is to control all Nexus Points in the galaxy.

Components include a square grid map of the galaxy, a deck of Action Cards tailored to the theme, and sets of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Star Wars Campaign
description:
A game of the galactic conflict between the Rebellion and the Empire, based on the Star Wars saga.

One player controls the Imperial forces and the other player controls the Rebels. The Rebels win by capturing the planet Coruscant, the Emperor, and Darth Vader. The Imperials win if all the Rebel leaders in play are captured.

Components include a space map centered on the planet Coruscant, a deck of Action Cards tailored to the theme, and sets of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Scortch
description:
"Based on the animated film Wizards by Ralph Bakshi. One player is the good Wizard Avatar. The other player is his evil brother Blackwolf. Both battle for world domination. On Avatar’s side is Magic, Elven Races, and Faerie Folk. Blackwolf's armies are filled with Mutants, Demons, and Ancient Technologies."

The Blackwolf player must destroy all opposing units to win, otherwise the Avatar player wins.

Components include a map of the land of Halcionia, two decks of Action Cards (one for each side), and sets of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Dark Sun Empires
description:
A game of fantasy conflict and conquest between the Sorcerer Kings who rule the City States of Athas. Inspired by the Dark Sun campaign setting of Dungeons and Dragons. The object of the game is to destroy all opposing Sorcerer Kings.

Components required to play include a map showing the territories of Athas, a deck of Action Cards tailored to the theme, and unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.

name: Satsuma Rebellion
description:
"Card Game for 2 players. Theme: The Satsuma Rebellion in Japan in 1877. The Modern Imperial Army destroyed the last of the Samurai. One player is the Samurai. The other player is the Imperial Army."

The game uses two custom decks of cards, the Samurai Deck and the Imperial Deck. Each deck contains eight types of cards, each ranked with a Strength value: Force, Reserves, Leader, Attack, Defense, Morale, Weapons, and Escape.

"The game ends when the Samurai player has accumulated 9 Casualty Markers. At that point, the last of the Samurai have been wiped out. Victory is a function of how many casualties the Samurai were able to inflict on the Imperials."

name: Carving Up China
description:
"Bidding game for 3-5 players. Each player is an Imperialist Power in the late Nineteenth Century trying to get a piece of China." Each player plays one of five Imperialist Powers: Britain, France, Germany, Russia, and Japan. Each country has a unique special bonus.

The game is played using two shared card decks - the Territory Deck and the Imperial Deck. The game ends when there are no cards left in the Territory Deck. The winner is the player having the most Victory Points, as determined by the combined point total of the Territory Cards in the player's Victory Pile.

name: Iron Bridge Gorge
description:
Card game for 2-4+ players. Based on the growth of Industry in the Severn Gorge in England at the beginning of the 1700’s, The Birthplace of the Industrial Revolution. Each player is an Ironmaster who controls a company in the region. Players buy cards that represent mines, refineries, factories, and other resources. These resources produce income. Players score Victory points each turn if they are the leader in a certain type of industry. A copy of the rules is available for free at:
http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/IBG.html

name: Arthur Saves the Planet: One Step at a Time
description:
In Arthur Saves the Planet: One Step at a Time, Arthur and his friends & family work together to solve environmental issues threatening his hometown of Elwood City. From littered beaches to endangered tree frogs, from deforested parks to wasted water, the team has its work cut out for it. And ANYONE can help! Pick an Arthur character and collect colored resource cards representing time, expertise, friends, effort and advice.

Arthur Saves the Planet provides a unique and challenging design for children to actually experience the joys of strategic gaming with their parents and friends! Players aged 4 and up must decide whether to move their character to a specific location on the board, or collect another resource card. Never leave your house and you won’t solve any problems, but if you don’t take time to collect resources, such as helpful friends and expert advice, then you’ll never find the right solutions!
categories: Children's Game, Environmental, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Clipper Race
description: Clipper Race is a sailing game published around 1935. Players (2,3,4) use a spinner to determine movement along predefined naval routes. The objective is to sail from: Boston, New York, Philadelphia or New Orleans to Shanghai and then return to one of the USA ports. The player must land exactly on Shanghai and the USA port. Along the way there are spaces that direct the player to go back spaces or sail to a different port before resuming course. Landing on an opponent sends him back 10 spaces. The shorter routes have more penalty spaces. The game comes with 6 beautifully crafted clippers (2 extra) in low relief that are painted in semi reflective paints.

name: Monopoly: Washington, D.C.
description:
This is the officially licensed Washington, D.C., edition of Monopoly. Here you have Monopoly with a twist.

The game includes tokens made to look like a pretzel, heart, Abraham Lincoln, DC Capitol Building, George Washington, and a money bag.

Board Spaces include C&O Canal, Bureau of Engraving, National Zoo, White House, Pentagon, Tidal basin, Dupont Circle, and other local attractions.

Cards include the 4th of July Celebration! All tokens advance to Washington Monument.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ga voor Goud
description:
Trivia game based on the 2008 Beijing Olympics sponsored by Dutch supermarket Plus. It includes a DVD and 15 trivia cards. The other 135 can be collected by shopping at Plus.

Roll the dice, walk the track answer your questions right and steal some medals along the way. Whoever lits the Olympic Flame first ends the game. Winner is the player with the most medal points.

name: Three Tigers Chess
description:
A 2-2 players game based on the Old Chinese Game "Tiger Chess".
A more complex game, with 3 "tigers", and 12 "human".
"human" aim at to capture the tigers, by surrounding the tigers.
"tigers" aim at to eat "human", so that the human cannot capture the tigers.
